pwn: vecik ta kinitjaovalitan noa cong tong a ti Cai ing on toa siiho a podjavadjavai toa kacalisiyan
english: President Tsai Ing-wen's Apology to the Indigenous Peoples on Behalf of the Government.

pwn: toco a qadaw ka sika 22 a cavilj a pitjaisangas, aoza "sanpaw" aya vecik itoa tja kimpo, pinavalitan anga toa " yoncoming" aya tja kangadanan. aico a pinavalitan a seman kangadanan, inika amin a semoalap toa pinakacoan ta sinisan paqeteleng a papongadan, pakeljang anga ota to avan a kacalisiyan a "kaqolidan a kaimazan i taiwan a caocao." toco a qadaw, tjakasimazai a temagilj a pacon, sa tja patjaljiaqayaw anga itjen to tadjekoacan. ori kitjaovalit aken toa siiho, a pasemalaw toa tjaljavavavan a kipaqaljai toa kakazoko anga a kacalisiyan a mapoljat. ori sevalit aken toa siiho, a kipaqaljai a podjavadjavai tjanomon a mapoljat, itoa sitjaisangasan a 400 a cavilj, a masa no kipaola kata inika pinapapamamavan a kilalaing tjanomon.
english: On this day 22 years ago, the term "shanbao" (mountain people) in the Additional Articles of our Constitution was replaced with the proper name: "indigenous people." This correction not only did away with a discriminatory term, but also highlighted the status of indigenous peoples as Taiwan's "original owners." From this basis, today, we are taking another step forward. To all indigenous peoples of Taiwan: On behalf of the government, I express to you our deepest apology. For the four centuries of pain and mistreatment you have endured, I apologize to you on behalf of the government.

pwn: masalo aken, komalji a patje toco, ita tja kinatevteveljan, izoanan a kimapida a caocao a kinemnemnem to sikoda a podjavadjavai ayaya. saka avan aico, a ori ko sitjaljomaza toco a qadaw a kitjaovalit toa siiho a podjavadjavai a kipaqaljai. saka a patjara inika pinapapamamavan, kata kinipaolan noa zoma zoko kasicoayan, izoa sakamayan a namatazoa itoa pinasasevalivalitan noa caocao ayaya a sipaconan, avan a tja sinika imaza a nasaljinga to pavalit to momalj a semangas.
english: I know that even now, there are some around us who see no need to apologize. But that is the most important reason why I am representing the government to issue this apology today. To see what was unfair in the past as a matter of course, or to treat the pain of other ethnic peoples as an unavoidable part of human development, this is the first mindset that we, standing here today, resolve to change and overturn.

pwn: pai ko madjolodjoloaw a ko kai a qivo, a pasemalaw toki anema patarevan noa podjavadjavai toa kacalisiyan. aico a kadjonangan i taiwan, pitjaisangas toa 400 a cavilj izoanga a caocao a kaimazan. aico a marka caocao imaza izoa niamadjo angata a sikaco, a kai, a bongka, a kakodanan, a sikavaljoljotan. pitjavililjanga, mano izoa a tacioran a caocao inika pinosaloan, sa pangtjez a semamaza taico a kadjonangan. saka itoa nacemalivat a likisi
english: Let me put in simple terms why we are apologizing to the indigenous peoples. Four hundred years ago, there were already people living in Taiwan. These first inhabitants lived their lives and had their own languages, cultures, customs, and domains. But then, without their consent, another group of people arrived on these shores, and in the course of history, took everything from the first inhabitants who, on the land they have known most intimately, became displaced, foreign, non-mainstream, and marginalized.

pwn: aico a tjaivililj a nakitevalj a caocao, qavan anga toa nanemanemanga a penoljat a kaimazan a caocao. pai sapakalivoi anga a penolingelingetj tiamadjo a kemasi toa kinatavakan a kadjonangan, saka masan tjeqaljaqalja anga caocao, ini anga ka tiamadjo a malailaing, sinantailj anga a caocao tiamadjo. a namirazek a kinakonian, palemek to liningedjelj a pitoa siselapai noa zoma no zokoan. no ori kipasemalaw tjen to kanangoaqan a tja kokka, tjara tja sanpazangalen aico a tja pinacalivat a likisi, sa tja pasemalavan a paqoliqolid a kinakemodamodan. saka nakoya inika kemasi varong a siiho a kipalikoz toa namayatoco a pinacalivat katjaisangas, pai avan aico a ko sinikalingdjelj toco a qadaw i maza.
english: The success of one ethnic people can be built on the suffering of another. Unless we deny that we are a country of justice, we must face up to this history. We must tell the truth. And then, most importantly, the government must genuinely reflect on this past. This is why I stand here today.

pwn: izoa ita sapitj a pinaka " taiwantongse." ita sangasangasan a kai a takalan, napatjanema a " neka no likisi na se taiwan. se hollanda a caocao a na patagilj, lja ceng a caocao a nakiposengsengan, pinaljavakan na cingtai a nakilalaing," aya. aico a kai, makeljang aravac to sikinemneman noa pairang a caocao. a kakazoko a kacalisiyan, ka pida kozolj a cavilj a pitjaisangas, imaza anga tosa kadjonangan, izoanga a martimaljimalji a natemalido a bongka kata povarongan, saka pazorozorong a pinasasevalivalitan anga. ljakoa, a tja sivecikan toa likisi, tja sinikilaing toa tjapopicol a naqemizing a zoko. pai masa mavan aico, tjaljo maza ken a kitjaovalit toa siiho a podjavadjavai toa kakazoko a kacalisiyan.
english: There is a book called "The General History of Taiwan" published in 1920. In its foreword are these words: "Taiwan had no history. The Dutch pioneered it, the Koxinga Kingdom built it, and the Qing Empire managed it." This is a typical Han view of history. The truth is that indigenous peoples have been here for thousands of years, with rich culture and wisdom that have been passed down through generations. But we only know to write history from the perspective of the dominant. For this, I apologize to the indigenous peoples on behalf of the government.

pwn: a sivitai na hollanda kata pinaljavakan ni ceng-ceng- kong napapacai toa tjorovo a pingpo zoko a caocao, sa qavi tiamadjo toa sikavaljoaljot; a pinaljavakan na cingcao izoa kodral aravac a maqaqeciqeci kata paselapai; a pinaljavakan noa zipon na penolinglingetj a kemaljaqolidan angata a pavalit a seman caocao niamadjo, patja toco a pitjaivililj anga toa maqaqeci, kamayan a conghoaminko a pori seman pairang ta kacalisiyan. aico a 400 a cavilj, a nasemamaza anga i taiwan a paljavak a marka siiho, nasema picol a lemivo, naqemav toa kadjonangan, a semavota a papeneka toa kaniamadjoan a mangoaqan a kacalisiyan. pai masa mavan aico, tjaljo maza ken a kitjaovalit toa siiho a podjavadjavai toa kacalisiyan.
english: The Dutch and the Koxinga Kingdom massacred and exploited the Pingpu ethnic group. The Qing Empire presided over bloody confrontations and suppression. Colonial Japan put in place comprehensive savage policies. And the post- war ROC government undertook assimilation policies. For 400 years, every regime that has come to Taiwan has brutally violated the rights of indigenous peoples through armed invasion and land seizure. For this, I apologize to the indigenous peoples on behalf of the government.

pwn: a kacalisiyan sikilailaing toa kakodan a pakaizoa toa marasodjan noa taqaljaqaljan, saka izoa kemasi sicoayan a povarongan madjadjalo katoa nanemanemangan i kacaoan. ljakoa, toco a liningedjelj a venaqoan a kakodanan noa kokka, neka anga no picol noa kacalisiyan a kisomadjo a kipenetj toa patjara niamadjo a sengsengan, neka anga no picol a kisomadjo a kilalaing toa taqaljaqaljan. namaceperak anga sicoayan a sirasodjan ta qinaljan, sa inika sinomavan tiamadjo na vaqoan a pinaka minsio a sirasodjan. pai masa mavan aico, tjaljo maza ken a kitjaovalit toa siiho a podjavadjavai toa kacalisiyan.
english: Indigenous peoples maintain tribal order according to traditional customs, and ecological balance according to traditional wisdom. But in the process of modern state-building, indigenous peoples lost the right to steer their own course and govern their own affairs. The fabric of traditional societies was torn apart, and the collective rights of peoples were not recognized. For this, I apologize to the indigenous peoples on behalf of the government.

pwn: a kacalisiyan tjara izoazoa a kai niamadjo a paqolid, ka cemalivat to zipon a napaljavak a pinnetj to masa kipalaing to pavalit a seman caocao niamadjo; ka pitjaivililj ta 1945 a cavilj, ljemaini anga a siiho a qivo toa kai a kinacalisian, avan a sika patjaseqazaqazalj anga a maolaw na kai noa kacalisiyan.pai sa namaqolip anga a mareka kai noa se pingpo zoko. a namasasevalivalit a siiho, inika nakisasoso toa kakodan toa bongka noa kacalisiyan, pai masa mavan aico, tjaljo maza ken a kitjaovalit toa siiho a podjavadjavai toa kacalisiyan.
english: Indigenous peoples had their own languages. However, with Japanese rule aiming to assimilate and turn all into imperial subjects, and with the ROC government banning tribal languages after 1945, indigenous peoples' languages suffered great losses. Most Pingpu languages have disappeared. Successive governments have been negligent in the protection of indigenous cultures. For this, I apologize to the indigenous peoples on behalf of the government.

pwn: pai tazoa cavilj, ka inika kemljakeljang a yami zoko, pasazoain i lanyo na siiho azoa paljiq na dingki. sa kipaolaola a marka taqaljaqaljan i lanyo. pai masa mavan aico, tjaljo maza ken a kitjaovalit toa siiho a podjavadjavai toa yami zoko a caocao.
english: Without the knowledge of the Yami tribe, the government stored nuclear waste on Orchid Island. Tribe members on the island had to suffer the negative consequences. For this, I apologize to the Yami people on behalf of the government.

pwn: ka patagilj a saqomaqanen a i taiwan noa kasicasaw a zoma a caocao, avan a i kazatjazatja i pasakaledep a pingpo zoko a sangasan a kicevongan. a namasasevalivalit anga a nazemang, qinolip anga a ngadan noa caocao kata kinazokoan noa se pingpo. pai masa mavan aico, tjaljo maza ken a kitjaovalit toa siiho a podjavadjavai toa pingpo zoko.
english: Ever since outsiders began arriving in Taiwan, the Pingpu ethnic group on the western plains have born the brunt of the impact. One ruling power after another eroded the individual and collective identities of the Pingpu ethnic group. For this, I apologize to the Pingpu ethnic group on behalf of the government.

pwn: a pitjaivililj toa kinamapavalitan a masan minsio, natemvela a kokka toa kiqaong noa kacalisiyan. sa izoa siniljaoi noa siiho, izoa anga ota kinisamoljan a kedri. toco a qadaw, izoa anga a namasan qapolo holic na kacalisiyan a pinaka " yoncomin cipenva." ljakoa, aico a holic, inika sinan pazangal noa marka kisasosososo itoa siiho, gemaljo anga a lingedjeljen, inika namakakaizoazoa, inika namaqacovong. pai masa mavan aico, tjaljo maza ken a kitjaovalit toa siiho a podjavadjavai toa kacalisiyan.
english: After the democratic transition, the country began to respond to the appeals of indigenous movements. The government made certain promises and efforts. Today, we have an Indigenous Peoples Basic Law that is quite advanced. However, government agencies have not given sufficient weight to this law. Our actions have not been fast enough, comprehensive enough or sound enough. For this, I apologize to the indigenous peoples on behalf of the government.

pwn: aico a i taiwan pinaka kinatevteveljan a siakai noa "namapakakaizoazoa a bongka," ljakoa, patje toco a qadaw, aico a pitoa tarivakan na kinacavacavan, pitoa sikitoloan, pitoa sikavaljoaljot a kizai, a pitoa sikicapiljan toa siizi na kacalisiyan, namacacadja anan aravac katoa inika kacalisiyan a caocao i taiwan. a sipaconan a seman kacalisiyan, a sisanpavalan, kamayan a izoa a patje toco. Inika namadjaljon a kinodanan noa siiho, avan no sika nacemavolid sakamayan a kacalisiyan toa siselapai kata kipaola a inika kinljang noa pairang. pai masa mavan aico, tjaljo maza ken a kitjaovalit toa siiho a podjavadjavai toa kacalisiyan.
english: Taiwan is known as a culturally diverse society. But even today, indicators on health, education, economic livelihood, political participation and more still show gaps between indigenous and non- indigenous peoples. Meanwhile, stereotypes and even discrimination against indigenous peoples have not gone away. The government has not done enough, so indigenous peoples have suffered pain and frustration unknown to other ethnic peoples. For this, I apologize to the indigenous peoples on behalf of the government.

pwn: inika qacovong a kisamolja na siiho, saka inika nakemljang a kirimo a siiho to inika qacovong a kisamolja, avan a sika kamayan a no siselapai a patje toco. djavadjavai a paqolid. a ko podjavadjavai toco a qadaw, oi to gemaljo anga aravac, ljakoa ki namasan patagilj aico. Inika ken a nakikaljava to ori masa mavan aico a pinoitan a vincikan, a kai a podjavadjavai, saka ori masan neka anga a no cinavolid a kipaola a no piqai i varong a kacalisiyan. ljakoa, nasaljinga aken a paqolid, to aico a ko podjavadjavai toco a qadaw, ori maqati a masan tagilj noa madjadjalodjalo na taqaljaqaljan a mapoljat i maza itoa tja koni.
english: Our efforts have fallen short, and succeeding generations have been blind to this inadequacy. Because of this, your hardship has continued to this day. For this we are truly sorry. Today's apology is long overdue, but it is a beginning. I do not expect any one speech or phrase of apology to wipe away four centuries of pain and suffering by the indigenous peoples. But I do hope with all my heart that today's apology will set this country and all its people on the path towards reconciliation.

pwn: ori paka toa caqoan aken noa kacalisiyan, a pasemalaw toa tja kinatevteveljan toco a qadaw. a kai noa se tayal zoko, "balay" aya toa kaqolidan. sbalay aya qivo toa maljaljengoangoaq," no pazoljoan a balay a pitjaiqayaw toa s a vicik. a kaqolidan kata madjadjalo, izoa kakacapilj a mamaw. no tja siomalj a qivo, a kaqolidan a madjadjalodjalo, amin no nakemasi varong itjen a kiljaqolid a kemljang toa kaqolidan a tja pinacalivat, mavan a ori namaqacovong.
english: Please allow me to shed light on this occasion with a piece of indigenous wisdom. In the Atayal language, truth is called "Balay," and reconciliation is called "Sbalay," so you simply add an "S" sound to "Balay." Truth and reconciliation are in fact two related concepts. In other words, only by facing the truth sincerely can reconciliation be attained.

pwn: itoa kakodan noa kacalisiyan, no izoa sepasaliw toa zoma caocao i qinaljan, saka nasaljinga toa kidjadjaloan, papecevongen noa volovolong azoa napasaliw kata pinasalivan a caocao. no maqepo anga tiamadjo, a inika avan a podjavadjavai ta kai a sisangas, avan a kemasi varong a macidicidilj a caocao, sa pasemalaw toa pinacalivat a kipaola niamadjo. no napasemalaw anga toa paqoliqolid a pinacalivatan, pai malap anga a volovolong toa i koppo sa kitekel anga toa timaimangan, pai a sicoayan anga, pacalivaten anga a paqolid. aico avan a paqolid a pinaka sbalay.
english: In indigenous cultures, when a tribe member has offended another and intends to reconcile, an elder brings together the offender and the offended - not to produce a direct apology, but to allow each side to frankly share their inner journeys. When this truth-telling concludes, the elder calls for everyone to drink together, so that what is past is truly past. This is "Sbalay."

pwn: a ko kikaljava toa tja kinatevteveljan toco a qadaw, mavan a sbalay noa siiho kata kacalisiyan. napapoljat aken toa ko picol, toa ko kinljang a pasemalaw toa pinasalisalivan noa siiho ka tjaisangas. no saoni tjara pasemalaw a tja qali a kacalisiyan toa vinarongan niamadjo. inika ken a temoro a qiqaong toa no sipazekatj toco i maza, ljakoa, kiqaong aken tjanomon to naseman pozangalan mon, to tjara ini anga ka ori momalj a mapacon a mamaw a pinasalivan ka sicoayan, saka aico a tja kokka, tjara izoa to ita a qadaw, to maqati a kemaljaqolidan a madjadjalodjalo.
english: I hope today's occasion can be a "Sbalay" between the government and the indigenous peoples. I have spoken of past mistakes and truths the best I can, with nothing held back. In a moment, our indigenous friends will speak. I do not dare ask you to forgive, here and now. But I sincerely ask you to sustain the hope that past wrongs will not be repeated, and that one day, this country can see true reconciliation.

pwn: toco a qadaw namasan tagilj sakamaya, a posikining toa madjadjalodjalo inika kacalisiyan katoa pingpo a caocao, avan a siiho. kemljang aken to inika qacovong a sema kai sakamaya a podjavadjavai, amin a sinan sengsengan a pitjaivililj na siiho a masa kacalisiyan, avan a ori sikakeljang to ori madjadjalodjalo a tja kokka a paqolid toki ini.
english: Today is only a beginning. The duty for reconciliation lies not with the indigenous peoples and the Pingpu ethnic group, but with the government. I know that words of apology alone are not enough. What we actually do for the indigenous peoples will decide whether reconciliation succeeds or stumbles.

pwn: ori tjaljomaza ken a pasemalaw, a i toa ko kinaizoanan a congtongvo, ori pakaizoa ken toa " kinateveteveljan a kisan ljemengoaq a pacikel toa namapaqolid a likisi kata kisan pacikel toa kamangoaq a paqolid noa marka kacalisiyan." ori pakatoa ngadan aken noa tjaljavavavan malailaing noa tja koni, a kisan volovolong taico a kinateveteveljan. sa ko kisaseljang toa sinkaoljan noa kakazoko a caocao, a kisamolja paseljengoaq toa likisi, a napapamamaw ota a marasodj toa ori kisamoljain a pitjaivililj naico a kokka.
english: Therefore, I am here to announce that we are setting up an Indigenous Historical Justice and Transitional Justice Commission under the Presidential Office. As the head of state, I will serve as convener and work hand in hand with tribal representatives to pursue historical justice. We will also discuss, on the basis of equality, the future policy direction of this country.

pwn: ori paljaloay aken to, a tjaljavavavan toa sinan pazangal noa kinateveteveljan itoa congtongvo, avan a papamamaw toa qiniladjan noa kacalisiyan kata kokka. a pinaparangezan noa kakazoko, a patjelja pingpo zoko, tjara mavan a rasorasodjan noa taqinaljanan a ori kasizoanan. aico a sinan djalan, ori masan tineveteveljan anga toa vinarongan noa kakazoko a kacalisiyan, saka ori masan kakasizoan a kemljang toa varong noa kacalisiyan a mapoljat.
english: I want to stress that this commission places the greatest importance on equality between the country and the indigenous peoples. The election of tribal representatives, including for the Pingpu ethnic group, will take as basis the consensus of peoples and tribes. This commission will serve as a mechanism for collective decision-making by indigenous peoples, and will ensure that the voices of tribe members find true expression.

pwn: izoa zoma anga, ori pazazekatj aken toa sincenyon to pennetj a pakaizoa toa " kinateveteveljan noa kisan papezangal toa namasan qapolo a kakodan na kacalisiyan." pai azoa pinaka izoa a sengsengan imaza, ori mavan anga a pasosoan noa siiho, sa masan kasizoangan noa tjaljavavavan a kinatevteveljan no marasodj a kiposengsengan toa sengsengan noa kacalisiyan. pai aico a sengesengan izoa pakatoa kipakim a pacekel toa likisi, papirazek toa kisomadjo a zemang toa qinaljan a kacalisiyan, papamamaw a kisaseljang toa kizai, sikitoloan kata pazorong a bongka, paljakev ta nasoljivatj a kinacavacavan, kata paljakev ta mangoaqan noa i pairairang anga a kacalisiyan....
english: In addition, I will request that our Executive Yuan convene regularly the Indigenous Peoples Basic Law Promotion Committee, and use the Yuan's authority to coordinate and handle matters related to any consensus reached by the above-mentioned commission. These matters include the following: to retrieve historical memories, to promote indigenous self-government, to seek fair economic development, to ensure continuation of culture and education, to safeguard indigenous health, and to protect the rights of urban indigenous peoples, etc.

pwn: no izoa sikamartimaljian noa kakodan na kacalisiyan katoa sitocoan a holic, ori pazazekatj aken toa sincenyon to pakaizoa toa " kinateveteveljan a kisan posaladj toa kacalisiyan a pakatoa holic," sa pakatoa nangoaq a rasodjan a papekedri toa macacogecog katoa rivorivoan noa siiho katoa kacalisiyan.
english: Where modern laws and indigenous traditional cultures are at odds, we will set up an Indigenous Legal Service Center with a high degree of cultural sensitivity, to reduce through institutional design the growing clashes between indigenous customs and modern laws.

pwn: tjara men a pazazekatj toa izoa a kiposengsengsengan itoa siiho to pakirimo a seman vecik toa patjara kakodan noa kacalisiyan a qemaljop toa inika sinikaqilji noa holic a qemoziqozip, sa djameqi tiamadjo a seman pasaliw a remosong. aico a namayatoco, tjara men a kinemenem toa sikamasoqadjayan a djalan.
english: I will ask the relevant agencies to immediately pull together cases in which indigenous community members have been indicted or sentenced for hunting, where the hunting was done in accordance with traditional customs, on traditional lands, and for non-transactional needs, and where the animals hunted were not protected by conservation laws. For such cases we will deliberate solutions.

pwn: ori pazazekatj aken toa marka kicapicapilj, to pasemalaw to namakoda angata a pinnetjan a seman papadjengan ta paljiq na dingki toa i lanyo. sa pavai a siiho toa nasedjaljep a valet toa yami zoko, a pitjaisangas toa semoalap taico a paljiq izoa.
english: I will also direct relevant agencies to present an investigative report on the decision-making process of nuclear waste storage on Orchid Island. Before finding a permanent solution for the nuclear waste, we will provide the Yami tribe appropriate compensation.

pwn: pai toco, masa tja paseljang toa kisanpazangal a kimadjo noa pingpo zoko katoa kipakeljang toa kinaqatian niamadjo, pai a pitjaisangas toa sika 30 a qadaw nosika 9 qiljas toco a cavilj, ori maljavar a siiho to pinnetj ta holic, saka maqati a mapacikel a niamadjo angata a kamangoaq katoa kinapingpo zokoan.
english: At the same time, under the principle of respecting the Pingpu ethnic group's self- identity, and recognizing their identity, we will examine relevant laws before September 30 of this year, so that Pingpu ethnic group identity will receive the rights and status it deserves.

pwn: no sika 1 a qadaw toa sika 11 qiljas toco a cavilj, ori povecik amen a pokeljang, sa nia pasemalaw toa patje inoino angata a kadjonangan noa kacalisiyan a kemasicoai. papezangazangal anga men to masan hozing itoa holic a taqinaljanaljanan,, saka no tjaivililj, a saljingan to kisomadjo a paljavak na kacalisiyan, tjara mapasoso a maitaita. ori papedjaljaw amen toa nia sidjekoacan, sa nia satjezi a kirimo a pasa toa lip-po-ing a sinanpazangal aravac na kacalisiyan a "vecik toa sipaljavakan a kisomadjo na kacalisiyan," " vecik toa kadjonangan katoa ljavek na kacalisiyan," "vecik toa sipapirazekan toa kai na kacalisiyan," sa lingdjelji a seman holic.
english: On November 1 of this year, we will begin to delineate and announce indigenous traditional territories and lands. The system of tribal public corporation is already in place. In the future, the ideals of indigenous self-government will be realized step by step. We will step up the pace and submit for legislative deliberation three laws of great importance to indigenous peoples: the Indigenous Peoples Self-Government Law, the Indigenous Peoples Land and Sea Areas Law, and the Indigenous Languages Development Law.

pwn: no masokecengelj toco a qadaw, ori kaigi amen toa patjara sengsengan noa kakazoko a kacalisiyan. i maza ita kakaigian, ori masan tjaliaw aravac a pasemalaw toa ori kiposengsenganen noa siiho. a pitjaivililj, no djemaljon a sika 1 a qadaw toa sika 8 a qiljas a ljemita to cavilj, tjara pasemalaw a sing- ceng-yon to patje inoino anga a kiniposengsengan toa patjara paseljengoaq toa likisi kata pasata mangoaqan noa marka kacalisiyan. saka aico a kemalja pacikelan toa kaqolidan a likisi na kacalisiyan, a patjara pakaizoa toa kisomadjo a remasodj na kacalisiyan, avan a masantjelolj a pinnetj noa siiho to kakisamoljain a padjaljon.
english: Later this afternoon, we will convene a national indigenous peoples administrative meeting. In that meeting, the government will elaborate on the policies. On every August 1 to come, the Executive Yuan will report to the indigenous peoples our progress on restoring historical justice and transitional justice. To implement the Indigenous Peoples Basic Law, to serve indigenous historical justice, and to lay the foundation for indigenous self- government - these are the three major goals for the government's policy towards indigenous peoples.

pwn: a marka kacalisiyan, a i maza, a pacocon toa tilivi katoa itelnik a taqaljaqaljan a marka ko qalialian a kacalisiyan a mapoljat, pai timonai a kisan ropasekeljakeljang. a no sinika i maza, ko djinaolj mon to posaladj a zemazaw, inika mavan a ori hosiio. timon a marka ko sikataqaljan zangalo a pakipapaolingaw, a temolo, olja namakapasoso a siiho toa sinikieces, sa kiomalj a paqolid toa sicoayan a pasalisaliw.
english: To all of our indigenous friends here and watching on TV and online: I invite you to stand witness. I invite you not to endorse, but to oversee. Please keep pressure on the government and right its course where necessary, so that it will realize its commitments and right historical wrongs.

pwn: masalo aken toa marka ko qali a kacalisiyan a mapoljat, timon a napakipapaolingaw toa caocao a mapoljat i itoa tja kokka, a no djekap taico a kadjonangan, kata no kakodanan a kemasi sicoayan, inika maqati a pasevalitan toa nanemanga. a kinamasan pazangal naico a penoljat, nakoya tjara tjasan tjaljavavavan a paqolid.
english: I want to thank all of our indigenous friends. You remind everyone in this country that there is irreplaceable value in the land we tread on and the traditions we inherit. This value deserves dignity.

pwn: no tjaivililj, tjara men a pakatoa seman sengsengan na siiho a zemorong ta kakodanan na kacalisiyan, saka a tjaivilivililj anga noa kacalisiyan, a namasasevalivalit anga a kacalisiyan, kata kakazoko anga a mapoljat imaza ita kadjonangan i taiwan, sa inianga kamasokai, inianga ka ori masopaqenetjan, sa ini angaka ori seqalja a kacalisiyan toa kakodanan niamadjo, ini anga ori seljaljiak itoa kadjonangan niamadjo.
english: In the future, we will push for policies to ensure that succeeding generations of indigenous tribes and all ethnic peoples in Taiwan never lose their languages and memories, that they are never separated from their cultural traditions, and that never again are they lost in a land of their own.

pwn: kiqaong aken to meseljaseljang a kisamolja a mapoljat, tjakeljangaw a tja likisi, tjakeljangaw a tja kadjonangan, tjakeljangaw ota a martimaljimalji a tja kakodan a kakazoko. sa tje pasa toa namadjadjalodjalo, pasa toa mamamaw a tja kinavaljotan kata tja kinamirazekan, a pasa toa vaqoan a tja djalan a taiwan no tjaivililj.
english: I call upon our entire society to come together and get to know our history, get to know our land, and get to know the cultures of our many ethnic peoples. Let us work towards reconciliation, a shared existence and shared prosperity, and a new future for Taiwan.

pwn: kiqaong aken toa taqaljaqaljan a mapoljat, kemasi toco a qadaw, kisamoljai a lemingdjelj toa kanangoaqan a kokka, a qolidan a izoa namakakaizoazoa a kinakemodamodan, saka namapapamamaw a kakodan a kokka.
english: I call upon all citizens to seize the opportunities offered by this day - to join together, work hard, and build a country of justice, a country of true diversity and equality.

pwn: bolabolay mon a mapoljat. toco a qadaw ori temolo a sinsi tjanomon toa anemaya a sepayoan a caocao no qivo toa kakesain.

pwn: sopo anga a poita. papezangalo anan.

izoa i Kasoga a nia qinaljan.

pwn: cemdas anga a qadaw, macoljo a ravac a qadaw.

pwn: namakoda a i tjanomon a kalevelevan?

pwn: vocelelj a kalevalevan, kavao a pakaliyaw.

pwn: 30 aico a tacavo a aljo, izoa anan a zoma ori so veli?
english: $30 for the cookies, anything else you need?

pwn: maqati aken a kisedjam toa so ginpiya?
english: Can I borrow money from you?
Yes! How much do you need?

pwn: namadraodraw aken a masi ginpiya, maqadi aken a kisedjam tjanoson?
english: I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

pwn: inika ken a nakemaco toa ginpiya ota!
english: I don't have any money either!

pwn: namadraodraw aken a kemaco toa ginpiya, maqadi aken a kisedjam tjanoson?
english: I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

pwn: ini, katjaisangas a so kinisedjam tjanoaken a ginpiya inianan ka so pacikeli.
english: No, you haven't paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

pwn: maqati aken a kisedjam toa so kava?
maqadi aken a kisedjam toa so sapitj?
pasedjaman tjanoaken a so zidinsia oii?
english: Can I borrow your bicycle, please?
Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

pwn: qemodjalj anga, inika ken a nakemaco toa kaosoa, maqati aken a so pasedjaman?
english: It's raining, I don't have an umbrella, can you lend me one?

pwn: ita a ko kaosoa, pai kadjadjalain a kiljaong!
english: I only have an umbrella, let's stick together!

pwn: aico a ko kinisedjam tjanoson ka tjaisangas a sapitj, ko pacikelaw tjanoson.
english: This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

pwn: no sapacon anan son ta anema a sapitj pasemalavi anga ken.
english: You can tell me what else you want to read.

pwn: nomakodakoda a ori ko sipacikelan ta kinpiya tjanoson?
english: When do I have to pay you back?
It doesn't matter, you can talk about it when you have money.
When are you going to pay me back?

pwn: ko so kiamai anga son notiyaw.
english: I will return it to you tomorrow.

pwn: nongida anga ori so pacikelen ako sapitj?
english: When are you going to return my book?

pwn: mato ko pinacikel anga ka tiyaw?
english: Didn't I return it to you yesterday?

pwn: aico a kinpic sinipasedjam ni Koliw tjanoson?
english: Did Kuliw lend you this pen?

pwn: oii, ko kinisedjam tjaimadjo toco a qadaw.
english: Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

pwn: aico a inpic so kinisedjam tjai Koliw?
english: Did you borrow this pen from Kuliw?
No, this is what mom bought.

pwn: neka anga no qatiya, sao kisedjamo tjai Umi.
english: We're out of salt, let's go borrow some from Umi.

pwn: sao qaqivo ti Umi to pacikel ta kinisedjam a kinpiya tjanoaken.
english: Go tell Umi to give me back my money.
How much does she owe you?

pwn: ori vaik aken a sema poljacengan a temalem ta ljaceng.
english: I'm going to plant vegetables in the garden.

pwn: pocemel anga ravac, semocemecemel aken, ori pozaljom anan nosaoni.
english: There's too much grass, I'm cutting it, I'll have to water it later.

pwn: maqati son a posaladj tjanoaken a malap ta tjakit kata capelai?
english: Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?
Put it next to the plow rake.
Did you turn over the soil?

pwn: ko vinliqad anga qipo tasaoni, ori tja tjogotan nosaoni.
english: I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

pwn: maqati anga a tjakiljaceng a so talem a ljaceng?
english: Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

pwn: maqati anga kiljacengen a kanran, azoa ljaqacai inianan kamaqati a kiljacengen.
english: The cabbage here is ready to be harvested, but the Showa grass there is not yet ready to be harvested.

pwn: waw! liyaw aravac a so kinivorasi.
english: Wow! You dug up so many gourds.

pwn: maqati a so posaladjan aken a pasa kobaw?
english: Will you help me with the barn?

pwn: poaraarai amen to djemameq ta ciqaw.
english: We're releasing fishing nets to catch fish.

pwn: liyaw angaravac a ciqaw i poror.
english: The fish basket has been full of fish.
How do you usually catch fish?

pwn: avan a voloq a ko sivoloq taciqaw.
english: I shoot fish with a spear.

pwn: saigo son a penanaq a qemaljop?
english: Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?

pwn: tjaliyaw a podringai aken a qemaljop, noremaketjan ota izoa no masi koang masi vato aken.
english: I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.
This is the road the boar took.

pwn: aico djokap noa vavoi, pai aico avan a djaladjalan noa vavoi.
english: These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

pwn: ari kadjaljavi a vaik a pacon toa tja dringai, mato nadjemameq anga toa sacemel.
english: Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.

pwn: mato semqoseqo anga a vato, ari vaiki a kirimo.
english: The dog seems to have smelled it. Let's follow them.

pwn: aico qezetj co a podringai, sidjamdjameq toa kolavaw.
english: This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.
What is that thing you put there?

pwn: seloc toa kola azoa dringai, avan a nia sidjamedjameq toa takec.
english: It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

pwn: maleva itjen tapagaogaw noa naqemati, liayaw a tja djinameq a sacemel toco a qadaw.
english: Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

pwn: oii lja! tjakacoaw a semaqinaljan satja kaqepoqepoan!
english: Yeah! Let's take it back to the tribe and share it!

pwn: toco a qadaw ori temolo a ken tjano itjen to anemaya ikai a sepaiwan ta qemoziqozip.
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in Paiwan language today.

pwn: toco a qadaw ori temolo a ken tjanoitjen to anemaya ikai a sepaiwan ta kodamono.
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in Paiwan language today.

pwn: ini, ni aljoy co a itong.
sinsi, neka nakemaco a ken ta sapitj.
english: Teacher, I didn't bring my textbook.

pwn: meseljango a pacon katoa so ljaqedi a salasaladj.
english: Share the book with your classmate next to you.

pwn: ko si pasedjaman tja no son a ko siqoliqolip.
english: I will lend you my eraser.

pwn: ori patjezoa nga men ta kitolo, kipapaolingavo anga ta djalan no sematjomaq.
english: It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.

pwn: ori patjezoa anga tjen ta kitolo aiyanga mapoljat.
english: The class is over, goodbye everyone.

pwn: nangoangoaq mon a mapoljat, ti piya a ko ngadan.
english: Hello everyone, my name is piya.

pwn: djavadgavay a mapoljat, ti lolji a ko ngadan.
english: Hello everyone, my name is lulji.

pwn: nangoangoaq son piya, ti kapi a ken.
nangoangoaq son, ti lolji a ken.
nangoangoaq son lolji, ti kapi a ken.
tiaken kina ni koliw ti tjoko a ken.
tiaken kaka a tjaljaljak a vavayan, ni koliw ti aljoi a ko ngadan.
english: I am kuliw's sister. My name is aljui.

pwn: ko sinsi timadjo, ti sakino timadjo.
ko kaka tjavolong a oqaljay timadjo timadjo ti camak.
tima ngadan na so kaka tjavolong a vavayan?
english: What is your elder sister's name?

pwn: ti moni a ngadan na ko kaka tjavolong a vavayan.
english: My elder sister's name is muni.

pwn: tima ngadan na so kaka tjaljaljak a vavayan?
english: What is your younger sister's name?

pwn: ti vais a ngadan na ko kaka tjaljaljak a vavayan.
english: My younger sister's name is vais.

pwn: pida nga cavilj na so kaka tjavolong a oqaljay toco?
english: How old is your elder brother?

pwn: tapoloq sa lima anga cavilj nimadjo toco.
pida nga cavilj na so kaka tjaljaljak a oqaljay toco?
english: How old is your younger brother?
Do you have schools in your community?

pwn: kitolotolo son itoa no qinaljan a gakko?
english: Do you study in your tribe's school?

pwn: oi, no i gakko amen a kitolotolo namaya men ta tacemekeljan.
english: Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.

pwn: ko kaka tjavolong a vavayan timadjo.
ko kaka tjaljaljak a oqaljay timadjo.
so kaka tjaljaljak a oqaljay timadjo?
ini, na ko kaka tjaljaljak a oqaljay a qali timadjo.
english: No, he is my younger brother's friend.

pwn: so kaka tjavolong a vavayan timadjo?
ini, ko kaka tjaljaljak a vavayan timadjo.
english: No, she is my younger sister.
How many people in their family?
There are five people in their family.

pwn: mapida a kakedriyan? ita no kinacemekeljan
english: How many children in your family?
There are four children in our family.

pwn: mapida so kaka tjaljaljak a vavayan kata oqaljai?
english: How many younger siblings do you have?

pwn: neka no ko kaka a tjaljaljak a oqaljay, izoa matjelo a ko kaka tjaljaljak a vavayan.
english: I don't have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.

pwn: izoa mapida so sirovetjek a oqaljay kata vavayan?
english: How many older siblings do you have?

pwn: neka ko kaka tjavolong a oqaljay ata kaka a vavayan.
english: I don't have any older siblings.
How many siblings do you have?

pwn: oi, ko kaka tjavolong a oqaljay timadjo.
sepaiwan zoko a caocao timadjo ota?
oi, sepaiwan a caocao ota timadjo.
na makoda kinaqadavan toco a qadaw?
na vocelelj a pagaljo a kinaqadavan no paka liyaw a temekel ta macoljocoljo a zaljom.
english: It's a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

pwn: macoljo a pagaljo a kinaqadavan no paka liyaw a temekel ta zaljom.
english: It's a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.

pwn: maqadaw aravac a qadaw, paqenetjo ta kiljaljaong.
english: The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.

pwn: liyaw a qerepos, neka no qadaw i kalevelevan.
english: There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

pwn: inika maqadaw no tiyaw, liyaw a qerepos, qaca vali.
english: It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.

pwn: na makoda kinaqadavan ta zoa qadaw?
english: How was the weather that day?

pwn: toco a qadaw, na vocelelj no macasaw kavao a paka liyaw ta kava.
english: It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.

pwn: na namakoda kinaqadavan no kalja polavayan?
english: How's the weather on the weekend?

pwn: sarongoaq aravac a kinaqadavan no kalja polavayan.
english: It will be sunny on the weekend.
Will it be rainy that day?

pwn: tazoa bolay a kinaqadavan inika ori qemodjalj.
english: It will have no rain and be sunny that day.
Yes, it will be rainy that day.
The rain stops and the sun comes out.

pwn: qemodjalj anga, ini aken a na kemaco ta ljinay.
english: It is raining and I don't have an umbrella with me.

pwn: inika qemodjaqogjalj toco no pasovililj to cengelj, ori qemodjalj kaco anga ta ljinay no macasaw.
english: It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.

pwn: no icavilj ori ljaljeqel no kaljaljeqelan?
english: Will it be very cold in winter next year?

pwn: oi, no icavilj ori vocelelj no kaljaljeqelan kavao anga paka liyaw.
english: Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

pwn: toco a cavilj ori macoljo no kaljacoljoan?
english: Will it be very hot in summer this year?

pwn: oi, macoljo aravac no kaljacoljoan, tekelo anga paka liyaw ta zaljom.
english: Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

pwn: tjengelay aken ta kaljavovoan, sarongoaq aravac a kinaqadavan.
english: I like spring because the weather is warm.

pwn: inika ken a tjengelay ta kaljaoragan liyaw aravac a boho no kaljaoragan.
english: I don't like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.

pwn: madraodraw anga ken a kemaco ta sapitj.
english: I forgot to bring the textbook.

pwn: kiseljang aken tjano son a pacon.
english: I will share it with you.

pwn: madraodraw anga ken a kemaco ta siqoliqolip.
english: I forgot to bring the eraser.

pwn: madraodraw anga son a kemaco ta sivecivecik?
english: Do you forget to bring your pen?

pwn: paqolid, pasedjam aken ta so sivecivecik? maqati?
english: Yes, can you lend me a pen?

pwn: anema so kanen ta son cengelj?
english: What would you like for lunch?

pwn: ori keman a ken ta minpaw.

english: What would you like for dinner?
What did you have for breakfast?

pwn: na keman anga ken ta qecilo.

english: What did you have for lunch?

pwn: na keman anga ken ta koka.
vaik amen a tjemadrek ta bolo.
vaivaiko, ko karimao anga son no saoni.
english: You go first and I will catch up later.

pwn: vaik amen a kivangavang ta bolo.
nakoya, vaiki a nan a men a semakoc ta sapitj.
english: No, we have to carry books first.

pwn: na gemisagis anga son ta aljis?
nekanan semenasenaw a ken ta tjapaq.
english: Not yet. I am doing the dishes.
Did you rinse out your mouth?
Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.

pwn: na semenaw anga son ta tjapaq?
ako son a inika na pilima?
english: Why didn't you wash your hands?
I will wash my hands later.
What were you doing just now?

pwn: na vaik a ken a karim ta sinsi.
english: I went to meet the teacher.

pwn: anema son kodain no patjezo i kakitolo?
english: What are you going to do after school?

pwn: ori poarot a ken a tjomaq.
ori kemoda timadjo no paotez a kitolo?
english: What is she doing after school?
She is going to go dancing.

pwn: neka ti kivi! itjomaq ti moni aken izoa anema kodain? ko kikai anga ti kivi. no mangetjez
english: kivi is not at home. I am muni. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

pwn: vovo tiamen ti tjoko kati kivi posaladji a men a semoqeljev ta paljing!
english: Grandma, we are tjuku and kivi, please open the door for us.

pwn: ti tjanobak a ken, mangetjez a ken a karim tjai camak.
english: I am tjanubak, I am here for camak.

pwn: vovo mangetjez a ken a pacon tjano son.
english: Grandma, I am here to see you.

pwn: coacoay anga so a inika mangedjez singelit aken aravac tjanoson.
english: You haven't been here for a long time. I missed you so much.

pwn: kivi, mangetjez aken a karim tjano son ta kivangavang.
english: kivi, I am here to play with you.

pwn: kirimo saqomaqanon coai anga ken a kaljava tjanoson.
english: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

pwn: aico a vorasi ko sinitalem pai kilingavi a keman.
english: This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!

pwn: qaljemqem angata a ico a vorasi.
english: The sweet potato is so sweet.

pwn: ido samazaw! aico ko sinitalem a kodamono, kilingavi a keman.
english: Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

pwn: qaljemqem aravac a ico a kodamono.
qiladjo! ko sinitalem aico a ponog neka no hilio kilingavi a keman.
english: Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.

pwn: owa! qaljemqem aravac aico a ponog.
english: Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

pwn: ini aken a maqatia a keman ta valjetjok, bolai a keman aken ta linggo.
english: I can't eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.
Sure, I like it very much.

pwn: ko sitjoljakan toa kodamono to so kanen.
english: Let me peel the fruit for you.

pwn: masalo, liyaw a qetim na aico a kodamono.
english: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.

pwn: malap a ken ta zalojm to ko sipatekel tjanoson son.
english: I will bring you some water.

pwn: soliavo a keman, na kemesa ken a pakaliyaw ta djamay.
english: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.

pwn: owa! ngoljingolj angata no kanen sangoaq ota.
english: Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.

pwn: soliavo a keman, liyaw a nan a imaza.
english: Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.
I'll make myself at home then.

pwn: soliavo a keman, liyaw a nan a imaza.
english: Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

pwn: liyaw anga ko kinan, nakoya anga keman.
english: I ate a lot and couldn't eat any more.

pwn: ori kacoin mon a ma gado ni sinsi toco a qadaw.
english: I will take you to the mountains today.

pwn: qivo ti kina liyaw aravac a cacarag i gado aya.
english: Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

pwn: toco a qadaw ori kacin mon ni sinsi a ma vavoa.
english: I will take you to the fields.

pwn: ori vaik a men a qemosol ta qipo?
english: Are we going to loosen the soil?

pwn: ori semaino itjen toco a qadaw?
ori kacoin a men ni sinsi a sema pana.
english: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

pwn: ori kacoin a men a sinsi a sema gade.
english: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.

pwn: ori vaik itjen a sema pana toco qadaw?
english: Are we going to the riverside today?

pwn: ini, ori kacoin itjen ni sinsi a sema gade.
english: No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.

pwn: ori vaik itjen a sema gado toco qadaw?
english: Are we going to the mountains today?

pwn: ini, ori vaik itjen a sema vavoa toco a qadaw.
english: No, we are going to the fields.

pwn: sinsi, anema tja paconan no semapana itjen?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?

pwn: viak itjen a pacon ta qaqodroy.
english: We are going to see dragonflies.

pwn: sinsi, ori sema gade tjen a pacon ta anema?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?
We are going to see butterflies.
What are we going to do in the fields?

pwn: ori vaik amen a sema vavoa pacon ta nia talem a ponog, kipapaolingavo izoa sasiq tjainan yo!
english: We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

pwn: sinis, ori sema pana tjen a ljemangoi?
english: Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?

pwn: ini, ori vaik itjen a pacon ta qaqodroy.
english: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

pwn: sinis, ori mavavoa tjen a temalem ta ljaceng?
english: Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?

pwn: ori vaik itjen toco qadaw a temovod ta qipo.
english: We are going to loosen the soil today.

pwn: inoan a qaqodroi a minlayalayap a pacacikecekel.
toco a qadaw tjopacon aken ta paqolid a valjoaljot a qaqodroi.
english: Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

pwn: yei! wa! tjengelay aken ta kalidrongodrongolj, bolay aravac.
english: Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

pwn: inika kalidrongodrongolj a zoa, tjainan azoa.
english: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

pwn: imazao a pacon, nakoya macadja a ravac yo!
english: Come here and take a look. Don't go too far!

pwn: nangoaq, inika cemadja a ori nia sazoain.
english: Got it, we won't go anywhere too far.

pwn: maya mekelj galjo a djemavac mavan no setjakeros anga.
english: Don't run and walk slowly lest you fall down.

pwn: saljinga ken a pacon a kirimo.
english: I want to see them right away.

pwn: namaka toa anema son a vaik a sema patjangzaq?
english: How do you go to the block-house?

pwn: na maka toa anema timadjo a vaik a sema bioyeng?
english: How does he go to the hospital?

pwn: na djemavac timadjo a vaik a sema bioyeng.
na maka ta anema son a vaik a sema bokoto?
english: How do you go to Penghu?

pwn: na maka ta hikoki a ken a vaik a sema bokoto.
english: I go to Penghu by plane.

pwn: na maka varokor aken a sema pokoto.
english: I go to Penghu by boat.

pwn: na maka ta anema son a sema tjomaq?
na maka ta tjeiyon a ken a sema tjomaq.
na maka toa anema ti tjoko a vaik a sema gakko?
english: How does tjuku go to school?

pwn: na maka ta kisia ti tjoko a vaik a sema gakko.
english: tjuku goes to school by train.

pwn: na maka ta anema ti piya a sema kiokay?
english: How does piya go to church?

pwn: na kizidinsia ti piya a sema kiokay.
english: piya goes to church by bicycle.

pwn: na maka ta tjeiyon son a sema gakko?
english: Do you go to school by MRT?

pwn: ini, na maka baso a ken a sema gakko.
english: No, I go to school by bus.

pwn: na kizidinsia son a sema gako?
english: Do you go to school by bicycle?

pwn: oi, na kizidinsia ken a sema gakko.
english: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

pwn: na maka ta kaotiy son a sema takaw?
english: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

pwn: oi, na maka kaoti aken a sema takaw.
english: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

pwn: no vaik son a sema taito maka hikoki son mano maka kisiya son?
english: Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

pwn: maka hikoki a ken, tjadjayaw a maka hikoki ta kisia.
english: I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

pwn: no vaik son a sema kiokay maka baso son mano onting son ta palidring?
english: Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

pwn: onting a ken ta palidring a sema kiokay tjanangoaq a onting ta maka baso.
english: I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

pwn: dongdong a vavelian ta no omaq?
english: Is the market close to your house?

pwn: inika dongdong, kiotobay a ken a sema toa vavelian.
english: No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.
Is the post office close to the school?
Yes, it is within walking distance.

pwn: idodod ta sasekezan na baso a kakanan?
english: Is the restaurant close to the station?

pwn: no casaw ta ljaljevavan ta baso sa djemavac to go pongkang djemaljon anga.
english: It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.

pwn: izoa so lingao toco a qadaw?
salinga ken ta vaik a paljilji tjanoson.
english: I would like to visit you.

pwn: izoa ko sengsengan toco a qadaw no tjaivililj anga.
english: I am out today. How about another day?

pwn: sa izoa so lingao notiyaw? ko karimao anga son no na kincengelj anga.
english: Then, are you available tomorrow? I'll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

pwn: maqati ko kaljavao anga son i tjomaq.
english: Sure, I will wait for you at home.

pwn: maqati aken a loing? saljinga ken ta pongengetj.
english: Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.
Would you mind if I do the video recording?

pwn: sekolong aken ini kana maparimasodjo a soko ota nakoya yo.
english: No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn't been tidied up yet.
Then I will just take photos.

pwn: masalo na selaing son a ko kivadaq.
english: Thank you for accepting the interview.

pwn: inika makoda anema ori so sikivadaq?
english: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

pwn: ka maqacovocovong son anema so kiposengsengan?
english: What do you do when you are young?

pwn: taizing aken kasicoayan ljakoa na kidjaola anga ken.
english: I was a police officer but I am retired now.
Then, are you working at the moment?

pwn: i zoazoa i qinaljan a so aljak ota?
english: Do your kids live in the tribe too?

pwn: ini izoazoa i lizok a kinaizoanan na ko aljak.
english: No, my kids are all living in the city.
Then, do you live by yourself?

pwn: na paqozip aken ota ta ita vato ita ngiyaw tiamadjo ko cemekeljan ota.
english: I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

pwn: na paqozip aken ota to ita ngiyaw no izoa qemoziqozip ini tjen a masepelj.
english: I have a cat too. I won't get bored with the company of my pet.

pwn: kivadaq aken tjanoson ta pakata palisiyan na qemaljop.
english: I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

pwn: kedri a ko kineljangan ljakoa tjara temevela ken ta ko kineljang.
english: I don't know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

pwn: anema palisiyan na zoa no siqaljoqaljop dogo?
english: Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

pwn: inika maqati a matjapi ta vavayan a siqaljoqaljop a nemanga.
english: Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

pwn: maqati a kiseljang a azoa vavayan a qemaljop?
english: Then, can women go hunting together?

pwn: nakoya komalji a vavayan inika maqati a qemaljop.
english: No, women cannot go hunting either.

pwn: koliw nekanga vava i tjomaq sao vaiko a veneli.
english: kuliw, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

pwn: izoanan a tjano ita vava i kakesan sikoda veneli!
english: There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

pwn: inika cengceng a tja no ita vaikoanan a veneli to tjanodrosa.
english: One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

pwn: veneli aken ta vava paveliveli mon ini?
english: I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?
Yes! How many bottles do you need?

pwn: veneli aken to tja no drosa katoa tja no ita a padai.
english: I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

pwn: imaza padai izoanan a so kinasaljinga?
english: Here is the rice, what else do you need?

pwn: venelianan aken ta qecilo izoa nimon?
english: I want some eggs too, do you have some?
I want to buy some clothes.
What kind of clothes do you like?

pwn: ori veneli aken ta rikirikitj a itong.
english: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

pwn: izoanan a nia vocelacelai kata cangiangia.
english: We have white and blue ones too.

pwn: pavai aken ta cangiangia a kava.
english: Please give me the clothes in blue.

pwn: koliw kasino son tasaoni na vaik? son a ondo?
english: kuliw, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

pwn: ini, na vaik aken a posaladj tjai vovo a veneli ta ljaceng.
english: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

pwn: manokemoda izoa so lingaw no qezemetj maqati son a kidjadjalan tja no aken a keman.
english: No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

pwn: ini, a maqati ori vaik aken a veneli ta itong.
english: No, I want to buy some clothes.

pwn: kidjadjalan aken tja no son nomaya.
english: Then, I will go with you.

pwn: nangoangoaq son pida valjitjoq na aico a ljaceng?
english: Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?
The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.

pwn: pida valjitjoq ta aico a vorasi?
english: How much are these sweet potatoes?

pwn: no iking a vorasi tjelo a poloq.
english: Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

pwn: pavai aken to drosa tadjaljengan a ljaceng iking a vorasi.
english: Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

pwn: koliw maraorao aken a kemaco ta sivecivecik maqati son a pasedjam tjanoaken?
english: kuliw, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

pwn: neka no niaken ota aico ni kivi.
english: I don't have one either. This is kivi's.

pwn: maqati a pasedjam tja no aken a palamo djaljaw sa ko pacikeli.
english: Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

pwn: masalo posaloi anga ti kivi ota.
english: Thank you and thank kivi for me.

pwn: ori pacikel aken taico a drosa sapitj.
english: I want to return these two books.
No problem and what else do you need?

pwn: kisedjam anan aken taico a tjelo a sapitj.
english: I would like to borrow these three books.

pwn: bolai anga paqenetjo no tjelo a qadaw ido anga pacikel.
english: Sure and remember to return them after three days.

pwn: inika nan so a pacikeli a ko siqoliqolip.
english: You haven't returned me the eraser.
Then, why is my eraser missing?
Did you lend it to piya?

pwn: inika ken a kemeljang vaik aken a kivadaq tjaimadjo.
english: I don't know. I will go and ask her.

pwn: ko pasedjamai anan son ta ko siqoliqolip.
english: I will lend you my eraser first.

pwn: kivi ni piya aico a kava a sinipasedjam tjanoson?
english: kivi, did piya lend you this coat?

pwn: ini aico vinele ni kina tjanoaken.
english: No, my mom bought it for me.

pwn: a kava ni piya namaya ta so kava.
english: piya's coat is the same as yours.

pwn: qocengecengel a kava nimadjo inika mamaw a nia qoljao.
english: His coat is black, so our colors are different.

pwn: kivi na kisedjam son ta valjitjoq tjai piya?
english: kivi, did you borrow money from piya?

pwn: izoa ori pacikel aken toco a qadaw ljakoa na maraoraw a ken a kemaco ta valjitjoq.
english: Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.
Then, when will you return the money?
I will return to him tomorrow.
Okay, I will tell piya for you.

pwn: no poringai ta kolavaw qezetjen ta qaciljai a ringay no poringai ta tjikorai seman vetjon a semeloc ta ringai.
english: It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

pwn: mano namaitoco tiaken a pasaliw djaljepan inika ken a djemamedjameq.
english: No wonder! I am mistaken and that's why I cannot catch any of them.

pwn: ko toloai son to kemoda semanaya taico a drosa ringai.
english: Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

pwn: bolai bolaiangata no tjaivililj tjara madjameq a sacemel.
english: Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

pwn: qaca anga cemel i vavoa sao alapo ta tjakit a masoko vaiki a semavavoa.
english: The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let's go to the fields.

pwn: i ljaqedi ta tjakaz no ljetaladj son ta soko so paconan.
english: It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

pwn: kipapaolingavo ta malap nakoya mapasaqetjo radjai a tjakit.
english: Be careful and don't get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

pwn: iteko ta kasiw a ko ringai.
english: My trap is under that tree.

pwn: izoa ko sinipokeljang imaza kemeljang aken to ino ako ringai.
english: I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

pwn: aico soronong tja pizoain i veleljoan to sidjameq ta ciqaw.
english: This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

pwn: neka no niamen a soronong panadip a nia sikiciqaciqaw.
english: We don't have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

pwn: inianan aken a cekao ta panadip no tjaivililj toloi anga ken?
english: I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

pwn: bolai kaciyori anga no tjaivililj a panadip ta ciqaw.
english: Sure! Let's go fishing together next time.

pwn: nomaya no tjaivililj ko toloai anga son to kemoda semanaya ta soronong.
english: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

pwn: garavagavagav anga so panadip mano izoa nga ciqaw a na mapanadip rakaco a kirimo.
english: Your fishing rod is moving. Isn't the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

pwn: mayanan mariqeriq aravac a varokor tjemaza ken a remakac ta panadip sazoao posaladji aken a malap ta arai.
english: Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

pwn: rakaco a pasamaza i tja no a ken ko posaladja son a remakac.
english: Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

pwn: bolai angata toco na mapeljoq anga ciqaw i ta sorongong.
english: Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

pwn: vaiki a kirimo a semiljeva ta tja salasaladj.
english: Let's go back immediately and share it with everyone.

pwn: mayanga kivangavang, qiladjo a kirimo toa sangel.
english: Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

pwn: sikalima qadaw toa singci tasaoni, ori semekez notiyaw, ari a kivangavang!
english: It's Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let's go out and play together!

pwn: nangoaq lja! ari a sema pana.
english: Great! Let's go to the riverside.
What day will it be tomorrow?

pwn: sikatjelolj a qadaw notiyaw, ari vaiki anga no pasovililj toa cengelj a benoro!
english: Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let's go play ball tomorrow afternoon!

pwn: ori anema so kodain no tiyaw a kadjaman?
english: What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

pwn: niciyobi notiyaw, ori sema kiokay amen kati kina.
english: Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

pwn: sa motjaq aen, ori sema kaya en.
english: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

pwn: sinsi, saqetjo a o tjiyalj, ori sema kaya en.
english: Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.
May I go wash my hands?

pwn: palamo kisemekaz anga kitolo, vaiko anga nosaoni.
english: It's almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

pwn: sinsi, marosaqetjo a o qolo, ori cingciya sa sekez no pasovililj toa cengalj.
english: It's almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.
Okay, take care and go home.

pwn: ori cingciyaen no tjavililj a singci i, sa vaik aen a kipocemel.
english: Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

pwn: saqetjo a tjiyalj nimadjo, i kaya timadjo.
english: She has a stomachache. She's in the restroom.

pwn: sinsi, saqetjo a liqo ni Kolio, na cingciya toco a qadaw.
english: Teacher, Kuliu has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

pwn: akomaya inikana mangtjez ti Tjoko kasaoni?
ti Sakino aen a Tjoridri, tapoloq anga o cavilj toco.
english: My name is Tjuridri, and I'm 10 years old.

pwn: anema no zokoan son a kakedriyan?
english: What ethnic group are you from?
Are all your family members indigenous?
Yes, my whole family is Paiwan.
Are all your family members indigenous?

pwn: ini, sePaiwana o kama, pairang a o kina.
english: No, my father is Paiwan, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

pwn: ni Sakino a Tjoridri aen a aljak.
english: I am Sakinu a Tjuridri's child.

pwn: so kama zoa caocao? pidanga cvavilj nimadjo?
english: Is that your father? How old is he?

pwn: onem anga poloq a cavilj nimadjo.
so kama zoa caocao? pidanga cavilj nimadjo?
english: Is that your father? How old is he?

pwn: malji, nia ramaljeng i qinaljan timadjo, alo anga poloq a cavilj nimadjo.
english: No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

pwn: pida nga cavilj na so kaka tjavolong a oqaljay?
tapoloq saka alo anga cavili nimadjo.
tjavolong tjanoson to liyaw a cavilj na so kaka tjavolong a oqaljay?
english: Is your brother much older than you?

pwn: lima cavilj a sikatjavolong tjanoaen nimadjo.
sicoayan anga o ljinengljengan tjanoson, qadjawson a na meqaca nga?
english: I haven't seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

pwn: oy lja, izoa nga 130konghon a o kinaqaca.
neka ei, na pasalio son a pacon.
oy lja, izoa 30 kongcin a o kinasdjelong toco.
ori karim aen tjaysinsi a ma pankongse.
english: I'm going to the office to see the teacher.

pwn: ori vak a venric toa cemel timadjo.
english: He's going to throw away the trash.

pwn: i ljaljangoyan timadjo, ori kiseljavak toa malalomalj a ljemangoy timadjo no saoni.
english: He's at the swimming pool. He's going to compete in a swimming competition later.

pwn: ino ti Tjoko? ori kiseljavak toa malalomalj a mintoloq timadjo no saoni.
english: Where is Tjuku? She's going to compete in a running competition later.

pwn: izoa i litang timadjo, o vikao a qemaqivo.
english: She's in the auditorium. I'll go call her.

pwn: ari vaiki a sema caocang dri!
english: Let's go to the playground together.

pwn: vaik anan aen a venli toa cengelj, o so karimao anga no saoni.
english: I'll go buy lunch first, and then I'll meet you later.

pwn: ari vaiki a qemalo toa piyentang dri!
english: Let's carry the lunch boxes together!

pwn: karimo toa zoma caocao, ori karim aen toa sinsi.
english: You find someone else, I'm going to find the teacher.

pwn: Kolio ori malalomalj toa cemogecog toa boro nosaoni?
english: Is Kuliu competing in croquet today?

pwn: neka ei, ori kiseljavak timadjo toa malalolamalj a mintjoljok.
english: No, he's competing in high jump.

pwn: no ita ondokay a qadaw ori kiseljavak son toa malalomalj?
english: Will you compete in the sports day?

pwn: oy ei, ori kiseljavak aen toa malalomalj a mintoloq.
ori kiseljavak aen a cemogecog toa boro.
anema ori tjakodain ita malalomalj toa ondo a qadaw?
english: What will we do in the sports day?

pwn: ori malalomalj amen a mavaviljvilj toa calis.
english: We will compete in tug of war.

pwn: ori pavelitjen toa kakanen no malalomalj a qadaw?
english: Will we sell food at the sports day?

pwn: na malap son toa sangasangasan a nadan ei, maro qizing son lja!
english: Congratulations on getting first place! You're amazing!

pwn: i tjomaq ti vovo a vavayan?

english: Yes, she's sleeping in her room.

pwn: neka i tjomq, tjaovaik a sasaw no qzemetj ki tjomaq.
english: No, she's not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

pwn: i tjomaq ti vovo a oqaljay?
ita tjayvavao a kinayzoan, savavavo a karim timdjo.
english: He's upstairs. You can go up and find him.

pwn: a, ti Kolio lja, sicoyan anga ljinengeljengan tjanoson, nangoangoaq son?
english: It's Kuliu. I haven't seen you in a while! How have you been?

pwn: nangoangoaq aen lja! mangtjez aen to makakay tjanoson.
english: I'm doing great! I came to chat with you.

pwn: cemalcala toa djamay i kakesan timadjo, o vaikao a qemaqivo.
english: He's in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

pwn: na vaik a sema podjorikokoan a djemameq toa djorikoko.
english: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

pwn: neka i tjomaq a no vovo a oqaljay, i kavoavoan timadjo, kaljavao i tjomaq timdjo dri!
english: Your grandfather is not at home. He's in the field. Wait for him to come back.

pwn: mangtjez anga son ama i Kolio dri!
coacoay anga ljinengeljengan tjanoson, na meqaca nga son.
english: I haven't seen you in a while. You've grown taller.

pwn: paconan son a mangtjez, maro maleva en..
english: It's so good to see you.

pwn: o sinipavay co a pangodralj tjanomon, pasa pinsiang ngo!
english: Here's a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

pwn: sicoayan anga so pinangtjezan, o qaivoao a mapoljat to mangtjez a keman.
english: It's been a while. Let's have a meal together.

pwn: saldji to pokakodan, temkel aen toa ociya, ari a matoa papasedjaloan a makakay.
english: No need to bother. I'll just have tea. Let's sit in the living room and chat.

pwn: masalo toa so pinasedjaloan, ori tjomaq anga en.
english: Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

pwn: tjaocoljoin co a djorikoko, kaco a tjomaq sa galjoyanga keman.
english: This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

pwn: maqati to mecevong itjen ita pasovililj toa cengelj notiyaw?
english: Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

pwn: maqati, kaljavari to maccevong itjen inoan?
maqati to tjigako iten? ori tja sansasingen.
english: How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

pwn: nangoaq a sema kakaqepoan, ori kemava en toa kinacalisiyan a itong.
english: Then let's go to the community center. I'll wear folk costume.

pwn: bolay aravac no paotez a temelak a vociyar noa sakora itoa niya qinqljan. no venotilak anga vociyar ido anga karim tjanoaen.
english: The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

pwn: ori kemaljava itjen a patje kaljavevoan, paso gemaljo anga ravac!
english: That would have to wait until spring. It's too late, isn't it?

pwn: sa pangtjezo anga ita palisiyan noa masalot a qadaw!
english: Then come during our Harvest Festival!
Alright! I'm looking forward to it!

pwn: o so kivadaqay to' "akomaya sa cemikel son a sema qinaljan a kemayzoa? "
english: May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?
I want to return to teach at the local school.

pwn: akomaya ikason a temolo i lizok?
english: Why not teach in the city?

pwn: ayatoa veleqed en toa o qinaljan, na saljinga en ota to pasocikel a qemeljing ta i qinaljan ota.
english: Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

pwn: saigo son aravac a tjemenon, tima na temolo tjanoson?
english: You're very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

pwn: avan a o vovo a vavayan. tjaljasaigoan a tjemenon i qinaljan timadjo.
english: It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

pwn: nakemoda sa venerong son a kicaqoan ta tjemenon?
english: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

pwn: nia kakodan a tjemenon, na sa patodor aen toa nia kakodan.
english: Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

pwn: sangoaq ngata tja tekelen aico a vinava vaqo.
maro saigo son angata, coacoay itjen a venava?
english: You're really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

pwn: ikacoacoay, tjara izoa pitjo a qadaw mavava nga. tja pakakesain anan a pita lalidringan avaqo, sa pizoay toa djolis a kemadikat, maqati anga djilongen.
english: No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

pwn: izoa kamangolj katoa ljaogiyo, tiyaen a na temalem a macidilj lja!
english: I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

pwn: pida valjitjoq no velin a ljemedrosa?
drosaiday sa limapoloq a valjitjoq a penoljat.
tjenglay aen toco a itong, pidapaisoan a veli?
english: I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

pwn: limaiday a valjitjoq a veli noco a itong.
pazangal aravac, maqati to tjamadjolo a pagaljo?
english: It's too expensive. Can't you lower the price a bit?

pwn: inikamaqati, no pitjamadjolo ori masipon aen.
english: No, if I lower it further, I'll lose money.

pwn: oynomaya! nomaya venli aen to taitongan toa qecengecengel a itong.
english: Alright then, I'll take a black piece of clothing.

pwn: na saljinga en taico a tjakit katoa pariyok.
english: I want this knife and this pot.

pwn: drosa kozoljan a valjitoq a veli a penoljat. o sinaliman a malang, tjaramaqati a siseljodj a coacoay.
english: It's a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

pwn: o tjomaljay a o qaliyaliyan to veneli, maqti to tjamadjolo anan?
english: I'll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

pwn: nangoaq lja! o sopoaw to 8ce anga.
english: Alright! I'll give you a 20% discount.

pwn: pangtezo a pacon lja! izoa itong katoa tjalopong a sipaveliveli.
english: Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

pwn: no ita itong tjelo a iday sa limapoloq a valjitjoq, no tjelo a itong kozolj a valjitjoq a veli.
english: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

pwn: veneli aen to ita sakamaya, pavay aen toa vaqoan.
english: I'll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

pwn: nangoangoaq son, na saveneli aen toa djoadjoay a tjinaljak katoa ljinivanger a qalom.
english: Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

pwn: sepaveli anga penoljat a tjinaljek, izoanan a o tjinanaq a yoping, veneli son?
english: The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

pwn: nangoaq dri! pavay aen to masanita, veneli anga en no tjayvililj toa tjinaljek.
english: Alright, please give me one. I'll come back next time to buy rice.

pwn: nangoaq, o ravavaw toa lobolobok, no maytazoa limapoloq a valjitjoq.
english: Okay, I'll pack it in a bag for you. That'll be 50 dollars.

pwn: djvadjavay a mapoljat, patagilj anga itjen a kitolo.
english: Hello everyone. Let's start the lesson.

pwn: djavadjavay a mapoljat, toco ori temolo ti sinsi ta nakakanen a pinaiwanan.
english: Hello everyone. Today I am going to teach you how to say food in Paiwanese.

pwn: nasepoalang anga son to anemamaya ti sinsi?
english: Do you understand what the teacher says?

pwn: sinsi maqati son a momalj a poita, ini anan aken nasepoalan.
english: I don't understand. Can you repeat it again?

pwn: pacono a pasa maza! kaciori a kisopo.
english: Look here, please! Repeat after me.

pwn: momaljo anan a poita, sa papezangalo nokisopo son.
english: Read it again. Please speak louder.

pwn: sinsi, na maadjoq a ko inpic.
english: I forgot to bring my pen.

pwn: sinsi na maadjoq a ko siqoliqolip.
english: I forgot to bring my eraser.

pwn: pomayan, saw pacono ta qayaqayam nomaya.

pwn: masalo aravac toa so tjaocikel kasaoni, liaw anga ko sinivecik.

pwn: na kemakang anga ken, ori ko vosaman nosaoni.
english: I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

pwn: amin a qaodriodri a maqati a no kiljacengen.

pwn: qemayoqayo amen i veljeloan, ori kiciqaw amen.

pwn: namapeljoq anga dradrakoyan ta nia kiniciqaw.

pwn: seman dringay aken ta ko siqaljop
english: I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.

pwn: makeljang to djinavacan noa vavoy a qeljo.
english: I can see the traces of the boar.

pwn: aico sidringadringay ta takec ni kama.

pwn: masalo angata ta naqemati, liaw a tja qinaljopan kasaoni.

pwn: oi angatalja! masalo aravac toa sinipagaogaw tjanoitjen noa naqemati.

pwn: oli tjaljomaza tja kitolo, mecevongi anga mapoljat.
