pwn: oi, no kitolo amen i gako mato taqomaqanan.
english: Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.

pwn: timadjo so kaka tjakeri a oqaljay?
ini, timadjo na ko kaka tjakeri oqaljay a qali.
english: No, he is my younger brother's friend.

pwn: timadjo so kaka tjavolong a vavayan?
ini, o kaka tjakeri a vavayan timadjo.
english: No, she is my younger sister.
How many people in their family?
There are five people in their family.
How many children in your family?
There are four children in our family.

pwn: mapida so kaka tjakeri oqaljay kata vavayan?
english: How many younger siblings do you have?

pwn: neka ko kaka tjakeri a oqaljay, izoa tjelo tjakeri a kaka vavayan.
english: I don't have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.

pwn: mapida so kaka tjavolong a oqaljay kata vavayan.
english: How many older siblings do you have?

pwn: neka ko kaka tjavolong a oqaljay kata vavayan.
english: I don't have any older siblings.

pwn: oi, timadjo ko kaka tjavolong a oqaljay.
a kalevelevan paso ljaljeqel, temekel itjen toa linalja a zaljom.
english: It's a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

pwn: a kalevelevan paso semezam, temekel itjen toa liaw a zaljom.
english: It's a bit hot, so we need to drink more water.

pwn: qaca qadaw, paqenetjo kiljaongo toa qadaw.
english: The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.

pwn: liaw qerepos, neka qadaw i kalevelevan.
english: There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

pwn: notiyaw neka qadaw, liaw qerepos, qaca vali.
english: It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.
How was the weather that day?

pwn: tazoa qadaw paso ljaljeqel, kavao ta tjiako no ljisasaw.
english: It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.
How's the weather on the weekend?
It will be sunny on the weekend.
Will it be rainy that day?

pwn: tazoa maqadaw a kalevelevan, ika qemodjalj.
english: It will have no rain and be sunny that day.

pwn: oi, ori qemodjalj no tazoa qadaw.
english: Yes, it will be rainy that day.
The rain stops and the sun comes out.

pwn: qemodjalj anga, ika namasi ljinay aken.
english: It is raining and I don't have an umbrella with me.

pwn: toco ika qemodjaqodjalj, ljakoa pasovililj ta cengelj ori qemodjalj, kaco toa ljinay.
english: It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.
Will it be very cold in winter next year?

pwn: oi, no icavilj ori ljaljeqel a kaljavoceleljan, kavao to liaw ta kava.
english: Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

pwn: toco a cavilj kisemezam a kaljazalazangan?
english: Will it be very hot in summer this year?

pwn: oi, no kaljazalazangan ori semezam, temekel tjen to liaw ta zaljom.
english: Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

pwn: tjenglay ken ta kaljavevoan, semeljec a kalevelevan.
english: I like spring because the weather is warm.

pwn: ika ken na tjengelay ta kaljaolagan, izoa liaw a boho no kaljaolagan.
english: I don't like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.

pwn: madraodraw a ken kemaco ta sapitj.
english: I forgot to bring the textbook.

pwn: tiaken kati son kacioli a pacon.
english: I will share it with you.
I forgot to bring the eraser.

pwn: na madraodraw son a kemaco ta inpic?
english: Do you forget to bring your pen?

pwn: oi pasedjamy aken ta so inpic?
english: Yes, can you lend me a pen?
What would you like for lunch?

pwn: oli keman na ken ta pang.
oli keman na ken ta paday.
saosaonan, nosaony o so kimaw anga.
english: You go first and I will catch up later.
No, we have to carry books first.

pwn: inianan, semenasenaw a ken ta kisi toco.
english: Not yet. I am doing the dishes.
Did you rinse out your mouth?

pwn: maka senaw anga ken ta kisi.

english: Why didn't you wash your hands?
I will wash my hands later.
What were you doing just now?

pwn: oli vaik a en kemin ta sinsi.
english: I went to meet the teacher.

pwn: no poaming kitolo anema kodaing nimadjo?
english: What is she doing after school?
She is going to go dancing.

pwn: neka ti akay i tjomaq! ti ljeljeng aken, anema so sikimkim? no mangetjez ko tjomaljay anga ti akay.
english: akay is not at home. I am ljeljeng. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

pwn: vovo, ti savan akay a men, posaladj amen a semoqeljev.
english: Grandma, we are savan and akay, please open the door for us.

pwn: ti boya ken, kemikim aken tjai kapi
english: I am buya, I am here for kapi.

pwn: vovo, mangtjez a ken paljilji tjanoson.
english: Grandma, I am here to see you.

pwn: sicoayan nangata so pinantjezan, singelit aken aravac tjanoson.
english: You haven't been here for a long time. I missed you so much.

pwn: savan, mangetjez aken kemin tjanoson a kivanvan.
english: savan, I am here to play with you.

pwn: kilimo ljitaladjo, coayanga ken a kemaljavaljava tjanoson.
english: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

pwn: aico o talem a vorasi, paqayami a keman.
english: This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!
The sweet potato is so sweet.

pwn: ido! aico o talem a kodamono, paqayami a keman.
english: Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

pwn: qiladjo! aico inika kinosolian a poday tiaken a na temalem kano pay!
english: Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.
Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

pwn: ika keman na en ta tjanes, keman na en ta ringko.
english: I can't eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.
Sure, I like it very much.

pwn: o sitjoljakan son ta kodamono sipakan tjanoson.
english: Let me peel the fruit for you.

pwn: masalo, aico a kodamono liaw qetim.
english: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.

pwn: malap aken ta zaljom sipatekel tjanoson.
english: I will bring you some water.

pwn: so liaw keman, liaw ko sinandjamay.
english: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.

pwn: o! salolom angata saka sangoaq taota.
english: Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.

pwn: so liaw keman, izoanan liaw imaza.
english: Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.
I'll make myself at home then.

pwn: so liaw keman, izoanan liaw imaza.
english: Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

pwn: liaw anga o kinan, dikinay anga keman.
english: I ate a lot and couldn't eat any more.

pwn: nosaony oli ko kacoing mon a sema vavowa.
english: I will take you to the mountains today.

pwn: aya ti kina liaw cacalag i vavowa.
english: Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

pwn: nosaony oli ko kacoing mon a sema can.
english: I will take you to the fields.
Are we going to loosen the soil?

pwn: nosaony oli vaik itjen a maino?
oli kacoing tjen sema pana ni sinsi.
english: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

pwn: oli kacoing tjen ni sinsi a sema vavowa.
english: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.

pwn: nosaony oli vaik tjen a sema pana?
english: Are we going to the riverside today?

pwn: ini, oli kacoing tjen a sema vavowa ni sinsi.
english: No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.

pwn: nosaony oli vaik itjen a sema vavowa?
english: Are we going to the mountains today?

pwn: ini, nosaony oli vaik itjen sema can.
english: No, we are going to the fields.

pwn: sinsi, ama oli tja paconan i pana?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?

pwn: vaik itjen a pacon ta tongbo.
english: We are going to see dragonflies.

pwn: sinsi, oli vaik itjen ma vavowa pacon ta anema?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?
We are going to see butterflies.

pwn: anema tja kodaing a ma can?
english: We are going to see butterflies.

pwn: oli vaik amen ma can paljilji toa nia talem a poday, kinemenemo izoa sasiq, pangac yo!
english: We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

pwn: sinsi oli vaik itjen a sema pana kemavekav?
english: Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?

pwn: ini, oli vaik itjen pacon ta tongbo.
english: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

pwn: sinsi oli vaik itjen sema can temalem ta ljaceng?
english: Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?
We are going to loosen the soil today.

pwn: kasaony sipoita pacon ta valjoaljot a tongbo.
english: Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

pwn: yi! wa! tjengelay a ken ta kadradrongolj, sasangowaq.
english: Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.
Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

pwn: pacocono imaza, maya vaik a ljacadja ta kadjonangan yo!
english: Come here and take a look. Don't go too far!

pwn: oi, ika men na vaik a pasa ljacadja ta kadjonangan.
english: Got it, we won't go anywhere too far.

pwn: maya mekelj, kigaljo a djemavac tjakoyanga sekolilj.
english: Don't run and walk slowly lest you fall down.
I want to see them right away.
How do you go to the block-house?

pwn: oli ongeting aken ta zidosiya sema tapaw.
oli kemoda vaik a bioing timadjo?
english: How does he go to the hospital?

pwn: oli kemoda son vaik a sema penho?
english: How do you go to Penghu?

pwn: oli ljivavaw aken ta hikoki sema pengho.
english: I go to Penghu by plane.

pwn: oli kemoda son vaik a sema pengho?
english: How do you go to Penghu?

pwn: oli ljivavaw aken ta varokor sema pengho.
english: I go to Penghu by boat.

pwn: anema so ljivavaven a sema tjomaq.
ljivavaw ta tjiing a sema tjomaq.
anema ljivavaven ni tjoko a sema gako?
english: How does tjuku go to school?

pwn: ljivavaw ta kisia sema gako ti tjoko.
english: tjuku goes to school by train.

pwn: anema ljivavaven ni camak a sema kiokay?
english: How does camak go to church?
camak goes to church by bicycle.

pwn: ljivavaw son ta tjiing sema gako?
english: Do you go to school by MRT?

pwn: oi, padjidingsia ken a sema gako.
english: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

pwn: oli ljivavaw son ta kaoty sema takaw?
english: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

pwn: oi, ljivavaw aken ta kaoty sema takaw.
english: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

pwn: oli ljivavaw son ta kisia toki hikoki? a sema taito?
english: Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

pwn: ljivavaw aken ta hikoki, ljivavaw ta hikoki tja djaljaw toa kisia.
english: I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

pwn: oli ljivavaw ta baso toki emongeting a sema kiokay?
english: Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

pwn: emongeting aken sema koikay, no paka ta baso tja salengoaq a emongeting.
english: I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

pwn: demot a iciba ta no omaq?
english: Is the market close to your house?

pwn: ljacadja, no vaik sema iciba paotobay aken.
english: No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

pwn: aza iobingkiyoko a kinacadjan kata gako demot ri?
english: Is the post office close to the school?

pwn: aza kakanan a kinacadjan kata tisiaba demot ri?
english: Is the restaurant close to the station?

pwn: tjevota ta tisiaba djemavac to lima bong djemaljon.
english: It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.

pwn: nosaony izoa o kodaing neka i tjomaq, no tjaivililj anga a qadaw.
english: I am out today. How about another day?

pwn: saka notiaw izoa so djikan? no pasovililj toa cengelj o kimaw son.
english: Then, are you available tomorrow? I'll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

pwn: dikilo, o kaljavaljavaw son i tjomaq.
english: Sure, I will wait for you at home.

pwn: dikilo aken semeljop toa so zaing? sa kiroko aken.
english: Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.
Would you mind if I do the video recording?

pwn: sekolong aken, ika pinarimasodj a kovaw, maya lja!
english: No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn't been tidied up yet.
Then I will just take photos.

pwn: masalo tjanoson gemaogaw toa ko sikivadaq.
english: Thank you for accepting the interview.
You are welcome. What would you like to know?

pwn: kivadaqaw son ka maqacovocovong anan son anema so sengsengan?
english: What do you do when you are young?

pwn: kasicoayan kinsac a ken, ljakoa toco na kitjaolanga en.
english: : I was a police officer but I am retired now.
Then, are you working at the moment?

pwn: kivadaqaw a kinaizoanan na so aljak i qinaljan taota?
english: Do your kids live in the tribe too?

pwn: ini, a kinaizoanan na o aljak i hici.
english: No, my kids are all living in the city.

pwn: sa macidicidilj son i toa so kinaizoanan?
english: Then, do you live by yourself?

pwn: izoanan ko qinozip ita vato kata qayaqayam, tiamadjo mato ko taqomaqanan taota.
english: I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

pwn: na qemozip a en to ita ta ngiyaw ota, izoa doboc na zemang ika masepelj.
english: I have a cat too. I won't get bored with the company of my pet.

pwn: sa kivadaq aken tjanoson toa pakata qemaljop a palisi.
english: I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

pwn: ika liaw o kineljang, ljakoa a ko kineljan tjara ko tevelay son
english: I don't know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

pwn: aza nimon siqaljoqaljop a kowang a torivecan izoa anema palisi?
english: Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

pwn: aza tja siqaljop kowang a torivecan dikinay vavayan a cemelcel.
english: Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

pwn: aza vavayan dikilo kiciol a qemaljop?
english: Then, can women go hunting together?

pwn: dikinay, a vavayan inika dikilo a qemaljop taota.
english: No, women cannot go hunting either.

pwn: boya nekanga vaowa i tjomaq, sao velio ta vaowa.
english: buya, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

pwn: izoanan ita dalilj i kakesan. pasaladji a venely.
english: There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

pwn: talanay a ita dalilj, sao velio anan to drosa mangetjez.
english: One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

pwn: oli veneli aken ta vaowa, pavelively mon?
english: I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?
Yes! How many bottles do you need?

pwn: oli venely aken to drosa dalilj, venely anan toa talobokan a paday
english: I want two bottles and a pack of rice.
Here is the rice, what else do you need?

pwn: oli venely anan ken ta qecilo, izoa nimon?
english: I want some eggs too, do you have some?

pwn: nekanga nia qecilo na sepavei anga.

english: I want to buy some clothes.
What kind of clothes do you like?

pwn: oli venely aken toa hansodi a kava.
english: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

pwn: izoanan niamen a voteqiteqilj kata cangiangia.
english: : We have white and blue ones too.

pwn: pavai a ken ta cangiangia a kava to ita.
english: Please give me the clothes in blue.

pwn: camak na maino son kasaony? na vaik son a ondo?
english: camak, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

pwn: ini, oli vaik posaladj ta ko vovo vavayan pavely ta ljaceng.
english: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

pwn: maitazoa! izoa so djikan no qezemetj? timitja kaciol a kaiv.

pwn: dikinay, oli vaik aken venely toa kava.
english: No, I want to buy some clothes.

pwn: saka kiciol aken tjanoson a vaik.
english: Then, I will go with you.

pwn: djavadjavay, kivadaqaw aico a talekelekan a ljaceng pida pakiyaw?
english: Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

pwn: a ljaceng no ita talekelekan drosa poloq a pakiyaw.
english: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.
How much are these sweet potatoes?

pwn: a vorasi no ita tjingtjing tjelo poloq a pakiyaw.
english: Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

pwn: pavai en to drosa talekelekan a ljaceng kata ita tjingtjing a vorasy.
english: Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

pwn: camak madraodraw a kemaco ta tingnaw ken, dikilo son a pasedjam tjanoaken?
english: camak, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

pwn: neka niaken taota, aico ni moni.
english: I don't have one either. This is muni's.

pwn: dikilo pasedjam tjanoaken a palamo? djaljaw ki o pacikely tjanoson.
english: Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

pwn: masalo, posaladji anga ken a pasemalaw tjai moni to masalo.
english: Thank you and thank muni for me.

pwn: oli pacikel aken toa aico a drosa sapitj.
english: I want to return these two books.

pwn: oi, oli saljinganan son ta anema?
english: No problem and what else do you need?

pwn: tiaken oli kisedjam anan ta aico tjelo a sapitj.
english: I would like to borrow these three books.

pwn: oi, nosikatjelo anga paqenetjo a pacikel.
english: Sure and remember to return them after three days.

pwn: inianan pacikel son ta ko siqoloqolip.
english: You haven't returned me the eraser.

pwn: aza ko siqoliqolip mano maino maolav anga.
english: Then, why is my eraser missing?
Did you lend it to camak?

pwn: ika ken kemeljang. o vaiki a kivadaq timadjo.
english: I don't know. I will go and ask her.

pwn: pasedjamay anan son ta o siqoliqolip.
english: I will lend you my eraser first.

pwn: moni, ti camak a na pasedjam tjanoson toco a tjiako?
english: muni, did camak lend you this coat?

pwn: ini, aico na o kina vinelian tjanoaken.
english: No, my mom bought it for me.
camak's coat is the same as yours.

pwn: a nimadjo tjiako qecengecengel, ika mamaw niamen qoljaw.
english: His coat is black, so our colors are different.

pwn: moni, na kisedjam son ta paiso ni camak?
english: muni, did you borrow money from camak?

pwn: izoa, oli pacikeleng angata kasaony tjaimadjo, ljakoa madraodraw a kemaco ta paiso.
english: Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.
Then, when will you return the money?
I will return to him tomorrow.

pwn: oi, o posaladjay son a pasemalav tjai camak.
english: Okay, I will tell camak for you.

pwn: no djemekep toa kolavaw ayaing ta siqezetjan toa qaciljay a dringay, a djemekep toa tjikoray ayaing ta veceqel a dringay.
english: It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

pwn: mano maitoco, pasalisaliw anga ken djaljepan ika na djemameq.
english: No wonder! I am mistaken and that's why I cannot catch any of them.

pwn: o so tolovi anga to kemoda cokolo ta drosa malji a dringay.
english: Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

pwn: oi! bolay ngata! no maitoco oli macaqo a djemekep ta sacemel.
english: Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

pwn: laladroqan anga cemel i can, sao alapo ta dramiya i kovaw, ali semavavoa.
english: The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let's go to the fields.

pwn: aza itoa cepeng a gidigidi, no ljitaladj son ta kovaw so pacoanan anga.
english: It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

pwn: kigaljo a malap, maya mapasaqetjo. ladjay a dramiya.
english: Be careful and don't get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

pwn: a ko dringay izoa i petekoteko ta kasiw.
english: My trap is under that tree.

pwn: imaza o pinizoa ta pokeljang, kemeljang a ken ta o dringay to ino.
english: I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

pwn: aico a kadrao tja pasa maza i pana a kiciqaw.
english: This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

pwn: aza izoa neka tja kadrao, tiamen ayaing ta panadip a djemekep ta ciqaw.
english: We don't have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

pwn: inianan paqayam a panadip a ken, no tjaivililj toloi anga ken wi?
english: I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

pwn: oi! no tjaivililj macioli anga panadip.
english: Sure! Let's go fishing together next time.

pwn: no tjaivililj o toloi anga son ta seman kadrao
english: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

pwn: midradroa so panadip, qadjaw izoa ciqaw na makalavic! kilimo lakaco.
english: Your fishing rod is moving. Isn't the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

pwn: galjoanan, miraroa ravac a varokor, imaza en a lemakac ta panadip, sao mazoa posaladj a malap toa ko aralj.
english: Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

pwn: lakaco a ciqaw pasa maza tjanoaken, o posaladjay son a lemakac.
english: Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

pwn: bolay angata! kasaony polamy, aza kadrango na mapeljoq anga.
english: Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

pwn: kilimo vaiki tja sipaseljavak katoa mapoljat.
english: Let's go back immediately and share it with everyone.

pwn: maya kivangavang anga, qiladjo kilimo i ta qiladjan.
english: Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

pwn: sikalima a'adaw toco, polavay no tiyav, kaciwciwli anga vayika kivangavang!
english: It's Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let's go out and play together!
Great! Let's go to the riverside.
What day will it be tomorrow?

pwn: sikadjelo no tiyav, no tiyave a makakecengelj vayikanga djen a kivangavang ta benolo!
english: Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let's go play ball tomorrow afternoon!

pwn: anema so kodayin no tiyav a qadjaman?
english: What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

pwn: sikapidjolj no tiyav, vayiq a ken sema kiyokay kati kina.
english: Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

pwn: pasomodjaq ken, vayiq a ken sema bingzo.
english: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

pwn: sinsi, sakedjo a ko djiyalj, pasa mabingzo.
english: Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

pwn: sinsi, sa'edjo a ko 'olo, kivada ken no maka kingcengelj.
english: It's almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

pwn: aljaq a ken na paywan zoko.

pwn: ini, paywan ako kama, paylang ako kina.

english: No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

pwn: kawdelji a vayiq sema ta aongdoan.

english: Yes, she's sleeping in her room.

english: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

pwn: na maleva varong pacona to mangedjezanga son.

pwn: ayco a pangodralj sinipavay dja nomon, padjingo pasata pingsiyang.

pwn: awmay cowacoayanga ini a mangedjez, ko djawljaw a mapoljat sa maciwli a keman.

pwn: maya ma'odjaw anga, temeqel aken ta oca sakamaya, ido sema keting djen a mazazepzep.

pwn: maljimalji ta so kiniljevakan, ori vaykanga ken.
english: Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

pwn: ayco a voyo djaw vocien, ta so kacoin sa galjoannga a keman.
english: This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

pwn: nangowa no tiyiav a makakingcengelj ti son a ti aken a sicevongan?

english: How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

pwn: no mayatozoa vaiki a makakaqepoan anga, lemava aken ta ljongpaw a semazoa.
english: Then let's go to the community center. I'll wear folk costume.

pwn: no mavosilak a veljangaw na djoyis ngowango alavac i ta nia qinaljan, kalavao a patje mavosilak anga a veljangaw keljo anga kalim djanoa ken.
english: The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

pwn: no mayatazoa modri maqaljava padje kaljavevoan, sesoay alavace.
english: That would have to wait until spring. It's too late, isn't it?

pwn: nomaya son no sipalisiyan ta maljeveq bangdjezan anga.

english: Alright! I'm looking forward to it!

pwn: kivada tja no son, awmaya no cemikel sema qinaljan ta sivaljotan

pwn: awmaya ini izoa i lizoq a temolo
english: Why not teach in the city?

pwn: ayatoa singelit aken ta ko qinaljan,mayanga saljinga to pacikelan ta sikamangoan na qinaljan.

pwn: macaqo son a cemaqis,ti ma na temolo djanoson.

pwn: mavan a ko vovo a vavayan, tjalja macaqoan a cemaqis i ta nia qinaljan ti madjo.

pwn: awmaya izoa so vinalongan a kitolo ta cemaqis?

pwn: ni amen a kakodanan a cemeqis, olja paljazoa za kakodanan ako vinalongan.
english: Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

pwn: sangowa ta tekelen ayco a vinavan ta vaqo.

english: You're really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

pwn: ini, pinaka pitjoljan sa pakaloayi. azoa si kesan sangasan za djowadjoway a paday kesayin patjepeliolj, sa vecelelj sana pasazoay ta pikaq sa kadikadi a cengcengan sa seman lipodropodroin sana ljengoai pasa ta djilong.

pwn: izoa imaza ko kamangolj kata kecang, savid ako sinitalem lja!

pwn: kelo samazao a marasodj, paqenetjo a kemaco a no siporisengsengan.

pwn: oi, sinsi, niya kinaco anga nia siporisengsengan.

pwn: ini inkanan a djemaljon, cemadja anan.

pwn: sao alapo toa sivilavilad toa qayaqayam.

pwn: oi, vaik aken a venilad toa qayaqayam.

pwn: djavadjavai a masantalj, ori vaik itejn a sema toa po qemoziqozipan toco.

pwn: oi! Nangoaq aravac! ori pakatanema itjen a vaik?

pwn: ori maka Baso itjen a vaik.

pwn: a i sangas mana po qayaqayaman, a i tjaivililj mana po qatjovian, sa tjarapacoconi toa marka nemanga.

pwn: inika makoda, sao pacono toa qayaqayam nomaya.

pwn: no cemalivat anga toa ita a zikangan samazai anga a matevetevelj.

pwn: napacon aken toa liyaw a qatjovo, sa izoanan a liyaw a qayaqayam.

pwn: adjeljoayo, ori vaik anga itjen. pakirimo, ori vaik anga itjen.

pwn: tjorovo aravac a caocao a ljemangoljangi imaza.

pwn: qaca aravac a zaljom i zoa, nangoaq a tjaljomaza itjen a ljemangoi.

a nema so pinakavavavan a mangetjez?

ori pakatoa anema son a sema kiyokai?

maka toa anemanema timadjo a magakko?

pwn: maka vavavavaw toa jiyin timadjo a magakko.

pwn: maka otobai timadjo a vaik a veneli ta ljaceng.
english: She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.

pwn: ori maka toa anema son a sema Tao?
english: How are you going to get to Orchid Island?

pwn: ori maka toa varokor aken a sema Tao.

pwn: ori maka toa anema timadjo a sema Tao?
english: How did he get to Orchid Island?

pwn: ori maka hikoki timadjo a sema Tao.

pwn: oi, namaka kisiya timadjo a sema Taito.

pwn: ini, namaka hikoki timadjo a sema Taito.

pwn: neka no ljaljevavavan toa jiyin imaza, amin a maka haiya son.

english: How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?
I will come to Taichung in an hour.

pwn: ki makodakoda no zikangan no maka toa jiyin son a sema toa nia omaq?

pwn: ki izoa 20 no pong a zikang.

pwn: makaya son a ko ki sosoan?
inika makaya, kedri a ko kineljangan.

pwn: pocog son no masokincengelj? pasa vaik a ken a kivala tjanoson?

pwn: ngangoaq, ko kaljavaw son i tjomaq.

pwn: pocog son no tiyaw? pasa kisoso aken toa patjara tja milimilingan a payoan.

pwn: ori sema gado aken no tiyaw, inika ken a i tjomaq dri!
english: I'm going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won't be home.

pwn: na seladenga ken to kemeljang son aravac toa patjara sinankakodan noa payoan zoko, sa ori pasakivadaq a ken tjanoson.

pwn: kedri a ko kinljangan, ljakoa ki ko sipasemalaw a ko kineljang.
english: I don't know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

pwn: djavadjavai aki makaya ken a paiga tjanoson? olja sika tjasaceqalja a po sivecik no tjaivililj.

pwn: izoanga a sivapoljoq saka alo anga ko cavilj toco.

pwn: masan pidalj a kai a so kinasaigo a qivo?

pwn: oi nangoaq. Ka maqacovocovong anan a ken vaivaik a ken a morisacemel a sema vokid.

pwn: pinakalevan, nangoaq aravac a so sinitolo toco.

pwn: namasan paqolid angata a ko siniqaqivo, mana sinitjaocikel noa mareka tja vovo.

pwn: ori tja tjaljomaza anga a tja kaljavar. pinakalevan aravac a so sinitjaocikel.

How much does she owe you?

pwn: makayanga co a kiljacengen a kadropong, azoa a samaq inikanan a makaya a kiljacengen.

pwn: posaladji a ken a pasa kobaw oi?

pwn: liyaw anga a kini ciqaw a pinipidror.

pwn: paka toa vokevok a ken a kiciqaw.
english: I shoot fish with a spear.

pwn: pinaka sinan djalan co noa vavoi.

pwn: pinaka zoanan co noa vavoi, manasika paka zoazonan co noa vavoi
english: These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

pwn: adri tjaljiljiyaw a tja dringai, mato nadjemameq anga toa sacemel.

pwn: mato semqo anga a vato. Ari tja kidjadjalanai.

pwn: aico mana sinan dringai toa paqezetj ta qacailjai, sidringadringai toa kolavaw.

pwn: maleva itjen toa papoloqem noa tja vovo, ljiyaw a tja qadaw toco.

pwn: oidri! tja kacoaw a pakaleva a semaqinaljan.

pwn: ko pasedjamai son toa ko siqoliqolip ota.

pwn: qemacovong anga tja kitolo, kinemenem itjen i djalan pai!

pwn: ori qemacovong anga tja kitolo, pai cevocevongi anga notiav.

pwn: djavadjavai a masantalj, ti Saoniyaw a ko ngadan.

pwn: djavadjavai a masantalj, ti Vais a ko ngadan.
english: Hello everyone, my name is Vais.

kina ken ni Api, ti Tjoko aken.
kaka aken ni Api a tjaljaljak a vavayan, ti Vais a ko ngadan.

pwn: ko sinsi timadjo, ti Koljelje a ngadan.

pwn: ti Tjoko a ngadan na ko kaka a tjavolong a vavayan.

pwn: tima ngadan na so kaka a tjaljaljak a vavayan?

pwn: ti Vais a ngadan na ko kaka a tjaljaljak a vavayan.

pwn: a kemeljang son ta ngadan nimadjo?

pwn: tapoloq saka lima anga a cavilj nimadjo toco.
pida anga a cavilj na so kaka a tjaljaljak a oqaljay toco?

pwn: lima anga a cavilj nimadjo toco.
a izoa no gakko i qinaljan?

pwn: izoa son toa no i qinaljan a gakko a kitolotolo?

pwn: oi, namaya men toa tacekeljan i gakko a kitolotolo.

pwn: ko kaka a tjavolong a vavayan.
ko kaka a tjaljaljak a oqaljay.
a so kaka a tjaljaljak a oqaljay timadjo?
ini, qali na ko kaka a tjaljaljak a oqaljay timadjo.

pwn: a so kaka a tjavolong a vavayan timadjo?

There are five people in their family.

There are four children in our family.

pwn: neka no ko kaka a tjaljaljak a oqaljay, izoa matjelo a ko kaka a tjaljaljak a vavayavayan.

pwn: mapida mareka so kaka a tjavavolongan a oqaljaqaljay a vavayavayan?

pwn: neka no ko kaka a tjavolong a oqaljay a vavayan.

pwn: oi, ko kaka a tjavolong a oqaljay timadjo.
a se paiwan zoko timadjo ota?
ljemaljeqel a pagaljo a kinaqadavan, temekel itjen toa linalja.

pwn: parozemolezol toco a kinaqadavan, semoqaca itjen a temekel toa zaljom.

pwn: mezangal aravac a qadav, paqenetjo a iljaljaong.

pwn: neka no qadav notiav, ori nakemelebav, mezangal a vali.

pwn: ori naljemaljaqel, emoba itjen a casav.

pwn: ori namaljengoaq a qadav no polavalavay.

pwn: oi, ori maljengoaq a qadav toazoa, inika ori qemodjalj.

Yes, it will be rainy that day.

pwn: qemodjaqodjalj anga, inika ken a nakemaco ta kaosoa.

pwn: neka no qodjalj toco, no masokincengelj kiqemodjalj, kemaco itjen sakamaya toa kaosoa.

pwn: no icavilj a kaljaljeqelan ato'i ori ljemaljeqel kemoda?
english: Will it be very cold in winter next year?

pwn: oi, ori ljemaljeqel aravac no icavilj, emitong itjen a pakaliav.

pwn: toco a cavilj a kaljazolzolan 'atoi ori zemolezol?

pwn: oi, ori zomelezol aravac, semoqaca itjen a temekel toa zaljom.
english: Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

pwn: tjengelay aken toa kaljavevean, sarengoaq a vali.

pwn: inika ken a tjengelay toa kaljaoraman, ro vali a kaljaoraman pai.
english: I don't like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.

pwn: inika ken a paqenetj anga kemaco toa laqolj.
english: I forgot to bring the textbook.
I will share it with you.

pwn: inika ken a paqenetj anga a kemaco toa siqoliqolip.
english: I forgot to bring the eraser.

pwn: inika son a paqenetj anga kemaco toa inpic?
english: Do you forget to bring your pen?

pwn: oi, pasedjami aken toa inpic oi?
english: Yes, can you lend me a pen?
What would you like for lunch?
What would you like for dinner?
What did you have for breakfast?

pwn: anema so kinan ta so cengelj?
english: What did you have for lunch?

pwn: nakeman anga ken ta votjolj na koka.

english: You go first and I will catch up later.

pwn: sikoda, vaiki anan a semakoc toa laqolj.
english: No, we have to carry books first.
Not yet. I am doing the dishes.
Did you rinse out your mouth?
Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.
Why didn't you wash your hands?
I will wash my hands later.
What were you doing just now?
I went to meet the teacher.

pwn: ori kemoda son no qemacovong itjen toa tja kitolo i gakko?
english: What are you going to do after school?

pwn: ori kemoda timadjo no qemacovong toa tja kitolo i gakko?
english: What is she doing after school?
She is going to go dancing.

pwn: oi i tjomaq aken, saomaqano a 'irimo.
neka ti Ljomeg i tjomaq! ti Vais aken, kemoda aya son? ko qivoav anga ti Ljomeg no mangtjez i tjomaq.
english: Ljumeg is not at home. I am Vais. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

pwn: vovo, ti Ljomeg kati Vais amen, pai soqeljevi a paljing!
english: Grandma, we are Ljumeg and Vais, please open the door for us.

pwn: ti Vais aken, kemikim aken tjai Koljelje.
english: I am Vais, I am here for Kuljelje.

pwn: vovo, mangtjez aken a kivala tjanoson.
english: Grandma, I am here to see you.

pwn: sicoayan anga so pinangtjezan, nasengelit anga ken tjanoson.
english: You haven't been here for a long time. I missed you so much.
Vais, I am here to play with you.

pwn: saomaqano a kirimo, coayanga ken a kiljaljavaljava tjanoson.
english: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

pwn: avan co a ko sinitalem a vorati, paqayamo a keman pai!
english: This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!

pwn: avan co a qaljemeqem a vorati.
english: The sweet potato is so sweet.

pwn: ido! paqayamo a keman toa ko sinitalem a kodamono.
english: Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

pwn: qiladjo! paqayamo a keman toca ko sinitalem a poday!
english: Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.

pwn: owa! avanco a qaljemaqem a poday.
english: Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

pwn: inika ken a maqati a keman toa tjianes, avan a pingko a keman aken.
english: I can't eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.

pwn: oi, tjengelay aken a keman toa piyapiya.
english: Sure, I like it very much.

pwn: ko sitjoljaan son toa kodamono toa so kanen.
english: Let me peel the fruit for you.

pwn: masalo, avanco a poqetim a kodamono.
english: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.

pwn: ko sialapan son toa zaljom toa so tekelen.
english: I will bring you some water.

pwn: soliavo a keman, napakaliav aken a seman djamay.
english: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.
Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.

pwn: soliavo a keman, liav anan a kinsa imaza.
english: Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.

pwn: saka inika ken na ori malomalj!
english: I'll make myself at home then.

pwn: soliavo a keman, liav anan a imaza.
english: Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

pwn: nasemoliav anga ken, inika ken a maqati anga patjaizoa a keman.
english: I ate a lot and couldn't eat any more.

pwn: toco a qadav ori kacoin mon ni sinsi a sema gade.
english: I will take you to the mountains today.

pwn: liav a cacalag i gade aya ti 'ina.
english: Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

pwn: toco a qadav ori kacoin mom ni sinsi a sema vavoa.
english: I will take you to the fields.

pwn: a vaik itjen a temovolj ta qipo?
english: Are we going to loosen the soil?

pwn: ori sema ino itjen toco a qadav?
ori kacoin itjen ni sinsi a sema pana.
english: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

pwn: ori kacoin itjen ni sinsi a sema gade.
english: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.

pwn: a ori sema pana itjen toco a qadav?
english: Are we going to the riverside today?

pwn: a ori vaik itjen a sema gade toco a qadav?
english: Are we going to the mountains today?

pwn: ini, ori vaik itjen a sema vavoa toco a qadav.
english: No, we are going to the fields.

pwn: sinsi, anema ori tja paconan i pana?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?
We are going to see dragonflies.

pwn: sinsi, anema ori tja paconan i gade?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?

pwn: vaik itjen a pacon toa kadjiadji.
english: We are going to see butterflies.

pwn: ori kemoda itjen a sema vavoa?
english: What are we going to do in the fields?

pwn: ori vaik itjen a pacon toa tja sinitalem a poday, kinemnem itjen toa sasiq, tjainan pai!
english: We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

pwn: sinsi, a vaik itjen a sema pana a emave'av/ljemangoy?
english: Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?

pwn: ini, ori vaik itjen a pacon toa qoljicacenglav.
english: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

pwn: sinsi, a vaik itjen a sema vavoa a temalen toa ljaceng?
english: Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?

pwn: itjen a vaik a temovolj ta qipo.
english: We are going to loosen the soil today.

pwn: tjaopacon aken toa qaqolidan a valjoaljot a qoljicacenglav.
english: Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

pwn: yi! wa! tjengelay aken aravac toa kadjiadji, bolay aravac.
english: Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

pwn: ozai a za minlayalayap a kadjiadji.

english: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

pwn: tjimazao a pacon, maya vaivaik a sema cadja yo!
english: Come here and take a look. Don't go too far!

pwn: oi, inika men a ori vaik a ljiacadja.
english: Got it, we won't go anywhere too far.

pwn: inika tjen a mekekelj, gemaljo itjen a djemavac avan a se'olilj son.
english: Don't run and walk slowly lest you fall down.
I want to see them right away.

pwn: anema ori so pakazoanan a sema tapav?
english: How do you go to the block-house?

pwn: onting aken ta sidosiya a sema tapav.
anema ori pakazoanan a sema biyoing nimadjo?
english: How does he go to the hospital?

pwn: anema ori so pakazoanan a sema bokoto?
english: How do you go to Penghu?

pwn: maka hikoki aken a sema bokoto. maka hikoki aken a sema bokoto.
english: I go to Penghu by plane.

pwn: ori maka gongkang aken a sema bokoto.
english: I go to Penghu by boat.

pwn: anema ori so pakazoanan a tjomaq?
ori maka kisiya ken a tjomaq.
anema ori pakazoanan ni Saoniyaw a sema gakko?
english: How does Sauniyaw go to school?

pwn: ori maka kisia ti Saniyaw a sema gakko.
english: Saniyaw goes to school by train.

pwn: anema ori pakazoanan ni Api a sema kiyokai?
english: How does Api go to church?

pwn: ori maka palidring ti Api a sema kiyokai.
english: Api goes to church by bicycle.

pwn: a namaka Jiyin son a sema gakko?
english: Do you go to school by MRT?

pwn: ini, ori maka baso aken a sema gakko.
english: No, I go to school by bus.

pwn: a namaka palidring son a sema gakko?
english: Do you go to school by bicycle?

pwn: oi, namaka palidring aken a sema gakko.
english: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

pwn: a namaka kaoti son a sema Takav?
english: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

pwn: oi, ori maka kaoti aken a sema Takav.
english: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

pwn: a namaka kisiya son mano namaka hikoki son a sema Kacedas?
english: Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

pwn: namaka hikoki aken, tja djaljav a maka hikoko toa kisiya.
english: I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

pwn: a namaka baso son mano naonting son toa haiya a sema kiyokai?
english: Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

pwn: naonting aken toa haiya a sema kiyokai, tja djaljav a onting toa maka baso.
english: I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

pwn: a djemet a siyobai toa no omaq?
english: Is the market close to your house?

pwn: inika djemet, maka otobatobai aken a sema siyobai.
english: No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

pwn: a djemet a iyobingkiyoko toa gakko?
english: Is the post office close to the school?
Yes, it is within walking distance.

pwn: a djemet a kakanan toa tisaba?
english: Is the restaurant close to the station?

pwn: djemavac itjen a palamo satje djemaljon.
english: It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.

pwn: a pocog son toco a qadav?
pasa vaik aken a kivala tjanoson.
english: I would like to visit you.

pwn: izoa ko saliman toco a qadav, avanai anga notjaivililj.
english: I am out today. How about another day?

pwn: sa izoa so zikang notiav? notiav a masokincenglj ko imav anga.
english: Then, are you available tomorrow? I'll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

pwn: maqati a notiav, pai ko kiljaljavai anga i tjomaq.
english: Sure, I will wait for you at home.

pwn: a maqati aken a lemoing? ori povecik aken.
english: Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.
Would you mind if I do the video recording?

pwn: inika ken a bolabolai, inika namapalimasodj a i paponemangamangan ota, mayanan wa!
english: No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn't been tidied up yet.
Then I will just take photos.

pwn: masalo toa maqati aken a kivadaq tjanoson.
english: Thank you for accepting the interview.
You are welcome. What would you like to know?

pwn: ko kivadaqay anema so sengesengan ta maqacovocovong son?
english: What do you do when you are young?

pwn: kisaco aken tasicoayan, ljakoa na taigo anga ken toco.
english: I was a police officer but I am retired now.
Then, are you working at the moment?

pwn: i gakko aken toco a kiposengsengan.
a i qinaljan a so aljak aota?
english: Do your kids live in the tribe too?

pwn: ini, i rizok a ko aljak.
english: No, my kids are all living in the city.
Then, do you live by yourself?

pwn: izoa ko paqoziqozip a vato a ita katoa qayaqayam a ita, namaya toa ko sikatacemekeljan tiamadjo.
english: I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

pwn: izoa ko paqoziqozipen a ita a ngiyav aota, no izoa qemoziqozip a tja saladj inika tjen a masepelj.
english: I have a cat too. I won't get bored with the company of my pet.

pwn: pasakivadaq aken toa paatjano palisi noa qemaljop.
english: I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

pwn: inika liav a ko kinljang, ljakoa aza ko inljangan maqati ken sakamaya temevela.
english: I don't know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

pwn: azoa no siqaljoqaljop a saozayan anema zoa a palisi?
english: Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

pwn: azoa nia siqaljoqaljop a saozayan inika maqati a vavayan a idjadjas.
english: Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

pwn: saka a maqati a vavayan a qemaljop?
english: Then, can women go hunting together?

pwn: nakoya, inika maqati a vavayan a qemaljop.
english: No, women cannot go hunting either.

pwn: Itjing, neka anga no tja vawa i tjomaq, sao viliyo.
english: Itjing, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

pwn: izoa anan a tjanoita i esan, mayanan a veneli!
english: There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

pwn: inika qacovong a tjanoita, vaiko sakamaya a veneli to tjanodrosa.
english: One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

pwn: veneli aken ta vawa, a paveliveli mon?
english: I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?
Yes! How many bottles do you need?

pwn: veneli aken to tjanodrosa, sana veneli anan ta paday to tjanoita i lobok.
english: I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

pwn: izoa a paday imaza, anemanan a ori so veliin ota?
english: Here is the rice, what else do you need?

pwn: kinaveneli anan toa qacilo, a izoa nan a qacilo?
english: I want some eggs too, do you have some?

pwn: ori veneli aken toa itong ota.
english: I want to buy some clothes.
What kind of clothes do you like?

pwn: ori veneli aken ta itong a hansodi.
english: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

pwn: aico a qodjidjilj a itong, pakanangoaq son?
a izoa anan a zoma a qoljav?
izoa anan a voqavoqalj katoa cangiangiya a qoljav.
english: We have white and blue ones too.

pwn: avanai azoa cangiyangiya a ko veliin.
english: Please give me the clothes in blue.

pwn: Poljaljoyan, nakasinoson tasaoni? navaik son a ondo?
english: Puljaljuyan, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

pwn: ini, navaik aken a posaladj tjai vovo a paveli toa ljacong.
english: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

pwn: ai manomaya, izoa so zikang no qazemetj? pangtjezo anga kaiv.
english: No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

pwn: inika maqati, ori vaik aken a veneli toa itong.
english: No, I want to buy some clothes.
Then, I will go with you.

pwn: navenala son, pidapida co a itavatjoan a ljaceng?
english: Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?
The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.
How much are these sweet potatoes?

pwn: no ita tjingtjingan tjelo a poloq.
english: Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

pwn: paveli aken to drosa vatjoan ta ljaceng katoa ita tjingtjingan a vorati nomaya.
english: Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

pwn: Comai, inika ken a paqenetj anga kemaco toa inpic, a maqati a so pasedjaman aken?
english: Cumai, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

pwn: neka no ko inpic, ni Keljeng co a inpic.
english: I don't have one either. This is Keljeng's.

pwn: sa'a maqati a so pasedjaman aken a palamo? ko pacikelav anga nosaoni.
english: Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

pwn: masalo, masalo ayao anga nomaya ti Keljeng.
english: Thank you and thank Keljeng for me.

pwn: ori pacikel aken toca drosa a laqolj.
english: I want to return these two books.
No problem and what else do you need?

pwn: ori kisedjam anan aken toa tjelo a laqolj.
english: I would like to borrow these three books.

pwn: oi pai. no makatjelolj paqenetjo a pacikel.
english: Sure and remember to return them after three days.

pwn: inika na so pacikel toa siqoliqolip tjanoaken.
english: You haven't returned me the eraser.

pwn: naowa, awa nekanga azoa ko siqoliqolip.
english: Then, why is my eraser missing?

pwn: aigo so sinipasedjam anga tjai Api.
english: Did you lend it to Api?

pwn: inika ken a kemeljang. vaik aken a kivadaq tjaimadjo.
english: I don't know. I will go and ask her.

pwn: ko sipasedjaman anan a ko siqoliqolip tjanoson.
english: I will lend you my eraser first.

pwn: Keljeng, a ti Koljelje a napasedjam tjanoson toca oba?
english: Keljeng, did Kuljelje lend you this coat?
No, my mom bought it for me.

pwn: pailja mamav ca no oba kati Koljelje.
english: Kuljelje's coat is the same as yours.

pwn: qecengecengel a oba nimadjo, maretimalji a qoljav na nia oba.
english: His coat is black, so our colors are different.

pwn: Paoles, a nakisedjam son tjai Comai ta paiso?
english: Paules, did you borrow money from Cumai?

pwn: izoa, ori ko cogan timadjo toco a qadav, mano inika ken a paqenetj anga kemaco toa paiso.
english: Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.
Then, when will you return the money?
I will return to him tomorrow.

pwn: oi ko qivoavanga nomaya ti Comai.
english: Okay, I will tell Cumai for you.

pwn: azoa bisangay tja podringayan ta qecev, azoa padjavatan tja podringayan ta seloc avanazao qoqolidan.
english: It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

pwn: manomaya, pacevacevak aken! djaljepan inika ken a djemamadjamaq.
english: No wonder! I am mistaken and that's why I cannot catch any of them.

pwn: ko tolowai anga son a momalj toazoa masanmosalj to kemoda semanaya.
english: Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

pwn: wa! penakaleva aravac! no podringay aken notjaivililj tjara iken a makadjamaq anga.
english: Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

pwn: qaqacan anga ravac alja cemel i vavoa, sao alapo ta drokodrokong a ma obav, itjen a vaik a mavavoa.
english: The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let's go to the fields.

pwn: izoa i ljaqediqedi ta dradra'oyan, no semaomaqan son ta obav isopaconi.
english: It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

pwn: kinemenem itjen a malap, avan a mavociq son, radjai aravac a dro'odro'ong.
english: Be careful and don't get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

pwn: inika tja djoladjolatan a ko dringay!

english: My trap is under that tree.

pwn: ko pinokeljangan a pimaza, kemeljang aken to ko pinino a dringay.
english: I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

pwn: romoe aico, tja sikiciqaciqav co a mapana.
english: This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

pwn: neka no nia romoe, no kiciqav amen avan a sipanadinadip a izoa.
english: We don't have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

pwn: inika napavala a semeljodj toa sipanadinadip, toloi anga ken notjaivililj oi?
english: I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

pwn: oi lja! ari vaiki anga notjaivililj a panadip.
english: Sure! Let's go fishing together next time.

pwn: saka ko tolowai anga notjaivililj toa seman romoe.
english: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

pwn: milaloaloag anga so panadip, tjara izoa anga ciqav a namakelai! pakirimo a remakac.
english: Your fishing rod is moving. Isn't the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

pwn: galjoanan, midradroqai aravac ca vare'or. tjimazaken a remakac toa panadip, sao sazoao a malap toa ami.
english: Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

pwn: rakaco a pasa maza alja ciqav, ko posaladjai anga remakac.
english: Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

pwn: aitja nangoaq aota! napakaliav itjen toco a qadav, namapeljoq anga ca tja poror.
english: Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

pwn: pai cikeli a kirimo sa tja pangapangalji a masantalj.
english: Let's go back immediately and share it with everyone.

pwn: mayanga kivangavang, kirimo qiladjo a sema toa so qiladjan.
english: Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

pwn: sikamasan pidalj a qadav toco ta tapolavayan?
sikamasanlimalj toco a qadav, polavay notoav, ari kivangavangi!
english: It's Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let's go out and play together!
Great! Let's go to the riverside.

pwn: sikamasan pidalj a qadav notiav ta tapolavayan?
english: What day will it be tomorrow?

pwn: sikamasantjelolj notiav ta tapolavayan, vaikianga seman mali no masokincengelj!
english: Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let's go play ball tomorrow afternoon!

pwn: anema ori so salima notiav a kadjamadjaman?
english: What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

pwn: polavalavay notiav, ori vaik aken kati kina a sema kiokay.
english: Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

pwn: pasa motjaq aken, vaik aken a sema binziyo.
english: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

pwn: sinsi, saketjo a ko tjialj, vaik a ken a sema binziyo.
english: Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

pwn: a maqati aken a sema binziyo?
english: May I go wash my hands?

pwn: ori, qemacovong anga tja kitolo vaiko anga nosaoni.
english: It's almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

pwn: sinsi, saqetjo a ko qolo, polavay aken no nomasokincengelj.
english: It's almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.
Okay, take care and go home.

pwn: sinsi, ori polavay aken no tjaivililj ta sangasangasan na tapolavayan, vaik aken a kipocemel.
english: Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

pwn: saqetjoqetjo a tjialj nimadjo, sa izoa timadjo i binziyo.
english: She has a stomachache. She's in the restroom.

pwn: sinsi, saqetjoqetjo a liqe ni Poljaljoyan, sa napolavay toco a qadav.
english: Teacher, Puljaljuyan has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

pwn: ti Tjanobak a lja Tjaloigi aken, tapoloq anga ko cavilj toco.
english: My name is Tjanubak Tjaluigi, and I'm 10 years old.

pwn: ti Tjanobak a lja Tjaloigi a ken.

english: What ethnic group are you from?

pwn: a kacalisian a mareka so sikatacemekeljan?
english: Are all your family members indigenous?

pwn: oi, paiwan zoko amen a tacekeljan.
english: Yes, my whole family is Paiwan.

pwn: ini, paiwan zoko a ko kama, pairang a ko kina.
english: No, my father is Paiwan, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

pwn: aljak aken ni Camak a lja Tjaloigi.
english: I am Camak a lja Tjaluig's child.

pwn: a so kama azoa? pida anga cavilj nimadjo?
english: Is that your father? How old is he?

pwn: onem a poloq anga cavilj nimadjo.
ini, nia ramaljemaljeng timadjo i qinaljan, alo a poloq anga cavilj nimadjo.
english: No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

pwn: pida anga cavilj noa so kaka a tjavolong tjanoson a oqaljay?
tapoloq saka alo anga cavilj noa ko kaka a tjavolong tjanoaken a oqaljay.
a liav a cavilj a sikatjavolong tjanoson noa so kaka a oqaljay a tjavolong tjanoson?
english: Is your brother much older than you?

pwn: taiday saka sepatj a poloq a ko kinaqaca.

english: I haven't seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

pwn: oi, taiday saka tjelo a poloq anga ko kinaqaca.
oi, tjelo a poloq anga ko kinasadjelong toco.
vaik aken a sema kakizoanan a kiposalima noa sinsi a kemim tja sinsi.
english: I'm going to the office to see the teacher.

pwn: ori vaik a veneric toa cemel.
english: He's going to throw away the trash.

pwn: izoa i ljaljangoyan timadjo, ori malalomalj ta ljemangoy timadjo nosaoni.
english: He's at the swimming pool. He's going to compete in a swimming competition later.

pwn: ino ti Moni? ori malalomalj ta mekelj timadjo nosaoni.
english: Where is Muni? She's going to compete in a running competition later.

pwn: izoa timadjo ta kakateveteveljan, ko vaikav a qivo timadjo.
english: She's in the auditorium. I'll go call her.
Let's go to the playground together.

pwn: vaik anan aken a veneli ta ko cengelj, ko kimav anga son nosaoni.
english: I'll go buy lunch first, and then I'll meet you later.

pwn: pay ari tja qaloav a tja binto!
english: Let's carry the lunch boxes together!

pwn: kimo ta zoma, ori vaik aken a kemim ta sinsi.
english: You find someone else, I'm going to find the teacher.

pwn: Poljaljoyan a ori malalomalj toco ta coitjio?
english: Is Puljaljuyan competing in croquet today?
No, he's competing in high jump.

pwn: no ondokay toazoa i qadav a izoa ori so kicapiljen?
english: Will you compete in the sports day?

pwn: izoa, ori kisaseljang aken toa malalomalj ta makelj.
ori kisaseljang aken toa malalomalj na coitjio.
ori kemoda itjen no ondokadokay i qadav?
english: What will we do in the sports day?
We will compete in tug of war.

pwn: a ori paveli tjen toa kakanen no ondokadokay?
english: Will we sell food at the sports day?

pwn: ini, ori paveli amen toa tjabolobololj.

english: Congratulations on getting first place! You're amazing!

pwn: a izoa i tjomaq ti vovo i vavayan?

english: Yes, she's sleeping in her room.

pwn: neka, tjao vaik a casav, no qazemezemetjang kimangetjez.
english: No, she's not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

pwn: a izoa i tjomaq ti vovo i oqaljay?
ozai i tjaivavao sao kimo a sema vavao timadjo.
english: He's upstairs. You can go up and find him.

pwn: ti Poljaljoyan, sicoayan anga ko pinaconan tjanoson, na venala son?
english: It's Puljaljuyan. I haven't seen you in a while! How have you been?

pwn: na venala ken! kemim aken tjanoson a maljavar.
english: I'm doing great! I came to chat with you.

pwn: seman djamadjamay i kakesan timadjo, ko vaikav a qivo.
english: He's in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

pwn: na vaik anga semaino ti Moni?
vaikanga sema pokokan a djemekep ta koka timadjo.
english: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

pwn: neka i tjemaq a no vava a oqaljay, vaik anga sema vavoa, tjitjomatjomaqo a kitjekaljava ta mangetjez timadjo.
english: Your grandfather is not at home. He's in the field. Wait for him to come back.

pwn: sicoayan anga ko pinaconan tjanoson, nameqacanga son.
english: I haven't seen you in a while. You've grown taller.

pwn: maleva ken aravac a pacon tjanoson.
english: It's so good to see you.

pwn: ko sipavavay aico a pangodralj tjanomon, pasa zoaoanga ta pingsiang.
english: Here's a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

pwn: coacoayanga inika mangtjengtjez, ko qaqivoav tiamadjo a mapoljat ta keman.
english: It's been a while. Let's have a meal together.

pwn: maya mavarong, nangoaq a temekel aken ta otja kaljavaljavari a sema polaolangan.
english: No need to bother. I'll just have tea. Let's sit in the living room and chat.

pwn: masalo ta so paiadja, ori vaik anga ken a cemikel.
english: Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

pwn: tjao papacain aico a koka, kacoanga cemikel ljengoaqoanga keman.
english: This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

pwn: kicon aken tjanoson ta notiav a masokincengelj oi?
english: Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

pwn: ecevongianga i gakko oi? ori seman iga men.
english: How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

pwn: sazoai i dradraiyanan nomaya, ori penaiwanan aken.
english: Then let's go to the community center. I'll wear folk costume.

pwn: bolay aravac no matelak a nia sakora i qinaljan, no padjaljon anga toazoa pangtjezoanga kemim tjanoaken.
english: The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

pwn: no maitazoa ikiljaljava ta kaljaveveanang, kigemaljoanga!
english: That would have to wait until spring. It's too late, isn't it?
Then come during our Harvest Festival!
Alright! I'm looking forward to it!

pwn: akoazoa lja cemikel son a sema qinaljan a kikavaljotan.
english: May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?
I want to return to teach at the local school.

pwn: akoazoa lja inika son a sema lizok a temolo?
english: Why not teach in the city?

pwn: ayatoa nasengelit aken toa ko qinaljan,na saljinga ken ta pasocikel toa ko picol ta qinaljan aota.
english: Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

pwn: macaqo son aravac a tjemenon, tima na temalo tjanoson?
english: You're very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

pwn: ko vovo a vavayan, tjalja macaqoan timadjo a tjemenon i qinaljan tjanoamen.
english: It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

pwn: akoazoa pasa kitolo son ta tjemenon?
english: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

pwn: nia kakodan a tjemenon,olja nia sipatatavelak a nia kakodan aya ko kininemeneman.
english: Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

pwn: macaqo son aravac, a coacoay a venawa to aico?
english: You're really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

pwn: ini, kitjara tapolavayan, tja kesain anan a djoadjoai a paday katoa paday,sa tja patataoden ata djolis, no maitazoa maqati anga pasa djilongen.
english: No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

pwn: izoa silji katoa lociao,tiaken a na temalem.
english: I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

pwn: pida avelian no co a masanmosalj?
drosaiday saka lima poloq a penoljat.
tjengelay aken to aico a itong, pida a avelian?
english: I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

pwn: pazangal aravac,a maqati a ljiatekeanan a kavelian?
english: It's too expensive. Can't you lower the price a bit?

pwn: inika maqati, masipon aken no patjaiteko anan.
english: No, if I lower it further, I'll lose money.

pwn: oi! avanazoa a qacengecengal a ko veliyen.
english: Alright then, I'll take a black piece of clothing.

pwn: tjengelay aken toa aico a siqono katoa padriyok.
english: I want this knife and this pot.

pwn: drosa kozolj a penoljat, tiaken a namalang, kicoacoay a so sicekaokao.
english: It's a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

pwn: ko sipasemalavan toa mareka koqali to veneli,a maqati a memadjolo anan.
english: I'll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?
Alright! I'll give you a 20% discount.

pwn: ido pacono ta sipaveliveli a itong katoa tjalopong.
english: Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

pwn: no ita itong tjelo a iday saka lima poloq, no tjelo kozolj.
english: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

pwn: veneli aken to ita, pavai aken ta vaqoan.
english: I'll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

pwn: djavadjavay, pasa veneli aken toa djoadjoay a paday katoa votjolj.
english: Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

pwn: mapoljatanga paday, izoa anan a ciniyan a tjanaq,veneli son?
english: The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

pwn: oi, paveli aken to ita, venelianga ken no tjaivililj ta paday.
english: Alright, please give me one. I'll come back next time to buy rice.

pwn: oi, ko polobolobokay nomaya, nomaitoco lima poloq.
english: Okay, I'll pack it in a bag for you. That'll be 50 dollars.

pwn: nasoljivat mon. toco ori patagilj a nga itjen.
english: Hello everyone. Now we are going to start.

pwn: nasoljivat mon. toco ori temolo ti sinsi tjanomon toa kemoda a qivo ta lami na kacalisiyan.
english: Hello everyone. Today I am going to teach you how to say Paiwan for food.

pwn: polingalingav mon ta kai ni sinsi?
english: Do you understand what the teacher says?

pwn: sinsi, inika ken a polingalingav. makaya son a qivo a kingtalj anga?
english: I don't understand. Can you repeat it again?

pwn: inika ken a lemangdanda, makaya pasiqaca a pagaljo?
english: I can't hear you, can you speak louder?

pwn: pai pacono a pasa maza! kisaseljango tjanoaken a semopo.
english: Look here, please! Repeat after me.

pwn: sopo-o a kingtalj anga. pai pasiqaca-o.
english: Read it again. Please speak louder.

pwn: sinsi, malim anga ken a kemaco ta ko inpic.
english: I forgot to bring my pen.

pwn: sinsi, malim anga ken a kemaco ta si'oli'olip.
english: I forgot to bring my eraser.

pwn: kisedjamo tjai tjaqedjiqedji a so salasaladj.
english: Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

pwn: sipotidetideqan anga zikan toa tja kitolo.
tja patjemaza-o a tja kitolo, cevocevongi anga no tjaivililj.
english: Class dismissed, see you next week.

pwn: aljak aken ni masegseg, ti koi aken.
english: I am masegseg's son, my name is kui.

pwn: sito aken ni masegseg, ti koi aken.
english: I am a student of tjanubak, my name is kui.
Who is he? He is baru.

pwn: ko kaka timadjo, ti camak timadjo.
english: He's my brother, his name is camak.

pwn: oi, ti camak a ngadan nimadjo.
ti camak a ngadan nimadjo? ini, ti koi a ngadan nimadjo.
english: Is his name camak? No, his name is Kui.

pwn: ti pales timadjo. ti kina i pales.
english: She's pales. she's my aunt pales.

pwn: ko drava timadjo, ti moni a ngadan nimadjo.
english: She is my friend, her name is muni.

pwn: tapoloq kato drosa a cavilj nimadjo.
lima a poloq a cavilj ni kama.

english: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

pwn: izoa madrosa tia kaka kata ko kaka a macidjilj.
english: I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.

pwn: neka a ko kaka a oqaljay.

english: How many people are in your family?
There are four of us in our family.

pwn: anema a sengsengan ni tjama i koi?
english: What does your uncle Kui do for a living?

pwn: izoa a sengsengan ni so kaka?
english: Does your sister have a job?

pwn: oi, paiwan zoko aken a kacalisian.
english: Yes, I am an aboriginal of the Paiwan tribe.

pwn: oi, tiamen a tacekeljan 'aca'aca amen a mapoljat.
english: Yes, we are all very tall.

pwn: kitolotolo anga a so kaka i gakko?
english: Does your sister go to school?

pwn: oi, kitolotolo anga i gakko timadjo.
macaqo a kemacalisianan a so kaka?
english: Do your siblings speak the language?
Yes, they speak the ethnic language.
How many brothers and sisters do you have?
I have three brothers and sisters.
Do you live with your parents?

pwn: oi, nakiteveljan aken ta ko matjaljaljak.
english: Yes, I live with my mom and dad.
Do you live with your grandparents?

pwn: ini, inika ken a nakitateveljan tjaimadjo.
english: No, I didn't live with them.

pwn: nakiteveljan aken tjai kama kina kaka a oqaljay.
english: I live with my father, mother and brother.

pwn: nongida vaik son a sema qinaljan?
english: When are you going back to the tribe?

pwn: no polavalavay toa kaljazalanzangan vaik aken sa kamaya.
english: I will go back in the summer.

pwn: tevota anga a qadav, nazalangzan a kinaqadavan.
english: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.
Is it going to be cold outside?
It's very cold, so wear lots of clothes.

pwn: toco a voaq inika vocelelj inika zalangzang, nasolapelj.
english: It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

pwn: toco a vengin namakoda a kinaqadavan?
neka no qerepos i kalevelevan, tevotavota a qiljas.
english: There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

pwn: tjao meljay a qadav kasawni, maqadav anga, tevotanga a 'oljivangeraw.
english: The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.

pwn: namakoda a kinaqadavan izoa i tjanoson?
english: What's the weather like where you are?
We're going to have a big storm here.
Good, the sun is coming out.

pwn: vocelelj a kinaqadavan, itong ngo a pakaliyav.
english: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

pwn: ori vaik anga ken a sema masasaw.
nosaoni palj'aca a qemodjalj, paqenetjo anga kemaco ta qaosoa.
english: It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.
There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.

pwn: namaya ta naqemodjalj anga, teveteveng a djalan.
english: It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

pwn: naqemodjalj? ako saljeveljever a so kinacavacavan?
english: Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

pwn: qemodjaqodjalj a i sasaw, inika ken a namasi qaosoa.
english: It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

pwn: kodral a vali, saqetjo a ko qolo ta vinalian.
english: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

pwn: paramor a qadav, malingac a ko qolo ta kinirasian.
english: The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.

pwn: malim anga ken a kemaco ta ko inpic.
english: I forgot to bring my pen.

pwn: malim anga ken a kemaco ta ko qecap.
english: I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

pwn: inika ken a nakemaco, vaiki a kiveli.
english: I don't have one either, let's go buy one.

pwn: makaya vaik itjen a kiveli ta inpic?
english: Let's go buy a pen, shall we?

pwn: oi, ori veneli anan aken ta si'oli'olip.
english: Well, I still have to buy erasers.

pwn: ari vaiki a kiveli ta kenamain?
english: Come on, let's go get some breakfast, shall we?

pwn: caqen, nakeman anga ken i tjomaq.
english: No, I've already eaten at home.

pwn: malim anga ken a semljec ta ko binto.
english: I forgot to steam my lunchbox.

pwn: malim anga ken a kemaco ta ko binto.
english: I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

pwn: pai kani a madroa ta ko binto.
english: Then let's eat my lunch box together!

pwn: ori anema so kanen no kingcengecengelj?
english: What are you having for lunch?

pwn: keman aken ta cengelj i gakko.
english: I want a nutritious school lunch.

pwn: anema ori so kanen no kincengelj?
english: What are you having for lunch?

pwn: nakemaco aken ta binto, kanianga madrosa.
english: I've brought a lunchbox today, let's eat together at noon!
Come on, let's go play basketball, shall we?
Please help me with the broom.

pwn: oi, ko sipavayan tjanoson aico a ljaljomay.
english: Okay, here's a broomstick for you.
Can you get me a rag, please?

pwn: semoasoap aken, alapan aken ayao ti koi.
english: I'm sweeping the floor, you ask Kui to help you.

pwn: qiljaqiljan aico a kasintan, sao zokingoanan.
english: The floor is dirty, go clean it.

pwn: oi, vaik aken a malap ta zoking.
english: Okay, I'll go get the cloth.
That window is very dirty, go clean it.

pwn: mayanan, ini anan ako makasoap tai maza.
english: Wait a minute, I'm not done sweeping here yet.

pwn: ori vaik aken a karim tjai sinsi.
english: I'm going to see my teacher.

pwn: no nakemasi gakko son ori kemodad son?
english: What do you do after school?

pwn: ori vaik amen kata ko salasalad a semenay.
english: I'm going to sing with my friends.

pwn: no nakemasi gakko timadjo ori kemoda?

english: She's at home, please come in.
May I ask if Ljavaus is at home?
She's not here, what can I do for you?

pwn: vovo, ti pales aken soqeljevi a paljing.
english: Grandpa, I'm pales please open the door.

pwn: patagaw, ti pales aken, mori kivangavang aken tjanoson.
english: patagaw, I'm pales, I've come to play with you.

pwn: coacoay anga itjen a inika mecevang.
oi lja! nasinglit aken tjanoson. pai keljo pasalinglingliti.
english: Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let's chat!
Please sit down and have some tea.

pwn: o! sangoaq aravc a no qociya.
oi! napesangoaq notjapaconan aico a kodamono.
nakemesa anga ti kina ta kaiven, keljo kano!
english: Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!

pwn: kano a pakaliyav, ini son a 'ali'ali.
english: Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you're not an outsider.

pwn: liyav anga ko kinan, maveto anga ken aravac.
english: I ate a lot, I was very full.

pwn: ori vaik anga ken, ko ljizavao anga son notjaivililj.
english: I'm leaving, I'll see you next time.

pwn: salilim anga, vaik anga ken a tjomaq.
oi, no izoa so zikang keljo anga a kivangavang.
english: Okay, come to my house sometime.

pwn: nasoljivat mon. toco a voaq ori kemaco ti sinsi tjanomon a sema qinaljan a kivadaq ta vavolongan.
english: Hello everyone, today I'm taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

pwn: pai pariya! ori kiqaqivoan amen ta vavolongan toa pinayoanan a kai.
english: Okay! We have to speak Paiwanese to the seniors.

pwn: vovo, mangtjez amen a ljemizav tjanoson.
english: Grandpa, we've come to see you.

pwn: na! mano macaqo mon a kemacalisianan a qivo ayao! qa! pai pariyangata!
english: You guys speak Paiwanese! That's great!

pwn: nasoljivat mon. toco a voaq ori kacoin mon ni sinsi a sema povaqoan a masengseng.
english: Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

pwn: keljo samazao a matjatjiljitiljv, pa'enetjo anga kemaco ta notorivecan.
english: Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

pwn: oi sinsi, nia inalapanga a nia torivecan.
english: Yes, sir, we've got our tools.
Not yet, it's still far away.
You go get the bird catcher.
Okay, I'll go and catch the birds.

pwn: nasoljivat mon. toco ori vaik itjen a sema zoa itoa kakatalidoan toa 'emozi'ozip.
english: Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.

pwn: aico a pariya! aki anema ori tja pakazoanan a sema zoa ayao?
english: Awesome! How are we going to get there?

pwn: tjevavav itjen ta baso a sema zoa.
matatiljitiljivo, ori padolo-i anga itjen a kiveli ta kipo.
english: Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

pwn: a i tjaiqayav mareka qayaqayam, a i tjailikoz mareka 'atjovi, talido a kisomadjo.
english: There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.
It doesn't matter, then you go and watch the birds.

pwn: no djemaljon ta icizikang pangtjez-i anga ki'epoan.
english: We'll be back in an hour.

pwn: napacon aken ta liyav a 'atjovi, izoa ota liyav a 'aya'ayam.
english: I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.
Hurry up, we have to go.
Wait for me, my feet are tired.

pwn: ari seljangi a vaik a ljemangoy?
tjorovo a cawcao imaza a ljemangoljangoy.
english: There are a lot of people swimming here.

pwn: vacalj a izoa zaljom, tjemaza-i sakamaya a ljemangoy.
english: The water is deep there, so we just swim here.
What kind of car did you take?

pwn: anema so tjevavavan a sema kiokay?
english: What bus do you take to church?

pwn: pivavaven aken ta zidosia ni kama a sema zoa.
nokazomazoman kemoda timadjo a sema gakko?
english: How does he usually go to school?

pwn: tjevavav toa napatjatjeketjak a tjatjevavavan timadjo a sema kakitoloan.
english: He took the subway to school.

pwn: kemoda ti so vovo no vaik a kiveli ta ljaceng?
english: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?

pwn: ki'otobay timadjo no vaik a kiljaceng.
english: She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.

pwn: ori kemoda son a vaik a sema Langi?
english: How are you going to get to Orchid Island?

pwn: ori tjevavav aken ta varokor a sema Langi.
english: I want to take a boat to Lanyu.

pwn: ori kemoda timadjo a vaik a sema Langi?
english: How did he get to Orchid Island?

pwn: tjevavav ta hikoki a sema Langi timadjo.
english: He took a plane to Orchid Island.

pwn: anema a ori tjevavavan nimadjo a sema Takao?
english: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?

pwn: tjevavav ta tjaljasaljiokan a sema Takao timadjo.
english: He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.

pwn: natjevavav ta kisia a sema Taito timadjo?
english: Did he take a train to Taitung?

pwn: oi, natjevavav ta kisia a sema Taito timadjo.
english: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.

pwn: natjevavav ta kisia timadjo a pasa Taito?
english: Did he take a train to Taitung?

pwn: ini, natjevavaw timadjo toa hikoki a sema Taito.
english: No, he took a plane to Taitung.

pwn: izoa a ljaljevavavan ta baso i dodot ta ico imaza?
english: Is there a bus stop near here?

pwn: izoa, kisoso-o a sema 'ayav ki son a pacon toa ljaljevavavan ta baso.
english: Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

pwn: aico a imaza ino a tjaljadodotan ta napatjatjaketjak a tjatjevavavan?
english: Where is the nearest MRT station?

pwn: neka noljaljevavavan imaza ta napatjatjaketjak a tjatjevavavan, amin a tjevavav ta zidosia.
english: There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

pwn: no tjevavav ta baso a pasa gakko aki izoa makodakoda a zikan?
english: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

pwn: tapoloq kato lima a tokian ki djemaljon i gakko.
no tjevavav toa tjaljasaljiokan a pasa Taicio aki izoa makodakoda a tokian ki djemaljon?
english: How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?

pwn: izoa ita tokian ki djemaljon i Taicio.
english: I will be in Taichung for an hour.

pwn: no ongting ta zidosia a sema Qolay aki coay a zikang?
english: Is it a long drive to Ulai?

pwn: tjara izoa a ita a tokian.
no tjevavav son a kemasi toa napatjatjatjatjak a tjatjevavavan a sema tjanoamen aki izoa makodakoda a zikang?
english: How long did it take you to come to my house by MRT?
Do you know how to ride a bicycle?
Don't, I don't know much about it.

pwn: izoa so zikang no nakingcengelj? saljingan ken a sema zoa a kivala tjanoson?
english: Are you free this afternoon? I'd like to visit you, is that okay?

pwn: oi, ko kaljava-o anga i tjomaq.
english: Okay, I'll wait for you at home.

pwn: izoa so zikang notiyav? ori kivadaq aken tjanoson ta milimilingan noa paiwan zoko.
english: Are you free tomorrow? I'd like to ask you about the legendary story of the Paiwan people.

pwn: notiav ori vaik aken a magado, neka ken i tjomaq lja.
english: I'm going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won't be home.

pwn: naselangda ken to kemeljang son aravac toa pakata na sepaiwan a kakodanan, saljinga ken ta kivada tjanoson.
english: I heard that you know a lot about the traditional customs of the Paiwan people, so I would like to ask you something.

pwn: inika liyav ako kingljan, ljakoa makaya ken a temevela toa ko kingljang.
english: I don't know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

pwn: makaya ken a pakavidio? no tjaivililj ki tjamadjolo anga sivecik.
english: Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

pwn: siva a polo' saka alo anga a ko cavilj.
pida a so kinacaqo a kai?
macaqo aken ta na seAmis a kata sepiyoma a kai.
english: I can speak Ami and Puyuma.

pwn: napasilevan aken aravac toa ko kinivadaqan tjanoson a voaq, pai makaya qivo anan son toa pakata palisi noa qemaljo?
english: It's a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

pwn: oi, ka maqacovocovong anan aken ro sa gado aken a qemaljop.
english: Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

pwn: maljimalji, toco a voaq pariya angata a so tinoloan.
english: Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

pwn: pariaria angata a ko qinaivoan. sinitaocikecikel noa tja sevalitan.
english: All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

pwn: tja patemazao a tja mare kivavadavadaq, maljimalji a so pinasemalavan.
english: That's all for today's interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

pwn: ori vaik anga ken, nakiljaljava ken no tjaivalilj ki tjaliyav anga ko langdaing a milimilingan.
english: I'm going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.

pwn: nasoljivat son, anema a ori so velin?
english: Hello, what do you want to buy?

pwn: nasoljivat son, anema a ori so velin?
english: Hello, what are you looking for?

pwn: ori veneli aken to ita ta talopon.
english: I want to buy a hat.

pwn: ori veneli aken ta kopo, izoa no sipaveliveli?
english: I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?
Yes, how many do you want to buy?

pwn: neka, inika men a paveliveli ta saviki.
english: No, we don't sell betel nut.
How many packs do you want to buy?
I want to buy sweet potatoes.
All the sweet potatoes are sold out.

pwn: ori veneli aken to drosa ta djioq.
english: I want to buy two bottles of oil.

pwn: amin anga a ita i tjanoamen.
english: We only have one bottle left.
How many pounds do you want to buy?

pwn: ori nangking a so veliing a qecilo?
english: How many pounds of eggs do you want to buy?

pwn: ori veneli aken to drosa a king.
english: I want to buy two catties.

pwn: ori veneli aken to drosa a djaljeng a kocay.
english: I want to buy two green onions.

pwn: izoa tjelo a djaljengan a tjeza, nison nay anga a penoljat.
english: There are three left, all for you!

pwn: pida a kakavilian ta ico i tovong a paday?
english: How much is this bag of rice?

pwn: no ita i tovong drosa iday.
drosa a polo' kato ita a vatan a pipenoljayan, no drosa a polo' ki pariya.
siva a polo' kato lima vatan a imaza.
pai kiveli anan aken to kedri, padjaljoni to taiday.
english: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

pwn: lima a iday saka poloq a vatan a pipenoljatan.
pai paka lima a idayo aken?

pwn: inika makaya, aico tjaljamadoloan anga aravac.

pwn: ori veneli aken ta ico a koa.

pwn: aico a koa tjelo a poloq a vatan, izoanan a zoma ori so velin?
english: $30 for the cookies, anything else you need?

pwn: makaya ken a kisedjam ta so paiso?
english: Can I borrow money from you?

english: Yes! How much do you need?

pwn: malim anga ken a kemaco ta ko paiso, makaya ken a kisedjam ta so paiso?
english: I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

pwn: inika ken a nakemaco ta paiso ota lja!
english: I don't have any money either!

pwn: malim aken a kemaco ta ko paiso, makaya ken a kisedjam ta so paiso.
english: I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

pwn: caqen, katjaisangas ka nakisedjam son tjanoaken ta paiso inianan ka so pacikeli.
english: No, you haven't paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

pwn: makaya ken a kisedjam ta so itong?

pai pasedjami aken ta so tjokitjoko?
english: Can I borrow your bicycle, please?

pwn: 'emodja'odjalj anga, inika ken a nacemaco ta qaosoa, pai pasedjami aken ta so qaosoa?
