pwn: ita sakamaya a ko qaosoa, pai tja siqaosoan a madrosa!
english: I only have an umbrella, let's stick together!

pwn: aico sonat mavan a so sinipasedjam tjanoaken ka katjaisangas, ko pacikelao tjanoson.
english: This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

pwn: no saljinga anan son a pacon ta sonat makayanan son a qivo tjanoaken.
english: You can tell me what else you want to read.

pwn: nongida nga ko pacikelen a so paiso?
english: When do I have to pay you back?

pwn: inika makoda, 'adjavan anga no izoa nga so paiso qivo anga.
english: It's okay, you can talk about it when you have money.

pwn: nongida nga so pacikelen a ko paiso?
english: When are you going to pay me back?
I'll return it to you tomorrow.

pwn: nongida nga so pacikelen a ko sonat?
english: When are you going to return my book?

pwn: aico a inpic sinipasedjam ni koi tjanoson?
english: Did Kui lend you this pen?

pwn: oi, ko kinisedjam tjaimadjo a voaq.
english: Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

pwn: aico a inpic so kinisedjam tjai koi?
english: Did you borrow this pen from Kui?
No, this is what mom bought.

pwn: nekanga no 'atia, sao kisedjamo tjai pales to kedri ta 'atia.
english: We are out of salt, let's borrow some from Pales.

pwn: sao djaoljo ti pales pacikelo ako paiso ayao.
english: Go tell Pales to give me back my money.
How much does she owe you?
I'm going to plant vegetables in the garden.

pwn: liyav a aravac a cemel, venasavasak aken, nosaoni ori pazaljom aken.
english: There's too much grass, I'm cutting it, I'll have to water it later.

pwn: pai alapan aken ta kawkav kata tjatjokon?
english: Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?
Put it next to the plow rake.
Did you turn over the soil?

pwn: ko kinavacokan anga, nosaoni ori temogot.
english: I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

pwn: a so sinitalem a ljaceng makayanga ta kiljasengen?
english: Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

pwn: makaya nga kilkangrangen a imaza, azoa ljaloin inianan ka makaya a kiljaloingen.
english: The cabbage here is ready to be harvested, but the Showa grass there is not yet ready to be harvested.

pwn: wa! mano liyav a so kinali a vorasi?
english: Wow! You dug up so many gourds.

pwn: pai posaladji aken a pasa ta kobav?
english: Will you help me with the barn?
We are casting nets to catch fish.

pwn: liyav anga djiname' a ciqaw i tjaretjek.
english: The fish basket has been full of fish.

pwn: no kaljakemodan a qadav kemoda son a kiciqaw?
english: How do you usually catch fish?

pwn: mavan a raqas a ko sicekcek ta ciqaw.
english: I shoot fish with a spear.

pwn: macaqo son a cokao ta tiveljatan kata vakela a 'emaljop?
english: Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?

pwn: mavan a siringaringai a ko sikisacemel, izoano malap aken toa ta koang kata kemaco ta vato.
english: I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.
This is the road the boar took.

pwn: aico djekap na vavoy, manasika aico mavan a papakazoanan a djalan noa vavoy.
english: These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

pwn: ari tja paconay a tja ringay, namaya ta nadjemameq anga ta sacemel.
english: Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.

pwn: namayata izoa nga se'ose'oin na vato. ari kadjaljavi a semazoa.
english: The dog seems to have smelled it. Let's follow them.
This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.
What is that thing you put there?

pwn: azoa tjokor, mavan a si'aljo'aljop ta vanan.
english: It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

pwn: maljimalji a papomangoaqan noa tja sevalitan, liyav a tja qadav a voaq.
english: Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

pwn: oi lja, tja siljevan a sema qinaljan!
english: Yeah! Let's take it back to the tribe and share it!

pwn: toco a qadav tiaken a no sirotemolo mori temolo aken tjanomon a masantalj to kemoda qivo toa qemozimozip a penaiwanan.
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in Paiwan language today.

pwn: toco a qadav tiaken a no sirotemolo mori temolo aken tjanomon a masantalj to kemoda qivo toa vangalj a penaiwanan.
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in Paiwan language today.

ika aken a namasi kakitoloan a sonatj.

pwn: kasadjo a pacon kata so seljaseljang.

pwn: maveceloq anga a ko sivecik a qidong.

pwn: mori patjemaza anga tja kitolo, no pasa omaq mon kipapaolingavo anga i djalan.

pwn: mori patjemaza anga tja kitolo, ocevocevongi anga ota masantalj.

pwn: mareka aiyanga masantalj, a ko ngadan ti Koljelje.
english: Hello everyone, my name is Kuljelje.

pwn: mareka aiyanga masantalj ti Adriv a ko ngadan.
english: Hello everyone, my name is Adriv.

pwn: oi Koljelje djavadjavay ti Veneng aken.
oi Adriv djavadjavay ti Cangkim aken.

vetjek aken ni Djanav a tjaljaljak a ko ngadan ti Veneng.
english: I am Djanav's sister. My name is Veneng.

pwn: timadjo a ko sirotemolo, a ti Pacak.
timadjo a ko sinsi, a ti Pacak.

My elder sister's name is Ravaci.

My younger sister's name is Selep.

pwn: pidanga cavilj ni so kaka i Pokiringan?

pwn: tapoloq kato lima a cavilj ni kaka toco.
pidanga cavilj na so kaka ti Qozang?

pwn: lima anga a cavilj na ko kaka toco.

Do you have schools in your community?

pwn: kitolotolo son itoa kakitoloan i qinaljan?

pwn: kitolotolo son itoa gakko i qinaljan?
english: Do you study in your tribe's school?

pwn: oi, no kitolotolo amen i kakitoloan mato tacemekeljan amen.

pwn: oi, no kitolotolo amen i gakko mato tacemekeljan amen.
english: Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.
He is my younger brother, Camak.
Is he your younger brother, Camak?

pwn: ini, qali timadjo na ko kaka.
english: No, he is my younger brother's friend.

pwn: ti so kaka i Moni azowa?
english: Is she your elder sister, Muni?
No, she is my younger sister.
There are five people in their family.
How many children in your family?
How many younger siblings do you have?

pwn: neka no tjavolong a mareka ko kaka.
english: I don't have any older siblings.
How many siblings do you have?

pwn: napevocelelj a kinaqadavan, soqacao anga a temkel toa macoljocoljo a zaljom?
english: It's a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

pwn: napezalangzang a kinaqadavan, soqacao anga a temkel toa macoljocoljo a zaljom.
english: It's a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.

pwn: namakoda a kinaqadaqadavan noa i pasasav?
mapaselav a qadav, paqenotjo anga toa kiljakev ta madrasi.

pwn: mapaselav a qorepos, neka no qadav.

pwn: inika maqadav notiav, qemorepos, saka venali a paotez.
english: It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.
How was the weather that day?

pwn: tazoa qadav napevocelelj, no masasav tjaljanangoaqan a mitong toa oba.

pwn: namakoda a kinaqadaqadvan no sipolavayan a qadav?

pwn: saljiang a kinaqadavan tazoa, inika qemodjalj.

pwn: oi, mori vocelelj aravac noicavilj, pakaliavo anga mitong.
english: Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

pwn: tocoacavilj no kaljazalangzangan mori zalangzang aravac pay?

pwn: oi, no kaljazalangzangan mori zalangzang aravac, gedegedo anga temkel toa zaljom.

pwn: tjengelay aken toa kaljavevean, saljavljavljav a kinaqdavan.

pwn: ika aken a tjengelay toa kaljaoragan, liav aravac a raljiz no kaljaoragan.

pwn: sao vaivaiko, nosaoni ko kimav anga son.

pwn: ini,vaiki anan a semakoc toa sonatj.

english: Tjeljev is not at home. I am Sangkilj. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

pwn: vovo, ti Sankilj aken kati Tjeljev, pay soqeljevi amen.

pwn: kacomoso, ti Sankilj aken kati Tjeljev, pay soqeljevi amen.

pwn: ti Ripon aken, kemikim aken a semamaza tjay Giana.

pwn: kacomoso, mangtjengtjez aken lja ljemilji tjanoson.

pwn: vovo, mangtjengtjez aken lja ljemilji tjanoson.
english: Grandma, I am here to see you.

pwn: coacoay anga son lja ika mangtjengtjez, pay singelit anga aken aravac tjanoson.

pwn: Tjeljev, mangtjengtjez aken lja kipakim tjanoson toa kivangavang.

pwn: kirimo tedepo, coay anga aken a tjakaljavaljava tjnoson.

pwn: kirimo tjomaqo, coay anga aken a tjakaljavaljava tjnoson.
english: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

pwn: tiaken a natemalem taico a vorasi, pay kano a pavavala.

pwn: keljo! aico a vangalj tiaken a natemalem, pay kano a pavavala.

pwn: pay qiladjo! aico a ljapanay a sinikilaing toa qinatian tiaken a natemalem pay kano a pavavala.

pwn: wo! aico a ljapanay qaljemeqem aravac.

pwn: maljimalji, aico a vangalj poqetim aravac.

pwn: pay ko sialapan son toa zaljom ta so tekelen.

pwn: soliavo a keman, liav aravac a ko kinsa djamay.
english: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.

pwn: wo! aico salom saka sangoaq angata.
english: Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.

pwn: soliavo a keman, oza liav anan a imaza.
english: Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.

pwn: nomatazoa ika anga aken lja masiaq!
english: I'll make myself at home then.

pwn: soliavo a keman, oza liav anan a imaza.

pwn: liav anga aravac a ko kinan, nekanga no ko sivalan a keman.

pwn: matoco ti kina liav aravac a salapeljan i gado aya.

pwn: tcoo a qadav tiaken a no sinsi mori ko kacoin mon a sema vavoa.

pwn: tcoo a qadav tiaken a no sirotemolo mori ko kacoin mon a sema vavoa.

pwn: ini, mori kacoin itjen ni sirotemolo a sema gado.

pwn: ini, mori kacoin itjen ni sinsi a sema gado.
english: No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.

pwn: vaik itjen a pacon toa qoljicacenglav.

pwn: sirotemolo, anema mori tja paconan a sema gado?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?

pwn: sinsi, anema mori tja paconan a sema gado?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?

pwn: vaik itjen a pacon toa kalabiabi.

pwn: anema tja kodain a sema vavoa?
english: What are we going to do in the fields?

pwn: mori vaik itjen a sema vavoa temalem toa ljapanay, kipapaolingavo itjen ayatoa izoa sasiq. izoa pangac lja!
english: We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

pwn: sirotemolo, mori vaik itjen a sema ljemavingan i pana a ljemangoy?
english: Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?

pwn: sinsi, mori vaik itjen a sema ljemavingan i pana a ljemangoy?
english: Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?

pwn: ini, mori vaik itjen a pacon toa qoljicacenglav.
english: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

pwn: sirotemolo, mori vaik itjen a sema vavoa temalem toa ljaceng?
english: Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?

pwn: sinsi, mori vaik itjen a sema vavoa temalem toa ljaceng?
english: Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?

pwn: toco a qadav mori vaik itjen a benoljebolj.
english: We are going to loosen the soil today.

pwn: izoa izowa a miperepereper a pasasivalj a qoljicacenglav.
tjao pacon aken a voaq toa kaqolidan a valjoaljot a qoljicacenglav.
english: Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

pwn: izoa izowa a miperepereper a pasasivalj a kalabiabi.
ya! wa! tjengelay aken toa kalabiabi, ngoangoaq aravac.
english: Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.
Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

pwn: tjaljomazao sakamaya pacon, nakoya ljiacadja a matjozoma dri!
english: Come here and take a look. Don't go too far!

pwn: oi, inika amen a ljiacadja a matjozoma.
english: Got it, we won't go anywhere too far.

pwn: nakoya mekelj lja, galjo a djemavac mano matjani mon.
english: Don't run and walk slowly lest you fall down.

pwn: mori kirimo a pacon a ko varong.
english: I want to see them right away.

english: How do you go to the block-house?

pwn: mori maka palidring aken a sema tapav.
mori makanema timadjo no sema bioing?
english: How does he go to the hospital?

pwn: mori makanema timadjo no sema kakipocemelan?
english: How does he go to the hospital?

pwn: makavavav aken toa sikoki a sema bokoto.
english: I go to Penghu by plane.

pwn: makavavav aken toa varokor a sema bokoto.

makavavav aken toa sipatjatjeketjek a ljiok a sema omaq.

english: How does Muni go to school?

pwn: na makavavav toa ljiok ti Moni a sema kakitoloan.
english: Muni goes to school by train.

pwn: na makavavav toa ljiok ti Moni a sema gakko.
english: Muni goes to school by train.

english: How does Camak go to downtown?

pwn: na makatolay ti Camak no sema lizok.
english: Camak goes to downtown by bicycle.

pwn: makavavav son toa sipatjatjeketjek a ljiok a sema gakko?
english: Do you go to school by MRT?

pwn: makavavav son toa sipatjatjeketjek a ljiok a sema kakitoloan?
english: Do you go to school by MRT?

pwn: ini, makavavav aken toa baso no sema gakko.
english: No, I go to school by bus.

pwn: ini, makavavav aken toa baso no sema kakitoloan.
english: No, I go to school by bus.
Do you go to school by bicycle?
Do you go to school by bicycle?

pwn: oi, makatolay aken no sema kakitoloan.
english: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

pwn: oi, makatolay aken no sema gakko.
english: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

pwn: tjevavav son toa tjasaljiok no sema Tjoaqao?
english: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

pwn: tjevavav son toa tjasaljiok no sema Takao?
english: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

pwn: oi, makavavav aken toa tjasaljiok no sema Tjoaqao aken.
english: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

pwn: oi, makavavav aken toa tjasaljiok no sema Takao aken.
english: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

pwn: no sema Valangao son ljiok a so pakavavavan mano sikoki?
english: Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

pwn: makavavav aken ta sikoki, tjadjaljav a sikoki toa ljiok.
english: I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

pwn: no sema lizok son makavavav son toa baso mano maka palidring son?
english: Are you going to drive to the downtown or take the bus?

pwn: makapalidring aken a sema lizok, tjamadjolo a makapalidring toa makabaso.
english: I will drive to the downtown because it is more convenient than the bus.

pwn: aza sinantjaljacadjoran a siobay na sedot toa no omaq?
english: Is the market close to your house?

pwn: inika dot, semavid aken a maka otobay no sema ta sinantjaljacadjoran a siobay aken.
english: No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

pwn: aza posasosoqanan na sedot toa kakitoloan?
english: Is the post office close to the school?

pwn: aza posasosoqanan na sedot toa gakko?
english: Is the post office close to the school?

pwn: dot aravac, no djemavac tja djaljonen.
english: Yes, it is within walking distance.

pwn: aza kakanan na sedot toa ljaljevavavan toa palidring?
english: Is the restaurant close to the station?

pwn: no sasav ta ljaljevavavan ta palidring sa djavac no lima a qotjeqotjan tja djaljonen.
english: It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.

pwn: na venarong aken to vaik a kivala tjanoson.
english: I would like to visit you.

pwn: izoa ko sikasalialim a voaq ika aken a i tjomaq, ki pinongiday anga kaomaya.
english: I am out today. How about another day?

pwn: ao notiav izoa so cog? ko kimav anga son no masokincengelj.
english: Then, are you available tomorrow? I'll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

pwn: makaya, ko kaljavav anga son i tjomaq.
english: Sure, I will wait for you at home.

pwn: kivadaqay pay makaya aken a penaseqilja kiljingav? na venarong aken toa penoadjoqan.
english: Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.
Would you mind if I do the video recording?

pwn: koyakoya aken, ika namaparimasodj ota salang, palaingi.
english: No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn't been tidied up yet.

pwn: ao nomatazoa ki aken a paqayljongan sakamaya.
english: Then I will just take photos.

pwn: ao nomatazoa ki aken a pasasing sakamaya.
english: Then I will just take photos.

pwn: maljimalji toa pokaoyi son a ko kivavadaqan.
english: Thank you for accepting the interview.

pwn: ikamakoda, anema so vinarong to kivadaq?
english: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

pwn: kivadaqay son pay ka maqacovocovong son anema so kodakodain.
english: What do you do when you are young?

pwn: kisaco aken ka sicoayan, ljakoa toco na kitjaola anga aken.
english: I was a police officer but I am retired now.
Then, are you working at the moment?

pwn: pay kivadaqay son aza so aljak imazamaza i qinaljan?
english: Do your kids live in the tribe too?

pwn: ini, aza ko aljak imazamaza i lizok.
english: No, my kids are all living in the city.
Then, do you live by yourself?

pwn: paqoziqozip aken ota to ita ta vato kata ita qayaqayam, ko cemkemkelj ota tiamadjo.
english: I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

pwn: paqoziqozip aken ota to ita toa ngiav, no izoa qemozimozip a tja saladj ika itjen a kiposepeljan.
english: I have a cat too. I won't get bored with the company of my pet.

pwn: kinemnem aken toa kivadaq tjanoson toa pakata palisian na siqaljopan.
english: I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

pwn: inika liav amaya ko kineljang, ljakoa aza ko keljangen ki ko so tevelay sakamaya.
english: I don't know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

pwn: aza no siqaljoqaljop a torivecan izoa nema a palisian.
english: Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

pwn: aza nia siqaljoqaljop a torivecan inika makaya sipacelecel toa vavayan.
english: Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

pwn: ao aico a vavayavayan makaya kicior a qemaljop?
english: Then, can women go hunting together?

pwn: inika makaya, inika makaya ota qemaljop a vavayavayan.
english: No, women cannot go hunting either.

pwn: Camak, neka anga no tja paday a vinava, sao vaiko a veneli.
english: Camak, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

pwn: izoa anan a tanoita i kindraljom i kakesan, palaingi toa veneli.
english: There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

pwn: inika cengceng a tanoita i kindraljom, sao velio anan to tjanodrosa anga i kindraljom.
english: One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

pwn: mori veneli aken toa paday a vinava, izoa no sipaveliveli?
english: I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?
Yes! How many bottles do you need?

pwn: veneli aken to tjanodrosa i kindraljom, sake veli ota to tanoita i tovong toa paday.
english: I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

pwn: oza imaza sa paday, anemaneman a so kinakelekel?
english: Here is the rice, what else do you need?

pwn: veneli anan aken toa qecilo, izoa no sipaveliveli?
english: I want some eggs too, do you have some?

pwn: nasepaveli anga nia qecilo a qemdjeljem.

english: I want to buy some clothes.

pwn: namakoda a kinakemodan na so varong?
english: What kind of clothes do you like?

pwn: mori veneli aken toa drikidrikitj a lima no kavan.
english: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

pwn: izoanan a nia vocelacelay kata samljam.
english: We have white and blue ones too.

pwn: pay pavay aken to tacaocaoan toa samljam a kava.
english: Please give me the clothes in blue.

pwn: Camak kasino son tasaoni? na kipalalaciq son?
english: Camak, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

pwn: Camak kasino son tasaoni? na ondo son?
english: Camak, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

pwn: ini, na vaik aken a posaladj tjay vovo a paveli toa ljaceng.
english: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

pwn: ini, na vaik aken a posaladj tjay kacomoso a paveli toa ljaceng.
english: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

pwn: mano kemoda, izoa so cog no qezemetj? makaya itjen a malingolj a keman?
english: No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

pwn: ikamakaya, mori vaik aken a veneli toa kava.
english: No, I want to buy some clothes.
Then, I will go with you.

pwn: pay pida kakavelian naico a djinaljeng a ljaceng.
english: Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

pwn: no tadjaljengan a ljaceng drosa poloq a vatan.
english: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.

pwn: aico a vorasi pida a kakavelian.
english: How much are these sweet potatoes?

pwn: no tatjingtjingan a vorasi tjelo a poloq a vatan.
english: Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

pwn: pay pavay aken to drosa djaljeng ta ljaceng kata tatjingtjingan a vorasi.
english: Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

pwn: Camak, malim anga aken a masi siqoliqolip makaya aken a so pasedjaman?
english: Camak, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

pwn: neka ota no niaken, ni Moni aico.
english: I don't have one either. This is Muni's.

pwn: saka makaya ko kisedjamen a palamo? palamo sa ko pacikeli tjanoson.
english: Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

pwn: maljimalji, pomaljimaljian anga aken ota tjay Moni.
english: Thank you and thank Muni for me.

pwn: mori pacikel aken taico a drosa sonatj.
english: I want to return these two books.
No problem and what else do you need?

pwn: mori kisedjam anan aken taico a tjelo a sonatj.
english: I would like to borrow these three books.

pwn: padria. paqenetjo no sipakatjelolj a qadav keljan anga penacikel.
english: Sure and remember to return them after three days.

pwn: inia so pacikeli a ko siqoliqolip lja.
english: You haven't returned me the eraser.

pwn: saka ako ika anga mapacocon a ko siqoliqolip.
english: Then, why is my eraser missing?

pwn: inika so sinipasedjam anga tjay Camak.
english: Did you lend it to Camak?

pwn: qadjav. pay ko kivavadaqay anga timadjo.
english: I don't know. I will go and ask her.

pwn: aza ko siqoliqolip sao kisedjamo anan.
english: I will lend you my eraser first.

pwn: Moni, aico a oba sini pasedjam pay ni Camak tjanoson?
english: Muni, did Camak lend you this coat?

pwn: ini, aico vinli ni kina tjanoaken.
english: No, my mom bought it for me.

pwn: aza oba ni Camak mamav kata nison.
english: Camak's coat is the same as yours.

pwn: aza nimadjo a oba qocengecengel, maretimalj a nia qoljav.
english: His coat is black, so our colors are different.

pwn: Moni, nakisedjam son tjay Camak toa valjitjoq?
english: Muni, did you borrow money from Camak?

pwn: Moni, nakisedjam son tjay Camak toa paiso?
english: Muni, did you borrow money from Camak?

pwn: oi, mori ko pacikelen a voaq a ko varong, ljakoa malim aken a masi valjitjoq.
english: Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.

pwn: oi, mori ko pacikelen a voaq a ko varong, ljakoa malim aken a masi paiso.
english: Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.

pwn: ao saka nongida anga so pacikelen?
english: Then, when will you return the money?
I will return to him tomorrow.

pwn: oi, ko posaladjay anga son a pasasinokokoz tjai Camak.
english: Okay, I will tell Camak for you.

pwn: aico a kikolavav tjara sipoqacev no poparaong, aico a kitjikoray tjara siposeloc no poparaong, manazoa padriadria.
english: It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

pwn: manokemoda, pasalisaliv aken! djaljepan a ika aken a makadjameq.
english: No wonder! I am mistaken and that's why I cannot catch any of them.

pwn: pay ko toloay anan son a momalj to aico a masan mosalj a sisan poraongan.
english: Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

pwn: nangoaq! padria angata! pay no matazoa no tjaivililj ki aken a makadjameq anga toa qaljoqaljopen.
english: Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

pwn: qaqacan anga cemel i vavoa, sao vaiko a sema salang a malap toa kaokav, vaiki a sema vavoa.
english: The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let's go to the fields.

pwn: aza izoa itoa tjakaz i tjoljivar, no temdep son i salang ki so paconi.
english: It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

pwn: kipapaolingavo no malap, nakoya mapasaqetjo radjay aravac a kaokav.
english: Be careful and don't get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

pwn: i patekoteko ta zoa kasiv aza ko siniporaong.
english: My trap is under that tree.

pwn: ko pinokakeljanga a pimaza, kemeljang aken to ino a ko siniporaong.
english: I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

pwn: ko pinokakeljanga a pimaza, kemeljang aken to izaino a ko siniporaong.
english: I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

pwn: varas aico, nia piniljaving toa pana a venaras toa ciqav.
english: This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

pwn: tiamen i pasa zowa neka no nia varas, savid to penanadip amen no kiciqav.
english: We don't have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

pwn: inia ko seljodj a penanadip, toloy anga aken no tjaivililj dri?
english: I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

pwn: padria! kaciori anga no tjaivililj a penanadip.
english: Sure! Let's go fishing together next time.

pwn: nangoaq! kaciori anga no tjaivililj a penanadip.
english: Sure! Let's go fishing together next time.

pwn: ao no tjaivililj ko toloay anga son toa seman varas.
english: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

pwn: aza so panadip matidrtidrtidr anga, palemek to izoa anga natjekalavis a ciqav! kirirno viljeviljo.
english: Your fishing rod is moving. Isn't the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

pwn: mayanan, mizazingay aravac a varokor. tjaljomaza aken a veniljevilj toa kalavis, sao posaladji aken a mazowa malap ta aray.
english: Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

pwn: pay viljeviljo a pasa maza i tjanoaken aza ciqav. ko posaladjay son a veniljevilj.
english: Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

pwn: padria angata! na poqadav a voaq, namapeljoq anga mareka koni.
english: Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

pwn: ari vaiki tja pakalevay a masantalj.
english: Let's go back immediately and share it with everyone.
Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

pwn: sincioanga toco a adao, yasomi no tjoao, vaiki a kinangevang!
english: It's Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let's go out and play together!
Great! Let's go to the riverside.
What day will it be tomorrow?
Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let's go play ball tomorrow afternoon!

pwn: anema roso kodain no tjyao a kadjamadjaman?
english: What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

pwn: notjyao ripaitjin, aro sema tjokai amen ka tji kina.
english: Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

pwn: valaovao aken, a ro ma binzio aken.
english: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

pwn: sinsi, sae'tjo sa ko tjiyalj, ma binzio aken.
english: Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

pwn: makaya ken na vaik a milima?
english: May I go wash my hands?

pwn: aro patjezoanga a tja zikan, mai yanang.
english: It's almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

pwn: sinsi, sae'tjo sa ko olo, kiatjo' aken no na itjao anga.
english: It's almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

pwn: owi, kipa paolingavo a tjaljo tjoma'.
english: Okay, take care and go home.

pwn: sinsi, pori kiyadjo' aken no tjaivelilj, no siciyi aro kipocemel aken.
english: Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

pwn: sae'tjo a tjiyal ni selep, vaik a ma binzio.
english: She has a stomachache. She's in the restroom.

pwn: sinsi, sae'tjo a liqo ni solja, ikana mantjez.
english: Teacher, sulja has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

pwn: lja pakedavi a tji selep aken, izoanga tapolo' ako cavilj.
english: My name is pakedavi a tji selep, and I'm 10 years old.

pwn: tjiaken lja pakedavi a tji solja.
english: My name is pakedvai a tji sulja.
What ethnic group are you from?
Are all your family members indigenous?
Yes, my whole family is Paiwan.
Are all your family members indigenous?

pwn: yini', amin tji kama a kacaljsiyan, tji kina paran.
english: No, my father is Paiwan, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

pwn: tji tjama a zoa? pida anga cavilj ni tjama?
english: Is that your father? How old is he?

pwn: tji kama izoanga onem kato polo' a cavilj.
ini', azo nia voljovoljon i inaljan, izoanga aloapolo'acavilj ni madjo.
english: No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

pwn: tji kaka izoanga tapolo' kato alo a cavilj.
tjavoljon to liaov a cacvlj ni so kaka tja noson?
english: Is your brother much older than you?

pwn: tjaljaljak aken to lima cavilj tjai madjo.
izoa taidai kato sepatj a polo' ako kina aca.
cowai yanga ikatjen na micevon, matjo moaca anga son?
english: I haven't seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

pwn: owi, moacanga aken to taidi kato tjelo a polo'.
owi, mokoral angaken to tjieloa poljo'.
aro vaik' aken a ma pankonse a kimin tjia sinsi.
english: I'm going to the office to see the teacher.

pwn: aro vaik' a venoljo' toa cemel tji madjo.
english: He's going to throw away the trash.

pwn: izoa i ljaljangowiyan tji pantjer, aro kiyan a pisai toa ljemangwi tjimadjo.
english: He's at the swimming pool. He's going to compete in a swimming competition later.

pwn: izai no tji selep? aro mekelj anga tji madjo no saoni.
english: Where is selep? She's going to compete in a running competition later.

pwn: izoa i kakaepoan tji madjo, ko kimao.
english: She's in the auditorium. I'll go call her.
Let's go to the playground together.

pwn: vaik nan aken a veneli toa ko cengelj, ko kimao anga son no saoni.
english: I'll go buy lunch first, and then I'll meet you later.
Let's carry the lunch boxes together!

pwn: kimitoa aliali, aro vaik' aken na kimim tjai sinsi.
english: You find someone else, I'm going to find the teacher.

pwn: toco a adao aro kian tji gosio toa coicio?
english: Is gusiu competing in croquet today?

pwn: ini', aro kiyan tji madjo toa midjorok.
english: No, he's competing in high jump.
Will you compete in the sports day?

pwn: oei, aro kian aken a mekelj.
anema aro tja kodaing no ngndokaidokai?
english: What will we do in the sports day?
We will compete in tug of war.

pwn: aro paveli tjen toa kakanen no ongndjokaidjokai?
english: Will we sell food at the sports day?

pwn: kacimas son, pasa makya son a rac!
english: Congratulations on getting first place! You're amazing!

pwn: izoa na tae'd i toa aqerengang njimadjo?
english: Yes, she's sleeping in her room.

pwn: neka' ri.tjao vaivaik. no masoljem anga ki pantjez.
english: No, she's not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

pwn: iazoi nikai. sao ljivavao a kiminm.
english: He's upstairs. You can go up and find him.

pwn: izoa a caocao a caocao i tjoma'?
solja coai angaken na ini' ka pacon tja noson na soljivatje son?
english: It's sulja. I haven't seen you in a while! How have you been?

pwn: oi na soljivat a ken.vaca' aken na ljimizao tja noson.
english: I'm doing great! I came to chat with you.

pwn: izaoa i kakesan ko djao lao.
english: He's in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

pwn: vai ka sema pokokan a djemekep ta koka.
english: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

pwn: neka' i tjoma' tja sovovo izoa i vavoa kaljavo i tjoma'.
english: Your grandfather is not at home. He's in the field. Wait for him to come back.

pwn: matjez anga son ayao kama i palan.
coai a ngaken ini' ka pacon tja noson. meaca anga son.
english: I haven't seen you in a while. You've grown taller.
It's so good to see you.

pwn: za sa pangoralj se'tjo a pasa pinsan.
english: Here's a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

pwn: coai a ngason a ini'ka kivala ko aivoao tjaiza sa tjen a matjvetjevel a kaiv.
english: It's been a while. Let's have a meal together.

pwn: pomayanga tjemekel a ken ta ocia ka mesen iladi sa tja mare aivoivo.
english: No need to bother. I'll just have tea. Let's sit in the living room and chat.
Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

pwn: tjao kinesakesa aico a koka kaco sa so kanin i tjoma'.
english: This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

pwn: makaya tjen a micevon nona itjao anga no tiyao.
english: Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

pwn: i tania gako pori pasan angamen.
english: How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

pwn: i ta na kaka'poan kao maya aro na kemacalisiyanan aken.
english: Then let's go to the community center. I'll wear folk costume.

pwn: ngoangoa' a inhoa ita na inaljan no kalja maoragan keljo anga.
english: The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

pwn: no ka lja veveanga nanga coai a ravac.
english: That would have to wait until spring. It's too late, isn't it?
Then come during our Harvest Festival!
Alright! I'm looking forward to it!

pwn: ako son na kicepelio a ma inaljan.
english: May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?
I want to return to teach at the local school.

pwn: ako in' i paran a pasopo.
english: Why not teach in the city?

pwn: ayatoa sengnelit a ken tako inaljan pori pacikel aken ta ko picol.
english: Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

pwn: macao so a teminon tjima na tomolo?
english: You're very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

pwn: tji vovov tja lecaoan tji madjo i inaljan a trminon.
english: It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

pwn: ko so na povaron a kicaoan.
english: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

pwn: olja pacoso ai co a tja kakodan a yaken.
english: Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

pwn: sangnooa' aravac ai co a vava.
anema no so caoan aro coai no sema vava.
english: You're really talented. Does it take a long time to make?
No, it only takes about a week.

pwn: izoa silji kata ljakio. tjiaken a na temalem!
english: I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

pwn: tjengelai aken taico a kava. pida?
english: I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?
It's too expensive. Can't you lower the price a bit?

pwn: aljai no tjamadele aro sonsoro aken.
english: No, if I lower it further, I'll lose money.

pwn: pai nomaya. azoa ocencenl paka itao.
english: Alright then, I'll take a black piece of clothing.

pwn: pori veneli aken ta vakal kataico a tjaljoljis.
english: I want this knife and this pot.

pwn: rosa kozol. kosi na lima a mesensen. makaya a sikoda a coai.
english: It's a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

pwn: ko ali a na siokai ta no aken a mamaza. makaya tjama djele.
english: I'll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

pwn: keljo keljo samazao a pacon. izoa kava a tjalopon izo penoljat.
english: Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

pwn: a kava no ita tjiloaidai kato tapoljo' notjelo takozol.
english: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

pwn: veneli aken paka ita ke lan ta va'oan.
english: I'll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

pwn: djavadjavai.pori veneli aken ta djoaidjoai kata linato ta makao a votjolj.
english: Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

pwn: maka pavelianganken ta kinsa. izoanan a coniopin, veneli son?
english: The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

pwn: pai no maya veneli aken toa ita. no tjai veliljangan veneliangan ken ta kinsa.
english: Alright, please give me one. I'll come back next time to buy rice.
Okay, I'll pack it in a bag for you. That'll be 50 dollars.

pwn: izoa za nia koko a kavatoan, ti koma" a ngadan. qocengecengel a qoljaw
english: sa drikidrikitj a quvalj a kinacavacavan

pwn: ka sema tjomaq ti tjokotjoko, mano qemaoqaong a sikataqaljan a mapoljat ta kinakoljian na zaljom i qinaljan, sa ini a kemeljang to ori kemodanga, qivo ti vovo tjaimadjo, idan a so sicaovan. sa tjevengi
english: qau sa pateptepan anga ta tja sikataqaljan"

pwn: toco a qadaw pitjo a milingan djemaljon a ken i gako.
english: I arrived at school at seven today.

pwn: patagilj anga, kitolo mangetjez anga ti sinsi qivo ti pangcang, "gacalji! dreqongi!"
english: It's time for class, the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: "Stand up! Salute!"

pwn: pasi qaca men a qivo, "nangoangoaq son sinsi."
tazoa no kitolotolo, toloan a amen ni sinsi ta pinayoanan a sasopoan.
english: In class, the teacher taught us the paiwan language of numbers.

pwn: kicior a men ta sinsi a semopo, semenay a men ta sasopoan a senay.
english: We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

pwn: liyaw a ko kinitolo ta kay a pinayoanan.
english: I have learned many paiwan languages.

pwn: ljemita ta qadaw a ken a sema gako, ljemita ta qadaw a ken a itolo toa pinayoanan, ori ikay a ken a palangeda tjaikina.
english: I go to school every day, I learn the paiwan language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

pwn: ti sakino a ngadan na ko kama.
ti kivi a ngadan na ko kina.
izoa macidilj a ko kaka tjavolong a oqaljay, ti piya timadjo, tapoloq sa ita anga cavilj nimadjo.
english: I have a brother, his name is piya, he is 11 years old.

pwn: kitolotolo amen i toa mamaw a gakko.
english: We study in the same school.

pwn: tjengelay aken kati kaka tjavolong a oqaljay a semenay.
english: Both my brother and I like to sing.

pwn: tjengelay aken a ljemangoi no kalja polavayan macior a men a tacemekeljan a vaik a ljemangoy.
english: I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

pwn: tjengelay aken a kipoqali ta vaqoan a qali, maqati amen a macior a semenay katoa ljemangoy.
english: I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

pwn: a nia kinaizoanan a tjomaq i tainan.

english: There are five people in our family.

pwn: i toa nia taqomaqanan matjelo a men a mare sirovetjek.
english: There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

pwn: na kitevelj aken tjai kama kina kaka tjavolong a oqaljay kata vavayan.
english: I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

pwn: qacaqaca a ko kama, a ko kama. taizing.
english: My father is tall and he is a policeman.

pwn: mariljay a ko kina, a ko kina. koisang.
english: My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

pwn: no i tjomaq ti kama penayowanan no ikai tja no amen.
english: My father speaks the paiwan language with us at home.

pwn: no kalja polavayan vaik a men a maqinaljan.
english: We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

pwn: maciyor aken kata ko kaka tjavolong a djemameq ta qobeqob.
english: My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

pwn: tjengelay aken aravac ta niamen a cemkemkelj.
english: I like our family very much.

pwn: toco a qadaw vaik aken kati kina ma casaw a kivangavang.
english: I went out with my mother today.

pwn: cangiyangiya ravac a kalevelevan no maqadadaw inika ljaljeqel inika macoljo sarengoaq a vali.
english: The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

pwn: keman amen ta minpaw i tjai vavaw ta cemel maqadaw a kinacavacavan sarengoaq angata.
english: We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

pwn: no pasovililj to cengelj mapavalit anga kalevelevan ta qodjidjilj.
english: In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

pwn: ko kivadaqan ti kina ako qodjidjilj a qoljaw na kalevelevan.
english: I asked my mother why the sky is red.

pwn: qivo ti kina tjara ori mangetjez anga a boho aya.
english: Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

pwn: neka no qerepos i kalevelevan no qezemezemetj minqot anga vitjoqan.
english: There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

pwn: ka tjomaomaq aken i djalan iqaong aken ta vitjoqan.
english: On the way home, I made a wish with the stars

pwn: olja inika na mangetjez a boho, saljinga ken ta vaik a kivangavang.
english: I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

pwn: a ko gakko i ljaqedi ta niamen a omaq djemavac aken a ljemitaqadaw a magakko djemavac aken ota sematjomaq.
english: My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

pwn: inika kodral a nia gakko inika tjorovo a sito na makakeljang amen a mapoljat.
english: Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

pwn: matevetevelj a kakedryan i ondodjo meseljang a kivangavang a maljavar.
english: All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

pwn: kiseljang ota tiasinsi tjanoamen a kivangavang a gakko namaya ta qaca a tacemekeljan.
english: The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

pwn: parimasodj amen a ljemita qadaw sa tja ljengoaqi a parimasodj a tja kakitoloan.
english: We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

pwn: izoa vaik a zemoking ta qezong izoa vaik a semoap.
english: Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

pwn: parimasodj amen toa potopotong i kgakko na marasorasotj amen a mapoljat a gakko na maparimasotj a ljemita to qadaw.
english: We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

pwn: tatiyaw na vaik aken a paljilji tjai vovo a oqaljay.
english: Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

pwn: coacoai anga men a inika mecevong singlit aravac aken tjaimadjo.
english: We haven't seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

pwn: kapacon ti vovo a oqaljay tjanoaken pakanan aken ta kodamono sa patekelan aken ta otja.
english: As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

pwn: qaljemeqem a sinitalem a kodamono ni vovo a oqaljay sangoaq angata.
english: The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

pwn: tjengelay aken ota ta ociya ni vovo no tekelen bolay angata.
english: I also like grandpa's tea, it's tasted good too.

pwn: no vecekadan to qadaw meseljang aken kati vovo a vavayan a kemesa toa nia cengel.
english: At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

pwn: kemesa ti vovo to liyaw angata cengelj izoa ciqaw koka siyak izoa loli ota.
english: Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

pwn: kana kincengel anga men vaik amen a mapoljacengan a kiljaceng.
english: After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

pwn: liyaw a kini vorasi vasa rokiya ni vovo to sipakaco tjanoaken a tjomaq.
english: Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

pwn: kiposao aken tjayamadjo kivalanga ken no tjaivililj ota ko ayain a ikai.
english: I said goodbye to them and said I'd see them next time.

pwn: kinaco amen ni sinsi a ma kakatalidoan ta qemoziqozip i paljing amen a na siyogo a ori veneli ta kipo.
english: Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

pwn: ka ljetaladj amen ta kakatalidoan ta qemoziqozip kikai ti sinsi, "a i qayaw qayaqayam a i tjai likoz qatjovi kacidicidiljo a talido a mapoljat." aya ti sinsi.
english: After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

pwn: marekotj aken ta qatjovi saka ini aken a pacon ta kana qatjovi.
english: I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

pwn: liyaw a ko pinaconan a qayaqayam a minlayalayap ita kasiw a pacacikecikel pacon aken ota ta ljeqo a na taqed i taladj ta lala na kasiw.
english: I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

pwn: izoa zo izoa rigi kata likoljaw ita kakatalidoan ta qemoziqozip maleva ken ta ko pinaconan toco a qadaw.
english: There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

pwn: liyaw a sasing a ko sinasing to sipapacon tjai kina kati kama.
english: I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

pwn: notjaivililj ori kicaciyoran tjai kama kati kina a mangtjez.
english: Next time I will come with my parents.

pwn: toco ka polavalavai vaik aken kata ko kaka tjavolong a vavayan a ma taito a paljilji tjai kama i koliw.
english: This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle, kuliw.

pwn: na maka kisiya men a kemasi taihoko a ma taito.
english: We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

pwn: tjemaljo a men i taito onting ti kama i koliw ta palidring a mangetjez a kicacevong tjanoamen.
english: When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

pwn: ini ka cadja ta tapaw ni kama koliw a hocecan ononting ta palidring palamo djemaljon.
english: The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.

pwn: izoa tjaljeqacaqaca a pogongngan idongdong ta tapaw ni kama koliw meseljang amen a kididingsiya mapogongan.
english: There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

pwn: i pogongngan kacoin amen ni kama koliw a pakan ta gong kata rigi.
english: In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

pwn: ka qezemezemetj meseljang amen a sema lizok a keman.
english: In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

pwn: liyaw a palidring i lizok saka na kiotobai amen a mazoa.
english: There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

pwn: ka ori vaik ta zoa paconan to cinakao anga otobai maka baso anga men a vaik.
english: When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

pwn: toco i taihoko anga men qadjao kimadjomak anga otobai ni kama koliw.
english: Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

pwn: kakakedriyan aken i koskos a niatapaw kapatagilj anga ken a magakko patjavat anga matawing i lizolizok a nia sikaco.
english: When we were young, our family lived in kuskus. After I started school, we moved to Taoyuan and have been living in the city ever since.

pwn: ka madaigako anga ken kitolo aken ta kinacalisiyan a bongka sa ko keljang anga ta i taiwan a kacalisiyan izoa ngaqoaqn namakakaizoa a bonka.
english: After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

pwn: manasika toco a cavilj no kaljapolavayan ori vaik aken kati kaka tjavolong a oqaljai a paljilji ta ramaljemaljeng a ori kiljaljoai ta nimitja a kemacidiljan a bonka.
english: So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

pwn: alo anga poloq a cavilj na ramaljemaljeng ljakoa no tja paconan namaya ta inika volovolong.
english: The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

pwn: ko kivadaq timadjo pida so kinacaqo a kai macaqo aravac a ikai ta pinaiwanan saigo ota ikai ta na tjokoko zipon kilang a kai.
english: I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in paiwan, as well as Chinese, Hakka and Japanese.

pwn: ka kivadaq anga ken tjaimadjo kemeljang anga aken to na kemasi kakedriyan kitolo ta zipon a kai a valjaw nimadjo pairang i toa karakodakodain nimadjo tjorovo a kineljang a kilang manasika liyaw a kinacaqo a kai.
english: I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Chinese, and he knows many Hakkas at work, so he can speak so many languages.

pwn: tazoa kakiqaqivoavoan amen liyaw a sini pasemalaw a pakatoa qemaljop a saigoan kata kakodan.
english: During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

pwn: komalji inika liyaw a niakeljange ljakoa nia pinaka toa dingowa a paiga maqati a gemaljo kiljaloai a kilangeda.
english: Although we could't fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

pwn: kakakedryan aken neka no ko kemeljang toa ko bonka masiyaq aken a maciljilj ta ko kinacalisiyanan.
english: When I was young, I didn't understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

pwn: no coai anga no tjaliao a kineljangan paka pakisomalji a kinangoaq kinabolai sedjalep a sikizengel a kinapaiwanan.
english: The more I know, the more I feel that being a Paiwan is unique and something to be proud of.

pwn: toco a qadaw no masolem ori mangetjez anga ko kaka tjaljaljak a oqaljai.
english: My younger brother is going home this evening.

pwn: vaik aken kati vovo a vavayan a semavavelian a veneli ta djorikoko to sipadjolo a kemesa ta sangoangoaq a kaiven to sipakan ta ko kaka tjaljaljak a oqaljai.
english: My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

pwn: cemalivat amen ta vaveliyan liyaw a vaqoan a ljaceng.
english: We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

pwn: na veneli amen ta ingcai qaqilj kata daikong.
english: We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

pwn: qivo azoa i ljaqedi a paveliveli ta kodamono a taoki, "qaljemeqem ako pangoralj kata qodis pai velio to kedri aya!"
english: The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: "My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!"

pwn: na veneli amen ta pangoralj kata qodis.
kacemalivat amen ta vavelian ta votjolj, qivo a taoki, "anema so velin? toco a qadaw a koka kakodralj sa qaloman no ita tjeloaidai."
english: We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, "What do you want to buy? Today's chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD."

pwn: paka pazangal ti vovo a vavayan kivadaqan a taoki maqati a menadjolo a paveli.
english: Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

pwn: ljakoa qivo a taoki minamadjolo anga inika maqati a paljateko ta kakavelian.
english: But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

pwn: a i ljaqedi a taoki qivo ta ido velio ta ko ciqaw kodralj saka madjolo.
english: The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

pwn: kacoai anga veneli anga men ta koka kata ciqaw tjomaq sa kemesa to tja no ita cekoi a djamai.
english: In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

pwn: na palingas ako kaka tjaljaljak a oqaljai na papintjos a ikai ta ini anga maqati a polavai a pohitayan no tjaivililj a niciobi maqati anga tjomaq.
english: The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn't take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

pwn: ikai ti vovo a vavayan liyaw anga kinsa qaqivo a mapoljat ta kemanan!
english: Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let's eat together!

pwn: na tjemaolj amen ta mareka nia kasoso qali ta meseljang a kaiv.
english: We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

pwn: izoa ko qali a ti koliw timadjo ro maraorao a kemaco ta nemanga.
english: I have a classmate named kuliw, he often forgets to bring things.

pwn: no kitolotolo kisedjam ta salasaladja toa sivecivecik siqoliqolip kata vavecikan a qadopo.
english: During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

pwn: no poita podrosa potjelo pasedjaman timadjo na zoma.
english: Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

pwn: ljakoa izoa za inika bolai a kakodanan nimadjo ro kisedjam sa ini a nga pacikel.
english: But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

pwn: no coai anga inika nga pasedjam tjaimadjo.
english: In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

pwn: izoa ka ita qadaw vaik amen a mapoljat a kivangavang.
english: One day, we all went on an outing together.

pwn: kaidjalan lingao ti koliw ta sama kaya ljakoa na maraorao a kemaco ta sidjoadjoas.
english: On the way, kuliw wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

pwn: kisedjam timadjo ta cilikami toa salasaladj ljakoa tevelain tjaimadjo namaya ken ota a inika na kemaco.
english: He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn't bring them either.

pwn: qemaong ta latjakan ti koliw madjalw sa ikaikai aqomaya inika ken a no pasedjaman ta cilikami aya.
english: kuliw burst into tears. He said angrily, why don't everyone lend me toilet paper!

pwn: pasemalavan na salasaladj timadjo, ayatoa inika son a kemaco no kisedjam son inika so pacekel!
english: The classmate told him, because you didn't bring it yourself, and you wouldn't return the things lent to you!

pwn: katiyao anga to qadaw na medjama ti koliw a magakko pacikelen a kinisedjam a nemanga na salasaladj.
english: The next day at school, kuliw arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

pwn: kipaqaljai ta salasaladj ti koliw ikai, ta tjara kemaco anga no tjaivililj ta nemanga timadjo masalo ota ta salasaladj ta na selaing a pasedjam ta nemanga tjaimadjo.
english: kuliw apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

pwn: a ko kama ro qaljoqaljop i qinaljap.
english: My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

pwn: ka kakedriyan aken no ori vaik a qemaljop no qezemezemetj ti kama kati kama i koliw kemaco ta tjakidi kata koang.
english: When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

pwn: no maljiya mangtjez a na kemaco ta qinaljop tiamadjo.
english: At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

pwn: izoa no vavoi izoa no lava izoa no patavatan ota.
english: Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

pwn: i ta sidjaljonan a qinaljan pangaljen niamadjo ta sikataqaljan azoa qinaljop a sacemel.
english: They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

pwn: tjara makavaljai aken sakamaya tjai kama a vaik a qemaljop.
english: Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

pwn: ikai ti kama no meqacanga ken kacoin anga son aya.
english: Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

pwn: saigo ota poringai ta sidjameqan ta sacemel a i qinaljan a oqaljaqaljai saigo tiamadjo a semanaya ta pareqel kata kadringayan a ringai.
english: The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

pwn: saigo aravac a semanaya ta pareqei a ringai ti kama ikai ti kama aico sidjamedjameq ta patjavatan tja kigagaljoin a pacon a pinakazoan a tjekap na sacemel tjapizoain i toa pinakazoan a djalan na sacemel a ringai.
english: My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

pwn: ayatoa sika maqatiyan a djaljaw a kiseljang ta ramaljeng a qemaljop kicaqoan aken a ljemita qadaw ta poringai a ko ringai djaljaw a paqolid sa djemameq ta sacemel.
english: In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

pwn: kapacon ti kama tja no aken ikai ta no tjaivililj tjara tjalja saigoan anga son aya.
english: Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

pwn: maqacovocovong anga ken toco kemavoc aken ta ko panaq kata vakela a kiseljang tjai kama a vaik a qemaljop.
english: Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

pwn: no cemikel a maqinaljan azoa qinaljop a sacemel siseljiva toa taqaljaqaljan a caocao.
english: When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

pwn: ikai ti kama maleva itjen ta tja sevalitan a na papomangoaqan sa izoa mapeljoq a tja sacemel a qinaljop.
english: Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

pwn: na sekavililj anga en a sema gako ka kadjaman.
english: I was late for school this morning.

pwn: na dremaodraw aen, masi kabang a semagako.
english: When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

pwn: neka no anema a o kinaco.
english: I didn't bring anything with me.

pwn: matevelj amen, a pacon toa sapitj a kitolotolo.
english: During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

pwn: no sekiseking, pasedjaman aen toa sivecivecik katoa siqoliqolip noa o salasaladj.
english: During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

pwn: aitocoin aen ni sinsi, "no tjayvililj odamao anga migacalj, mayanga sekavililj!"
english: The teacher told me, "Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!"

pwn: ti Kolio a o kaqaliyan, aljak noa sePaiwan ota timadjo.
english: My good friend's name is Kuliu, and he is also an Paiwan child.

pwn: maciyociyor amen a kitolo i Tjaqaciljay a qinaljan.
english: We study together in the Tjaqaciljay tribe.

pwn: ro kilangda men toa volovolong a menilimilingan, macaqo amen aravac a penaiwanan.
english: We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Paiwan proficiently.

pwn: qaca to koral aen, kedri to mariljay ti Kolio.
english: I am tall and overweight, while Kuliu is short and thin.

pwn: tarivak aravac ti Kolio, tjenglay amen a mapoljat taymadjo.
english: Kuliu is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

pwn: malalomalj toa ondo noa gako kasoni a qadaw masanliyaw aravac a sipalalomalj a ondo.
english: Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

pwn: izoa mavavijvilj toa calis, tjemadrek toa boro, mintoloq, zemiyan katoa penanaq.
english: There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.
I participated in the running competition.

pwn: na sekolilj aen ka mintoloq aen, na pedjamoq to qaca ravac a o congal.
english: When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

pwn: ljakoa migacalj aen, sa getjem a minntoloq a pasaqayaw.
english: But I stood up and continued running forward.

pwn: ka djemaljon aen toa paotezan, maleva aravac a timaimanga caocao.
english: Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

pwn: ljaki inika en a malap toa sangasangasan, ngadan na maleva en aravac, ayatoa o qinacovong a lalomaljen.
english: Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

pwn: na vaik amen kati ama kivala tjay ama i Sakino.
english: Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

pwn: na mapasaqetjo a kola ni ama i Sakino.
tjinomaljan amen to na maberong to ita berong a qaljiyo.
english: He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

pwn: ka ljemelaljelay timadjo toa qaliyo na matjani a kemasi toa qaljiyo.
english: He fell off the roof while repairing it.

pwn: na kemaco ti ama toa votjolj a gong katoa saviki to sipavay tjay ama i Sakino.
english: My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

pwn: masodjo amen i qomaqan kati ama i Sakino, pinaseljavakan aen to liyaw a milimilingan.
english: My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

pwn: ka ori vaik anag en, kemazala ti ama i Sakino to na meqaca ngaen, to tja vangsar anagen.
english: Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

pwn: o ayain tiama i Sakino: " no mengoaq anga so kola, pangtjezo anga matjanoamen a kivala."
english: I said, When your foot gets better

pwn: ka2022a cavilj, na pakaigi a siho to maqati anga vecikan a mibonsio to na sekacalisiyan a ngadan.
english: In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

pwn: o kinivala sa kivadaqi azoa coacoay anga kiqaqav toa siho to vecikan a mibosio toa "na kacalisiyan a ngadan " a i qinaljan a ti Kolio a maqacovocovong.
english: I interviewed Kuliu, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

pwn: niapinenetj toco sisekezan a qadaw to ori kivalain a semata tjomaq nimadjo.
english: We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

pwn: ka maljavaljavar amen pinasemalavan aen toa kinasizoan noa ngadan nimadjo, pinakeljangan aen toa sikatacemkeljan katoa nimadjo a qinaljan.
english: During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

pwn: "akomaya gemtjem sakamaya to momalj toa ngadan, mano nakoya sipavecikan a sicoayan? " o ayain a kivadaq.
english: I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn't the old registration method sufficient?

pwn: aitocoin aen nimadjo, "ayatoa a ciniokokan a vecik inika sedjameq toa kaqolidan a ngadan nimadjo, a qaliqali "ko siyenseng" ayanan no qemaqivo tjaymadjo," liyaw ana masan djeli a kay.
english: He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Ku Xian Sheng

pwn: ati Kolio qivo, "a veciken to na kinacalisiyan a ngadan, kanimitjan angata ngadan. a o ngadan avan no na sevalit toa nimitja tjarakacalisilisiyan, nimitja cemekeljan, na saljinga itjen to madjomak a kanimadjoan a ngadan."
english: Kuliu said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

pwn: na vaik amen kati vovao a vavayan i papaveliyan a zematjak toa racev, na kemaco to liyaw a sinitalem a ljaceng, sa sanayai toa na kinacaliiyan a kakanen sa paseljavakan toa caocao a mapoljat.
english: Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

pwn: tjenglay a mapoljat toa zinatjakan ni vovo a vavayan, tjorovo a veneli toa kamangolj katoa ljaqacay, tjorovo ota mangtjez a keman toa sinadjamay nimadjo.
english: Everyone loved my grandmother's stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

pwn: sangoaq aravac a kinsa nimadjo a koniyaw katoa djoadjoay a tjinaljek, djinaong toa aradj a votjolj noa vavay, madjaolj a tjorovo a qaljaqalja toa seqoan, matjatjavilivilj a caocao matoa nia zinatjakan.
english: The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

pwn: no kemesakesa ti vovo a vavayan, i gidi aen a djemaodjaolj toa qaljaqalja. tjaraotjaotjao aen i gidi a, "niyamen a sinitalem a ljaceng, na meqca i gado, pay kirimo a mangtjez a veneli o!"
english: While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

pwn: palamo mapoljt a sepaveli a nia racev, maytoco ti vovo a vavayan, "ayatoa olja izoa son na posaladj lja."
english: Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It's all thanks to your help.\""

pwn: aico sengsengan, na matolo anagen toa na cemelanga katoa kakanen a kakeljangan, aotaota seljavak anga en toa loljayan noa zematjak a paveli.
english: Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

pwn: pacon aen toa tjenglayan nivovo a vavayan ta sicoayan a kakanen, na miyazoan saka mapongadan a o vinarongan.
english: Seeing my grandmother's passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.

pwn: kasaony pitjo milingan a ko sina gakoan.
english: I arrived at school at seven today.

pwn: patagilj anga kitolo, ljetaladj anga sinsi sema kiosic, qivo a hanciw:" gacaljo! kicongalo!"
english: It's time for class, the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: "Stand up! Salute!"

pwn: a sini tolo na nia sinsi pakata pinaiwanan a semopo
english: In class, the teacher taught us the Paiwan language of numbers.

pwn: timitja kicioli ta sinsi kisopo, na semenay a men ta semopo a senay.
english: We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

pwn: liaw anga o kinasaigo a pinaiwanan.
english: I have learned many Paiwan languages.

pwn: ljemita ta qadaw ma gakko a ken, ljemita ta qadaw kitolotolo toa pinaiwanan, oli kiljavaljang sasi palanda tja kina.
english: I go to school every day, I learn the Paiwan language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

pwn: a ngadan na ko kama ti camak.
a ngadan na ko kina ti savan.
izoa ko kaka tjavolong a oqaljay, a ngadan nimadjo ti boka, toco poloq sa ita anga cavilj nimadjo.
english: I have a brother, his name is buka, he is 11 years old.

pwn: kitolotolo amen itao mamaw a gako.
english: We study in the same school.

pwn: tjengelay semenay ken kata tjavolong a kaka oqaljay.
english: Both my brother and I like to sing.

pwn: tjengelay ken a kemavekav, no polavay, tiamen taqomaqanan maciociol vaik a kemavekav.
english: I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

pwn: tjengelay ken sekeljang toa atalasi a qali, dikilo amen maciol a semenay kata kemavekav.
english: I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

pwn: a nia kinaizoanan imaza i taito king taren goan a tjoabar mola.
tiamen taqomaqanan izoa ma tjelo a sirovetjek.
english: There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

pwn: na matevelj amen kata ko kama, kina, tjavolong a kaka oqaljay kata vavayan.
english: I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

pwn: qaca ko kama, kisace a ko kama.
english: My father is tall and he is a policeman.

pwn: koljay a ko kina. koisan a ko kina.
english: My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

pwn: no i tjomaq amen ti kama lokayan na men ta pinaiwanan.
english: My father speaks the paiwan language with us at home.

pwn: no kilavay toa kalja zalangezangan ro vaik amen a sema qinaljan.
english: We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

pwn: tiaken kata tjavolong a kaka oaqaljay vavayan ro kaciol a djemekep toa ceqel.
english: My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

pwn: tjengelay a ken toa o taqomaqanan.
english: I like our family very much.

pwn: no saonay oli vaik amen kivanvan kati kina.
english: I went out with my mother today.

pwn: no maqadaw cangiangia a kalevelevan, ika ljaljeqel ika semezam taota, sodjosy a vali.
english: The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

pwn: na qemiladj amen itoa zaleman kemakan ta pang, aza teljare na qadaw pazarezar itoa kacavacavan, semeljec aravac.
english: We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

pwn: ko kivadaqan ti kina, akomaya qodjidjilj a kalevelevan.
english: I asked my mother why the sky is red.

pwn: aya ti kina, masa oli mangetjez anga boho.
english: Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

pwn: noqezemetj neka qerepos i kalevelevan, tjevotanga vitjoqan.
english: There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

pwn: oli vaik anga men matjomaq taota.
a si vaikan matjomaq a djalan, kipenetj aken toa vitjoqan.
english: On the way home, I made a wish with the stars

pwn: olja ika mangetjez a boho, sa vaik anan na ken ljisasaw a kivanvan.
english: I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

pwn: a ko gako i gidi toa nia omaq, ljemita ta qadaw djemavadjavac aken a magako, djemavac matjomaq taota.
english: My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

pwn: ika qaca nia gako, mapoljo a sito, makakeljang a mapoljat.
english: Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

pwn: mapoljat a qaqonoan romaqepo i ondozin, maciol a kivanvan ta bolo, maciol a pakatateveravera.
english: All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

pwn: a mareka sinsi kiciol tjanoamen a kivanvan, taota, a gako mato na mirazek a cemekemekelj.
english: The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

pwn: no ljemita qadaw semoap amen, aza kiosic tja paka soapen a palimasodj.
english: We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

pwn: izoa djemoas ta qezong, izoa vaik a semoap ta kalavan.
english: Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

pwn: noaya tiamen nia soapen a i gako mareka potopotong, maqaqepo mareka posaladj, no ljemita qadaw aza i gako na siki.
english: We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

pwn: katiaw, na vaik aken i qinaljan a paljilji ta ko vovo oqaljay.
english: Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

pwn: sicoayan anga tja sincevoan, singelit aken tjaimadjo.
english: We haven't seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

pwn: ti vovo oqaljay ka pacon tjanoaken, pakanan na ken toa soyka, patekelang na ken ta ocia.
english: As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

pwn: a talem ni vovo oqaljay a soyka qaljemeqem, sangoaq aravac.
english: The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

pwn: tjengelay aken temekel ta ni vovo oqaljay a ocia taota, notja tekelen sangoaq ota.
english: I also like grandpa's tea, it's tasted good too.

pwn: ka hilo, na maciol aken kati vovo vavayan keman ta kincengelj.
english: At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

pwn: ti vovo vavayan a kinsa cengelj liaw djamay, izoa ciqaw, izoa voyo, izoa siak, izoanan dingding.
english: Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

pwn: no pakakan ta cengelj, oli vaik amen mapoljacengan kiaya toa ljaceng.
english: After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

pwn: na malap ti vovo vavayan to liaw ta vorasi, vasa, kata lakio pavay tjanoaken, sipakaco a matjomaq.
english: Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

pwn: vaik aken kiposao tjamadjo, patjomalj no tjaivililj oli vaik anan a paljilji tjamadjo.
english: I said goodbye to them and said I'd see them next time.

pwn: kasaony kacoing amen na nia sinsi maqaqaqozipan, i paljing amen kilasodj a venely ta kipo.
english: Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

pwn: ka ljitaladj ta qaqaqozipan, aya ti sinsi:" aza i sangas pakata qayaqayam, aza i likoz pakata kanaqatjovian, kitimon a patjatjaovaik a pacon ta talido."
english: After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

pwn: malekotj a ken toa qatjovi, sika ini pacon na ken ta kanaqatjovian.
english: I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

pwn: na pacong a ken ta liaw a qayaqayam, tiamadjo i toa kasiw pavavaw a minlayalayap, izoanan pinaconan a ljeqo na taqed itoa na kasiw a belong.
english: I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

pwn: aza qaqaqozipan izoa zong, onma kata tjakakodralan a ngiangiyaw, kasicoayan inianan pacong ta namitoco a doboc, kasaony ko paconan maleva racac.
english: There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

pwn: liaw a o sinasin, oli sipapacong ta o kama kati kina.
english: I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

pwn: no tjaivililj oli kiciol a ken tja kama kina maciol a semamaza.
english: Next time I will come with my parents.

pwn: toco kilavay, oli vaik amen kata tjavolong a kaka vavayan ma taito paljilji ta djisan.
english: This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

pwn: oli ljivavaw men ta kisiya kemasi taihok ma taito.
english: We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

pwn: djemaljong i taito, ti djisan emongeting ta haiya mangetjez i tisiaba kicevong tjanoamen.
english: When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

pwn: aza disiaba demot ta omaq ni djisan, ika coay a ongeting djemaljong.
english: The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.

pwn: i dodot ta omaq ni djisan izoa qacaqaca a papagongan, maciociol amen padjidingsia mata papagongan.
english: There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

pwn: ka i papagongan, ti djisan kacoing amen pakan ta sizi kata kiqadraqadr toa onma.
english: In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

pwn: ka masolem, maciol amen ma hici a keman.
english: In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

pwn: aza hici liaw a zidosia, avanasika paotobay men a mazoa.
english: There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

pwn: ka oli vaikanga men, sedjomak to na macakaw a nia otobay, sa vaikanga men ljivavaw ta baso.
english: When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

pwn: toco oli vaikanga men sema taihok, qadjaw kidjinomak anga a otobay ni djisan.
english: Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

pwn: ka qaqonoan a nia omaq i tjoabar, ka magako anga, patjavat a sema taihok. imazamaza i hici a sikac.
english: When we were young, our family lived in tjuabar. After I started school, we moved to Taipei and have been living in the city ever since.

pwn: ka temakesi anga ta daigako, na peniliq a ken toa ita pakata na kacalisian bonka a kitoloan, poalang anga za kacalisian to izoa maretimaljimalji na talido a bonka i taiwan.
english: After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

pwn: manasika, toco a cavilj no pakilavay toa kaljazalangezangan, oli vaik amen kata o kaka oqaljay sema qinaljan, kivadaq ta ramaljemaljeng, saljinga to kemeljang toa nimitja zoko a bonka.
english: So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

pwn: aza ramaljeng alo poloq anga cavilj, ljakoa no tja paconan mato tjaokaramaljeng.
english: The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

pwn: o kivadaqan timadjo macaqo toa pida kai. taoliq ravac no lokai timadjo ta pinaiwanan, saigo a lokai ta na moqami a kai taota.
english: I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Paiwan, as well as Japanese and Pangcah.

pwn: mano ka qaqonoan timadjo na kitolo ta pinaiwanan, a cekelj amizoko, sa za sengsengan nimadjo makakeljan kata tjolovo a ripong caocao, avansika liaw kinasiago a kai.
english: I asked him to find out that he learned Paiwan languages when he was a child, his wife is an Pangcah, and he knows many Japenese at work, so he can speak so many languages.

pwn: ka kitjaocikel amen, aza ramaljeng na tjemaocikel to liaw pakata qemaljop a kakodan.
english: During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

pwn: komalji ika men maqati a sepoalang kiselangda, ljakoa na emaya men ta itoa lima dingwa a remoing, maqati momalj kigaljo a kilangeda.
english: Although we could't fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

pwn: ka qaqonoan ika poalang toa pasa niaken zoko a bonka, pakata kacalisian angata ken izoa keri a siaqan.
english: When I was young, I didn't understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

pwn: ka tjaivililj liaw anga pinoalang, o kinemenemen tiaken paiwanzoko a caocao, na pakisomalji angata, pacengceng si ilasian ota.
english: The more I know, the more I feel that being a paiwan is unique and something to be proud of.

pwn: nosaony masolem, oli sema tjomaq anga tjakeri a kaka oqaljay.
english: My younger brother is going home this evening.

pwn: tiaken vovo a vavayan vaik maiciba veneli ta voyo, padjolo a kemesa ta sangoangoaq a kaiven sipakan ta o kaka tjakeri a oqaljay.
english: My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

pwn: na cemalivat amen toa paveliveli ta ljaceng, aza sipaveliveli liaw na nasasangoaq a ljaceng.
english: We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

pwn: na venely amen ta ingcay, qaqilj kata daikong.
english: We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

pwn: aza i gidi a paveliveli ta kodamono a tawki qivo:" a ko pangodralj kata qodis qaljemeqem. velio to keri pay!"
english: The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: "My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!"

pwn: na veneli amen ta pangodralj kata qodis.
ka cemalivat amen ta paveliveli toa votjolj, aza tawki qivo anema so velin? kasaony a voyo kodral to qalev, no ita tjelo taidai a paiso.
english: We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, "What do you want to buy? Today's chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD."

pwn: paka pazangal ti vovo vavayan, kivadaqan a tawki toki maqati a pomadjoloing.
english: Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

pwn: ljakoa aya tawki madjolo anga, dikinay anga kilovadan.
english: But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

pwn: aza i tjoljivar a tawki qivo, ido velio ta ko ciqaw, a ko ciqaw kodral to madjolo.
english: The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

pwn: kavililjanga venely a men ta voyo kata ciqaw taota, sema tjomaq kemesa ta tacokoi a djamay.
english: In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

pwn: kemaljava coayanga, masolem anga a kalevelevan.
english: After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

pwn: ti kaka tjakeri a oqaljay padingwa mangetjez a qivo, papintjos to ika semekez anga i sividay, no tjaivililj a niciobi mana dikilo a mangetjez.
english: The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn't take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

pwn: aya ti vovo vavayan liaw a kinesanga, qaqivo a mapoljat kacirori a keman!
english: Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let's eat together!

pwn: na djemaolj a men ta marekasoso kata qalialian, maciol paselingolj a keman.
english: We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

pwn: izoa o dokiosi ti kapi, timadjo ro draodraw kemaco ta nemanga.
english: I have a classmate named Kapi, he often forgets to bring things.

pwn: ka kitolotol amen, na kisedjam timadjo ta na dokiosi a inpic, siqoliqolip kata qadopo.
english: During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

pwn: poita, podrosa, potjelo, aza salasaladj pokaoi a pasedjam ta nemanga tjaimadjo.
english: Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

pwn: izoa damidami a kakodan nimadjo, ro kisedjam ta nemanga sa ika pacikel anga.
english: But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

pwn: kavililjanga a mapoljat ika sa pasedjam ta nemanga tjaimadjo.
english: In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

pwn: izoa to ita qadaw, na maciol amen vaik a kivanvan.
english: One day, we all went on an outing together.

pwn: ka i kadjalanan, sa mabinzio ti kapi, ljakoa madraodraw kemaco timadjo ta sidjoadjoas.
english: On the way, Kapi wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

pwn: na kisedjam timadjo ta salasaladj ta sidjoadjoas, ljakoa maitoco temevela a mapoljat tjaimadjo, ika nakemaco a ken taota.
english: He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn't bring them either.

pwn: ti kapi qemaoqaong ta latjakan, matjalaw timadjo qivo, akomaya ika no pasedjaman na ken ta sidjoadjoas!
english: Kapi burst into tears. He said angrily, why don't everyone lend me toilet paper!

pwn: tjomaljang na salasaladj timadjo, lja ika son na rokacot, saka no pasedjaman son ta nemanga, ika son na pacikel.
english: The classmate told him, because you didn't bring it yourself, and you wouldn't return the things lent to you!

pwn: kamaljia magako, medjama sema gako ti kapi, aza kinisedjam ta salasaladj a nemanga pinacikel anga penoljat ta dokiosi.
english: The next day at school, Kapi arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.
